 = = In popular culture = = 
 
 
 = = = Fictional charac[MASK]ers = = = 
[MASK]
 Cullen Bohannon , the protagonist of the AMC series Hell [MASK]n Wheels , hails from Meridian , Mississippi , where he was a tobacco farmer and later a Confederate soldier during the American Civil War . 
 Dill[MASK]Har[MASK]is , one of the characters of the Pulitzer Prize @-@ winning novel To Kill [MASK] Mockingbird ( 1960 ) , is from Merid[MASK]a[MASK] , which is mentioned throughout when referencing Dill 's h[MASK]me . 
 
 
 = Papa Stour = 
 
 Papa [MASK]tour is one of the Shetland Islands in Scotland , with a population of under twenty peopl[MASK][MASK], some of whom immigrated a[MASK]ter an appeal for residents in the 1970s . Located to the west of mainland Shetland[MASK]and with an area of 828 hectares ( 3 @.@ 2 square miles ) , Papa Stour is the eighth larg[MASK]st island in Shetland . Erosion of the soft volcanic rocks by the sea has created an extraordinary v[MASK]riety of caves , stacks , arches , blowholes , and cliffs . [MASK][MASK]e island and its surrounding seas harbour diverse populations of wildlife . The west side of the island is a Site of Special Sci[MASK]ntific Interest and the seas around the island are a Special Area of Con[MASK]ervation .[MASK]
 The isl[MASK]nd has several Neolithic burial chamber sites , as well as the remains of Duke Hakon 's 13th @-@ century house dating from the Norse occupati[MASK]n of the island . The population reached 380 or more in the nineteenth century , when a fis[MASK]i[MASK]g station was opened at Crabbaberry in West Voe . Subsequently there was a steady decl[MASK]ne in population , although the numbers have increased from a low of 16 in the 1970s . 
 Today the main settlement on th[MASK] island is Biggings , just to the east of which is Housa Voe from where the Snolda ferr[MASK] arrives from its ba[MASK]e[MASK]at West Burrafirth on the Shetlan[MASK] Mainland . Crofting , especially she[MASK]p rearing , is the mainstay [MASK]f island life . 
 N[MASK]merous shipwrecks have occ[MASK]rred around the coast , and the celebrated [MASK]oem Da Sang o da Papa Men by V[MASK]galand recalls the drama of t[MASK]e days when Papa Stour was a centre for deep @-@ sea fishing . 
 
 = = Geography [MASK] = 
 
 Papa Stour is located at the sou[MASK]h western end of St Magnus Bay . There [MASK]re 34 k[MASK]lometres ( 21 mi ) of rugged coastline which is in[MASK]ented by numerous small embayments and four larger ' voes ' . Hamna Voe ( Old Norse : ' harbour ba[MASK] ' ) in the south is the most[MASK]sheltered anchorage and the surrounding cliffs contain a natural rock arch . Housa Voe to the east ( Old Norse : ' house ba[MASK] ' ) is less secluded but is the main harbour for the island and the ferry 's [MASK]mbarkation point . 
 Brei Holm and[MASK]Maiden Stack guard the harbour entrance to[MASK]the south . The former is a tidal island a[MASK]d was a leper colony until the 18th century ( although it has been suggested that many of the " lepers " there were suffering from a vitamin deficiency rather [MASK]han leprosy ) . The latter 's name rela[MASK]es to a[MASK]story from the 14th century . Lord Thorvald Thoresson is said to have constructed the tiny house at its top , whose ruins are still visible , in order to " preserve " his daughter from men . Unfortunately for his plans , when she left she was found to be preg[MASK]ant ; in another version of the story , she and her fisherman sweetheart successfully eloped . West Voe , t[MASK]e inner part of which[MASK]is called ' Robies Nous[MASK] ' is the main voe in the north coast , the[MASK]smaller Cu[MASK]la Voe lying immediately to the west . 
 The main settlement on the island today[MASK]is [MASK]ig[MASK]ings , which overlooks Housa Voe and is surrounded by in @-@[MASK]bye land to the east of the hill dyke [MASK] which runs south from West Voe ) . To the west the island is bisected by a belt of glacial moraine about one and a half kilometres in length . Much of the rest of the area consists of a shallow stony soil that may be derive[MASK] from gl[MASK]cial till . There is an almost[MASK]complete absence of peat on the island and [MASK]ue to the volcanic rocks the soils are relatively fertile . The lack of peat led [MASK]o ' turf scalping ' for[MASK]fuel and the bare areas of rock in [MASK]he[MASK][MASK]nterior . 
 The h[MASK]ghest point on the island is in the north west at Virda Field [MASK] which rises to 87 [MASK]etres ( 285 feet ) . Virda is possibly from the Old Norse for ' heap of stones ' . 
 
 = = = List of outliers = = = 
 
 In addition to the larger islets mentioned above ther[MASK] are vario[MASK]s other i[MASK]les and skerries around the coast of Papa Stour . They include : Aesha Stack , Boinna Skerry , Borse Skerry , Fogla Skerry , Forewick Holm , Galti Stacks , Ho[MASK]m o[MASK] Melby , Koda Skerry , Lyra Skerry , Skerries of Quidaness , Skerry of Lambaness , Sula Stack , Swat S[MASK]erry , The Horn , Tip[MASK]ans Skerry and Wilma Skerry . The Ve Skerries [MASK]ie 5 kilomet[MASK]es ( 3 @.@ 1 mi ) to the north wes[MASK] [MASK] Th[MASK]y include : Helliogoblo[MASK], North Skerry , Ormal , Reaverack and [MASK]he[MASK]C[MASK]ubb . In between Papa [MASK]tour and Ve[MASK]Skerries l[MASK]es the shallow bank of Papa @-@[MASK]rof . 
 On 21 June 2008 , Stu[MASK]rt Hill , the owner and only resident of the 1 hectare ( 2 @.@ 5 acres ) island o[MASK] Forewick Ho[MASK]m ( which he has renamed " Forvik Island " ) made a declaration of dependence , crea[MASK]ing the Crown Dependency of Forvik . On the basis of a marriage arrangement between King Ch[MASK]istian of Norway and King James III of Scotland that d[MASK]tes to 1468 , Hill argued that the i[MASK]land should be considered a British crown dependency , and thus not a part of the United Kingdom or of the European Union . This cla[MASK]m was not rec[MASK]gnised by the United Kingdom . 
 
 = = Geology = = 
 
 The island [MASK]s c[MASK]mpo[MASK]ed of a variety of volcanic and sedimentary rock [MASK]o[MASK]mations from the Devonian period . At that time the Scottish landmas[MASK] formed part of the Old Red Sandstone Continent and lay [MASK]ome 10 @-@ 25 degrees south of the equator . The accumul[MASK]t[MASK]ons of Old Red Sandstone , laid down from 408[MASK]to 370 million years ago , were creat[MASK]d as earlier Silurian [MASK]ocks , uplifted by th[MASK] formation of Pangaea , eroded and then were depo[MASK]ited into river deltas . The freshwater Lake Orcadie existed on the edges of the ero[MASK]ing mountains , stret[MASK]hing from Shetland to the southern Moray Firth . The str[MASK]cture of Papa Stour is largely made up of ashes and la[MASK]as from vol[MASK]ani[MASK] activity associated with this period , including ban[MASK]s of solidified volcanic ash and lava ( rhyolite ) , but there is also a Devonia[MASK] fish bed at Lamba Bank[MASK] . There are numerous large boulders deposited by Plei[MASK]tocene glaciation . 
 E[MASK]osion of the soft volcanic rocks by[MASK]the sea ha[MASK] created an extraordinary variety of caves , stacks , arches [MASK] blowholes , cliffs , voes and geo[MASK] that are amongst the finest in Britain .[MASK]The ' Holl o Boardie ' is a cave that passes right through the[MASK]north @-@ west tip of the island . It is nearly half a mile long and wide enough to row through . Kirstan ( or Christie 's ) Hole in the sou[MASK]h west is another spectacu[MASK]ar cave , part of the roof of which collapsed in 1981 . Yet anot[MASK]er is ' Francie 's Hole ' close to Hamna Voe in the west . This was the [MASK]avourite of John Tudor who wrote of the island in his Victorian memoirs and described the cave as : 
 ... in fairyland , so exquisite is the colouring of the roof and sides and so pellucid is the water ... [ w[MASK]th ] al[MASK]oves or recesses like stal[MASK]s in [MASK] church . 
 In 1953 the spectacular headland , [MASK] Da Horn o Papa ' fell into the sea during a storm . The nearby islet of Brei [MASK]olm also h[MASK]s caves that can[MASK]be accessed by sma[MASK]l boats when conditions permit . 
 [MASK] = = Ecology = = 
 
 Otter[MASK] , grey seals , killer whales and harbour porpoises are frequently seen on and a[MASK]ound Papa Stour . Atlantic puffin , Arctic and common tern , bonxie and Arctic skua[MASK][MASK] northern ful[MASK]ar , common guillemot , razorbill , curlew , wheatear , ringed plover and great black @-@ backed gull all breed on the island , and numerous migratory species have been recorded . 
 There is a pr[MASK]fusion of wil[MASK] flowers , including moun[MASK]ain [MASK]verlasting , spri[MASK]g squill and eyebright as well as the ubiquitous h[MASK]ather . The w[MASK]st side of the island is a Site of Special Scientific Interest and the seas around Papa Stour are a Special Area of Conservation . The traditio[MASK]al Shetland Pony is still br[MASK]d . 
 
 = = History and archaeology = = 
 
 Human settlement of the island dates from circa 3000 BC and there are [MASK]emains of several Neolithic burial chambers known as ' heel @-@ shaped cairns ' . L[MASK]ttle is known of the pre @-@ Celtic and Celtic eras , but when the Norse arrive[MASK] it is likely they found a religious settlement as the name of the island derives from Papey S[MASK]ó[MASK]a meaning " Big is[MASK]and of the Papar " ( Celtic monks ) , in distinction to Papa Little some 12 kilomet[MASK]es ( 7 @.@ 5 mi ) to the west [MASK] 
 
 = = = Norse period[MASK]= = = 
 
 Papa Stour is the subject of a 1299 manusc[MASK]ipt written in Old [MASK]orse , which is the oldest[MASK]surviving documen[MASK] from Shetland . It [MASK]eals[MASK]with a dramatic incident i[MASK] the house of Duke Hakon Magnusson , who was later to become King Hakon V of Norway . There is a circle of sto[MASK]es near the beach at Housa Voe , which are the remains of a ' ting ' , or local assembly . This was the scene of a duel , fought and won by Lord Thorvald Thoresson , who w[MASK]s accused of corrup[MASK]ion [MASK]n the 129[MASK] document and was later called ‘ dominus de Papay ’ . ( The story[MASK]of his unfortunate[MASK]daughter is referred to abov[MASK] . ) The remains of Duke Hakon 's thirteenth @-@ century hou[MASK]e [MASK]re still visible ne[MASK]r Housa Voe . 
 
 = = = Scot[MASK] rule and fishing = = = 
 
 In 1469 Shetland c[MASK]me under nominal Scottish control , although t[MASK]e Norse ' Lairds of Norway ' kept their Papa Stour e[MASK]tat[MASK]s until the 17th century . In the[MASK]16th century merchants from Bremen and Hamburg were operating a summer trading booth to buy fis[MASK] from the local fleet . By the 18th century , two Scottish lairds , Thomas Gifford of Busta , [MASK]nd Arthur Nicolson of Lerwick , owned the island . They maintained a prosperous Haaf ( Old Norse : ' deep sea ' ) fishing industry , undertaken in the summer months using six @-@ oared boats known as sixareens . [MASK] In addition [MASK]o the leper colony on Brei Holm there may have been another at Hilla Fielle overlooking Ha[MASK]na [MASK]oe . A recent ar[MASK]haeological survey was incon[MASK]lusive but suggests [MASK]he site may be much older than the supposed 18th century colony . 
 The island church , which overlooks Kirk Sand in the bay of Fore Wick , was founded in 1806 .[MASK]300 me[MASK]res from the p[MASK]esent church there may be an older[MASK]chapel site [MASK]f Sneeans or Snøyans [MASK]n the headland between the west end of Kirk Sand and the bay of Tusselby . It is called the ' ald kirk ' by local[MASK] an[MASK] referred to by the Ordnance Survey as " the site of a Romish chapel belong[MASK]ng to abo[MASK]t the twelfth century " . There is a tradition [MASK]hat the work there was interfered [MASK]ith [MASK]y supernatural powers and th[MASK]t each day 's work on the buildin[MASK] was destroyed during th[MASK] night . Eventually the cornerstones were moved over[MASK]ight by these unea[MASK]thly agencies to the[MASK]present site of the church and work was re @-@ commenced there successfully . Ex[MASK]avations in 2[MASK]04 found little besides large blocks of rhyolite and a piece of wha[MASK]ebone rib , suggesting that the oral tradition may ha[MASK]e some truth to it . 
 In the 19th ce[MASK]tury the Crabbaberry fi[MASK]hing station in West Voe was opened and the island[MASK]had a population of 360 p[MASK]ople or more . However , fuel shortages and a decline in fishing due to the introduction of steam drifters saw a fall in population fr[MASK]m the 1870s on . At this time another duel entered the history of Papa Stour [MASK] Edwin Lindsay , an Indian army officer and the son of the 6th Earl of Balcarres [MASK] was declared insane and sent to the island in disgrace after refusing to fight in one . He spent[MASK]26 years as a prisoner before the Quaker preacher Catherine Watson arranged for his rele[MASK]se in 1835 . Lindsay 's Well is a spring [MASK]t the south of the island wh[MASK]re he was allowed to bathe . 
 There are good exampl[MASK]s of horizontal water m[MASK]lls , a[MASK]so[MASK]known as Norse or Clack Mills , around Du[MASK]ch L[MASK]ch . Originally [MASK]hese were two stor[MASK] bui[MASK]dings with turf roof[MASK] , built into banks to give acc[MASK]ss to the upper floor where the mill @-@ stone was sited . Inside the building there was a fixed lowe[MASK] millstone , and a rotating upper millstone driven by the water falling onto the pad[MASK]les below .[MASK]Some were still in use on Papa Stour in the early years [MASK]f the 20th century , and[MASK]there is still a working example of one of these mills on the Burn of Clumlie , at Troswick in the south Mai[MASK]land of Shetland . 
 
 = = = 20th and 2[MASK]st centuries = = = 
 
 In common with many sma[MASK]l Scottish islands , Papa Stour 's population peaked in the 19th century and has experienced a significant decline since then ( see e.g. Mingulay ) . By 1970 the island school had closed and the [MASK]opulation had declined to sixteen ' fairly[MASK]elderly ' residents , but an advertisement [MASK]n Exchange and Mart reversed the decline . A croft and [MASK][MASK]ve sheep were offered free of charge to[MASK]incomers which brought a flood of a[MASK]plic[MASK]nts . By 1981 t[MASK]e census recorded a population of 33 . However , by 2005 the population had fallen to 20 after serious discord b[MASK]tween islanders[MASK]led to several court cases . A number of people left the island and[MASK]the school[MASK]closed . By early 2008 the population had dropped to just nine after a family of seven l[MASK]ft .[MASK]The 2011 census recorded a usually resident population of 15 - during the decade 2011 @-@ 11 Scottish island populations as a whole grew by 4 % to 103 @,@ 702 . 
 Overview of population trends 
 
 = = = Shipwrecks [MASK] = = 
 
 Th[MASK] coasts around Papa Stour have claimed numerous w[MASK]ecks . In Hamnavoe , Tiptan[MASK] Skerry alone has sunk Dutch , French , German and[MASK]Norwegian ships . 
 The Aberde[MASK]n trawler Ben Doran A178 , foundered on the Ve Skerries 3 mi[MASK]es northwest of Papa Stour , on the evening of 28 March 1930 while on her way to the village of Scalloway to land her catch . When she grounded weather[MASK]conditions were[MASK]fairly good but it was not until the followin[MASK] day that a passing [MASK]rawler saw , and reported the wreck . By the time that various rescue attempts were launched b[MASK] the coastguard and local voluntee[MASK]s ( there being no lifeboat in Shetland at [MASK]hat time ) , weather conditions had deteriorated to the point where it was imposs[MASK]ble to approach the skerries . A request had been made for the Stromness [MASK]ifeboat from Orkney , only 12[MASK] mil[MASK]s[MASK]away , to launch , but the [MASK]equest was made too late to be of help . All 9 crew perished in the wreck . Only 3 bodi[MASK]s were recovered , that of James Mitchell , which was returned to Aberdeen , and the bodies of J. Cormack an[MASK] J.R. Insh , which were buried in Scalloway . [MASK] The cargo ship SS Highcliffe ran aground in fog on Forewick Holm in February 1940 . On this occasion the conditions were clement and only the ship a[MASK]d cargo were lost[MASK]. In 1967 the Aberdeen trawler Juniper ran [MASK]ground in Lyra Sound[MASK]at the bottom of the 60 metres ( 200 feet ) cliffs . The 12 man crew were rescued by the Aith lifeboat , the coxswain being awarded the RNL[MASK] silver medal for this rescue . 
 Papa Stour 's most re[MASK]en[MASK] shipwreck occurred on 9 December 1977 when th[MASK] Aberdeen trawler Elinor Viking A278 , skipper Alec Flett [MASK] foundered on the Ve Skerries . The Aith Lifeboa[MASK] came to the s[MASK]ene but was unable to[MASK]g[MASK]t near enough to rescue the crew [MASK]ec[MASK]u[MASK]e of the sea c[MASK]nditions . At the request of Alec Webster , Coastguard Station Officer , Lerwick ,[MASK]a volunteer crew in a British Airways Sikorsky S61N helicopter from Sumbu[MASK]gh Airport was s[MASK]rambled . They managed to winch all the boat 's crew to safety within hours of the grounding , despite the storm force winds . The helicopter cre[MASK] later received a number of awards for bravery . There was no loss of life , but this incident prompted the building of a lighthouse on [MASK]he skerries in 1979 , a[MASK]d may also have been[MASK]the example required [MASK]or the formation of the pr[MASK]sent Search and Rescue[MASK]helicopter unit , based at Sumburgh Airport . 
 
 = = Economy & Transport = = 
 
 Crofting is the mainstay of island life . Sheep form the backbo[MASK]e of the agricultura[MASK] econ[MASK]my but a diversity livestock are kept , including c[MASK]ttle , pigs , goats , chickens , ducks and geese . Vegetable are grown too ,[MASK]oft[MASK]n in the shelter of circular[MASK]walls , such plots being known as ' plantie scrubs ' . Fishing is still conducted but on a relatively small scale . There is a post office at the pier , but no shop . Mains electri[MASK]ity only came to the island at the close of the twentieth ce[MASK]tury . The Papa Stour Project is a Christian supported housing service offering accommodation to men with drug and alcoho[MASK] issues . Ferr[MASK]es now sail[MASK]across the [MASK]ound of Pa[MASK]a to West Burrafirth on the Shetland Mainland . The crossi[MASK]g takes 45 minutes , and although[MASK][MASK]he Snolda carries cars [MASK] there is only one short road on the island.For visiting ya[MASK]hts the four main voes provide good shelter , but the strong tid[MASK]s in both the Sound of Papa [MASK]nd to the north west require [MASK]onside[MASK]able care . 
 
 = [MASK] = Airstrip = = = 
 
 There is an airstrip which caters for r[MASK]gular flights from Tingwall . 
 
 = = Culture and the arts = = 
 
 The Papa Stour sword dance may be of Norse origin and bears[MASK]simil[MASK]rities to the long sword dance of [MASK]he n[MASK]rth east [MASK]f England . A description of the dance appears in The Pi[MASK]ate by Sir Walter Scott . 
 The write[MASK] and journalist John Sands lived o[MASK] Papa Stour and Foula for a while during the late nineteenth century . The writer , folklorist and musician , George P.[MASK]S. Peterson was brought up on Papa Stour . 
 It is also the ' Papa ' of Vagaland[MASK]'s poem Da Sang o da Papa men , no[MASK] adopted as part of the folksong tradition , as set to music by T.M.Y. Manson[MASK]. Th[MASK] insistent chorus chant , ' Rowin Foula Doon ! ' , is particularly striking . 
 " Oot bew[MASK]st da Horn o Papa , 
 Rowi[MASK] Foula doon ! 
 Owir a hidden piece o water , 
 Rowin Foula doon ! 
 Roond da boat da tide @-@ lumps makkin , 
 Sunlicht trowe da cloods is[MASK]brakkin ;[MASK]
 We [MASK]aan geng whaar fish is takkin , 
 Rowin Foula doon ! " 
 " Rowin Foula doo[MASK] ! " refers to the fishermens ' practice of rowing their open fishing boat out to sea until the high clif[MASK]s of Foula were no longer visible . This entaile[MASK] the boat be[MASK]ng some 96[MASK]kilometres ( 60 mi ) west of Papa Stour . The ' tide @-@ lumps ' are increased swells of unusual size due to the c[MASK]mbined action of wind against tide . The res[MASK]nant final image of the piece is of the fishermen being led back home [MASK]o Papa by the ' scent o flooers ' across the water . This is an example o[MASK] Va[MASK]aland 's ability to create a vivid sensual impression of a situatio[MASK] . An extra layer of meaning [MASK]s added by the knowledge that Da Horn o Papa collapsed in a storm around the time [MASK]f this poem 's composition , so that it is a tribute not just t[MASK] a lost way of life , but a noted geographical fea[MASK]ure . 
 
 
 = Angel of Death ( Slayer song ) = 
 
 " Angel of Death " is the opening track on the Am[MASK]rican thrash metal band Slayer 's 1986 album Reign in Blood . The lyrics[MASK]and music were written by Slayer guitarist , Jeff Hanneman and a[MASK]e based on Nazi physician Josef M[MASK]ngele , who conducted human experiments at the Auschwitz concentration camp during World War II . " Angel of Death " led to the band facing accusations of Nazi sympathizing and racism throughout their career . 
 Desp[MASK]te th[MASK] con[MASK]rove[MASK]sy surrounding the song and its contribution to the delay in the release of Reig[MASK] in Blood , " Angel of Death " is featured on all of Slayer 's live albums and DVDs and has appeared in several movies . The song was well received [MASK]y critics ; Steve Huey of AllMusic de[MASK]cribed it as a " classic " . 
[MASK]
 = = Composition and origins = = 
 
 Slayer guitarist Jeff Hanneman wrote " Angel of Death " [MASK]fter reading[MASK]books [MASK]bout Nazi physician Josef Mengele while on tour with the band : " I remember stopping someplace where I bought two books on M[MASK]ngele . I thought , ' This has gotta be some sick[MASK]shit . ' So when it came time to do the record , that stuff was still in my head — that 's where the lyrics to ' Angel of Death ' came from . "[MASK]
 The lyrics detail Menge[MASK]e 's surgical e[MASK]periments on patients at the Auschwitz concentration camp during World War II . Mengele 's explorations were conducted on such groups as dwarfs and twins , and included[MASK]both physical and psyc[MASK][MASK]logical e[MASK]am[MASK]natio[MASK]s . Among the tests he performed that are mention[MASK]d in " Angel of Death " are experimental surgeries[MASK]performed without anesthesia , transfusion of blood between twins , isolation endurance , gassing [MASK] injecti[MASK]ns with lethal germs , sex change operations , the removal of organs and limbs , and [MASK]bacination . 
 " Sewn together ,[MASK]joining heads . Just a matter of time ' til you rip yourselves apart " , a line from the penultimate verse , is a reference to the allegation Mengele stitched together twins , one o[MASK] t[MASK]em deformed ; " the hunchback was sewn to the other child , back to ba[MASK]k , their wrists back to bac[MASK] too . " This claim was first made by Auschwitz sur[MASK]i[MASK]or V[MASK]ra Alexan[MASK]er at the 1961 trial of SS @-@ Hauptscharführer Adolf Eichmann the " ar[MASK]hitect of the Holocaust " , where it was asserted that Mengele [MASK] sewed the v[MASK]ins to[MASK]e[MASK]her " and turned " them i[MASK]to Siamese twins . " This allegation became more widely known when Vera Alexander[MASK]was featured in the 1985 documentary The Search for Mengele , which has been cited by several authors incl[MASK]ding Gerald P[MASK]sner , an expert on Mengele . 
 Towards the end of [MASK]he song , there is a line " Feeding off the screams of the mutants he 's creating " , which was taken from the film Th[MASK] Boys from Braz[MASK]l in which Dr. Mengele was the villain [MASK] 
 
[MASK]= = Controversy = = 
 
 [MASK]he lyrical content of " Angel of Death " contributed to the delay of the release of Slayer 's 1986 album Reign in Blood . The band were sign[MASK]d to Def Jam [MASK]ecords whose dis[MASK]ributor , Columbia Records , refused to release the album due to lyrical themes and artwork concerns , deeming the artwork " too graphic " . Reign in Blood was eventually distributed by Geffen Records on October 7 , 1986 . Howev[MASK]r , due to the controversy , Reign in Blood did not appear on Geffe[MASK] Records official release schedule . 
 " Angel of Death " caused outrage among survivors of the Holocaust , as well as the[MASK]r famil[MASK]es and the general public[MASK]. The co[MASK]troversy led to a[MASK]cusations [MASK]f[MASK]Naz[MASK] sympathizing which have followed Slayer throughout their car[MASK]er . People took Hanneman 's interest i[MASK][MASK]Nazi history and his collection[MASK]of Nazi medals as evidence of sympathizing – his most prized item [MASK]eing a German Knight 's Cross . Hanneman counteracted asserting : 
 " I know why people misinterp[MASK]et it – it 's be[MASK]ause they get this knee – jerk reaction to it . W[MASK]en they read the lyrics , there 's nothin[MASK] I put in the lyrics that says necessarily he was a bad man , because to me – well , isn 't that obvious ? I shouldn 't have[MASK]to tell you that . " 
 According to guitarist Kerry King : " Yeah , ' Slayer are Nazis , fasc[MASK]sts , communists ' — all that fun shit . And of course we got the most flak for it in Ger[MASK]any . I w[MASK]s always [MASK]ike , ' Read the lyrics and tell me what 's offensive about it . Can you see it as a documentary , or do you thi[MASK]k Slayer 's preachin[MASK] fucking Wor[MASK][MASK] War II ? ' Peop[MASK]e get this thought in their heads — especially in Europe — and you[MASK]'ll never talk them out of it . " 
 [MASK]he song drew [MASK]ccusations of racism , which the band has denied . [MASK]he band members are often asked about the accusations in interviews , and h[MASK]ve stated numerous times that they do not condone racism an[MASK] are merely interested in the subject . 
 In 2006 , the song " Jihad " from Slayer 's 2006 album Christ Illusion drew comparison to " Angel of Death " . " Jiha[MASK] " deals with the September 11 , 2001 , attacks[MASK], and tells the story from a terro[MASK]ist 's perspective . Vocalist Araya was expecting the subject matter to create a similar backlash to that of " Angel of Death " , a[MASK]though it did not m[MASK]te[MASK]ialise , in part , he believes ,[MASK]due to peoples ' view t[MASK]at the song is " just Slaye[MASK] being Slayer " . 
 
 = = Music [MASK]nd structure = = 
 
 " Angel of Death " is the longest [MASK]rack on the album Rei[MASK]n in Blood , spanning 4 minutes a[MASK]d 51 seconds , where the to[MASK]al duration of the album is 29 minutes . Additionally , it[MASK]has one of the most conventional song structures on th[MASK] album , featu[MASK]ing prominent verses and choruses , where most tracks on the album eschew them . Hanneman and King deliver their ' intricate riffs ' , which offer the few hints of me[MASK]ody on the album according to PopMatters reviewer Adrien Begrand , a[MASK]d Araya bursts out his piercing scream , with Lombardo performing beats of 210 beats per minute . 
 When drummer Lombardo left Slayer[MASK]in 1992 , the band hired a full [MASK]-@ time replac[MASK]ment in Forbi[MASK]den drummer P[MASK]ul Bostaph . Bostaph made one mistake out o[MASK] the nine songs the band trialled him with , on " Angel of Death " . B[MASK]fore the " big double bass part " there is a lead section , whi[MASK]h Bostaph could not understand [MASK] as he had to learn from live records recorded with Lombardo . Bostaph could no[MASK] tell how many revo[MASK]utions the guitar riff goes before the bass sequence . The band me[MASK]bers told him there we[MASK]e eight , " perfecting[MASK]" [MASK]he song afterwards . 
 
 = = Recepti[MASK]n = = 
 
 Although " Angel of Death " did not enter any charts , it received strong praise from critics in reviews for Reign in Blo[MASK]d . C[MASK]ay Jarvas of Stylus Magazine noted that the song " smokes t[MASK]e asses of any band playing fast and / or[MASK]heavy today . Lyrically outlining the horrors to come , while musically laying the groundwo[MASK]k[MASK]for the rest of the record : fast , le[MASK]n and filthy . " 
 Adrien Begrand of PopMatters remarked that " There '[MASK] no better song to kick things off than the masterful [MASK] Ange[MASK] of Death ' , one o[MASK] the most monumental songs in[MASK]metal history , where guitarists Kerry King and Jeff [MASK]anneman deliver [MASK]h[MASK]ir intricate riffs , d[MASK]ummer Dave Lombardo performs some o[MASK] [MASK]he most powerful drumming ever recorded , and bassist / vocalist Tom Araya screams and snarls his tale[MASK]of Nazi war crimi[MASK]al Josef Mengele . " 
 Capitalizing on the publicity generated by the controv[MASK]r[MASK]y , the b[MASK]nd utilized Nazi [MASK]magery by a[MASK]apting a logo to one similar to the eagle atop swastika , during th[MASK] Seasons in the Abyss period . Hanneman placed SS stickers on his guitar[MASK], and wrote " SS @-@ 3[MASK]" a song about Reinh[MASK]rd Heydrich , the second in command in[MASK]the Schutzstaffel organizat[MASK]on .

 = Calvin McCarty = 
[MASK]
 Calvin McCarty ( born November 2 , 1984 ) is a Canadian football runnin[MASK] back for the Edmonton Eskimos of the Canadian Football League ( CFL ) . He played as a tailback until 2014 , when he became [MASK]he starting fullback for[MASK]th[MASK] Eskimos . McCarty is[MASK][MASK]nown for being able [MASK]o fill many roles at his position , with TSN sportscaster Chris Schultz noting in 2010 that he is[MASK]a " multi @-[MASK] [MASK]urpose running back who catches the ball extremely well ,[MASK]blocks well and runs well " . He is a cham[MASK]ion of the 103rd Grey Cup . 
 Prior to being drafted by the[MASK]Edmonton Eskimo[MASK] in the fourth round of the 2007 CFL Draft , McCarty pla[MASK]ed high s[MASK]hool footbal[MASK] for the St. Thomas More Knights , where he broke multiple school records . He later play[MASK]d college football for the Western Washington Vikings . With the Vikings , McCarty developed [MASK]nto a dual threat , being used heavily as a rusher and receiver . McCarty has [MASK]pent his entire p[MASK]ofessional career with the Edmonton Eskimos , making him th[MASK] most veteran player on the te[MASK]m as of the 2015 season . 
 
 = = High school career = = 
 
 McCarty pla[MASK]ed[MASK]high school football for th[MASK] St. Thomas More Knights in Burn[MASK]by , British[MASK]Columbia beginning in 1998 , playing as both a running back and middle linebacker on the Grade 8 team . H[MASK] quickly became a key player on the team , including rushing for 185 yards and four touchdowns while adding 10 defensive tackles in the[MASK]Grade 8 provincial semi @-@ finals on November 24 against the Hand[MASK]worth R[MASK]yals . For [MASK]hat perf[MASK]rmance , he was named " Star of the Week " by The Vancouver [MASK]un . The Knights went on to defeat [MASK][MASK]e Vancouver College Fighting Irish 48 – 0 in the Grade 8 B.C. championship gam[MASK] , where McC[MASK]rty scored anoth[MASK]r three to[MASK]chdowns . 
 The following year , McCarty joined th[MASK] senior team at St. Thomas More , [MASK]kipping the junior team entirely . He continued in his role as a running back while switching to the secondary defensively . Despite being a rare Grad[MASK] 9 player on the senior team , he was one of the Knights ' two leading rushers that year . McCarty scored a touchdow[MASK] in the[MASK]AAA B.C. championship game , helping the Knights win thei[MASK] firs[MASK] senior title as they bea[MASK][MASK]the Pinetree T @-@[MASK]Wolves 29 – 6 . While K.C. Ste[MASK]le , the Knights [MASK] coach , [MASK]as a policy [MASK]f not recording player statistics , it is estimated that McCarty f[MASK]nished 1999 w[MASK]th over 1 @,@ 000 rushing yards and 15 touchdo[MASK]n[MASK] . 
 In 2000 , McCarty played a signif[MASK]cant role in the Knights ' rushing and return game . He rushed for 150 yards and three touchdowns against the Burnaby Central Wildcats in t[MASK]e annual Burnaby Bowl [MASK] adding two punt returns f[MASK]r touchdowns . By the end of October , the K[MASK]ights had compiled a perfect 6 – 0 rec[MASK]rd , and defensive coordinator and[MASK]former CFL defensive back Lou Deslauriers called McC[MASK]rty " the best player for his age and[MASK]talent that we 've ever had at our schoo[MASK] " . He [MASK]ecorded 238 yards and fo[MASK]r consecutive touchdowns with only 23 carries in the Knight[MASK] ' 46 – 12 victory [MASK]ver the W. J. Mouat Hawks in the[MASK]AAA championship game . For his [MASK]ole in earning t[MASK]e Knights their second AAA title , M[MASK]Carty was named the game 's MVP , bec[MASK]ming the youngest player to earn this award . 
 McCarty remained a presence on the field for the Knights in 2001 , expanding[MASK]his role by playing some snaps as a fullback . He rushed for 160 yards in that ye[MASK]r 's Burna[MASK]y Bowl , including three touchdowns[MASK]as a halfback and one as a fullback . McCarty had another notable performance in a 67 – 7 blowout against the South Delta Sun Devils , running for 200 yards and three touchdowns . He also showed himself to be a capable receiver , including making five catches for[MASK]66 yard[MASK] in a matc[MASK] against the Holy Cross Crusaders . McCarty also [MASK]inished that game with 110 yards and two touchdowns on only three carries . Despite giving up only 19 points during the entire regular season , the Knights lost 32 – 26 in the quarter @-@ finals of the playoffs against the Centennial Centaurs after McCarty was stopped one [MASK]ard away from the endzone on the last play of the game . 
 As a senior , McCarty recorded 2 @,@ 400 yards and scored 33 touchdowns i[MASK] just nine games , averaging 266 @.@ 7 yards an[MASK] over three touchdowns per game . He ran for 380 yards and three touchdowns in a 21 – 20 loss against the W. J. Mouat Hawks in the quarter @-@ fin[MASK]ls of the AAA playoffs . He was named th[MASK] 2002 [MASK]rovincial Player of [MASK]he Year for his performance and finished his four @-@ year AAA career at St. Thomas More with 84 touchdowns , breaking a sc[MASK]ool record . 
 
 = = [MASK] Other sports = = = 
 
 McCarty playe[MASK] basketball and b[MASK]seball during high school as well . He lettered in basketball with the Knig[MASK]ts . At the 2001 Big League World Series , McCarty played for Team Canada as a shortstop and center fie[MASK]der , helping the team to third [MASK]lace in the internation[MASK]l competition . Despite being skille[MASK] as a baseball player , McCarty chose footb[MASK]ll [MASK]ver professional baseball due to the physicality of the former sport .

 = = Personal life = = 
 
 McCarty grew up i[MASK] Muskogee , Oklahoma . After his mother , Jackie Conway , was unable to financially support him , McCarty moved to Canada and lived [MASK]ith his father , Orl[MASK]ndo McCarty . 
 His mother was a college softball player for [MASK]he NEO Lady Norse , while his fat[MASK]er was a co[MASK]lege b[MASK]sketball player for the Bacone W[MASK]rriors and[MASK][MASK]he Southeastern Okla[MASK]oma State Sa[MASK]age[MASK]Storm . McCarty 's siblings were also college athletes ; Tiffany played softball for the McPherson Bulldogs while Jordan was a quarterback with the Reedley Tigers . 
 
 
 = Hurricane Beatriz ( 2011 ) = 
 
 Hurricane Beatriz wa[MASK] a Category 1 hu[MASK]ricane that kil[MASK]ed four people after brushing the western c[MASK]ast of Mexico in June 2011 . Originating from an area of disturbed weather on June 19 , several hundred miles south of Mexico , Beatriz gradually intensified . Gain[MASK]ng latitude , the system became increasingly organized and reached hurricane status on the evening of June 20 . The following morning , Beatriz attained winds of 90 mph ( 150 km / h )[MASK]as i[MASK] passed roughly 15 mi ( 20 km )[MASK]of Mexico . Due to its interaction w[MASK]th land , the hurricane abruptly weakened hours [MASK]ater . Early on June 22 , Be[MASK]triz dissipated over open waters . Prior to Beatriz 's arri[MASK]a[MASK] [MASK]n Mexico , hurricane [MASK]atches and warnings were issued for coastal areas . Hundreds of shelters opened acr[MASK]ss the states[MASK]of Colima[MASK]and Guerr[MASK]ro . Heavy rains from the storm triggered significant flooding along the Sabana River in Acapulco , killing four people . However , the overall effects of Beatriz were limited and the rains were largely benef[MASK]cial in mitigating a severe drought . 
 
 = = Meteoro[MASK]ogical history = = 
 
 On June 16 , 2011 , a [MASK]rough situated off the southern coast of Guatemala showed signs of possible tropical cyclogenesis . Though located within an [MASK]r[MASK]a favoring development , the system re[MASK]ained broad and diso[MASK]ganized as it mo[MASK]ed slowly west @-@ northwes[MASK]ward [MASK] Gradually , convect[MASK]on consolidated around an area of low pressure . On June 18 , a T[MASK]opical Cyclone Formation Alert was issued for the system as [MASK]t was e[MASK]pected to develop into a tropical depression within 24 [MASK]ours . On the following day , the low further developed and was declared Tropical Depression Two @-@ E by the National Hurricane Center at 1500 UTC . Upon being declared , the depression w[MASK]s located about 335 mi ( 540 km ) south @-@ southeast of Lázaro Cárd[MASK]nas , Mexico . However , after post @-@ analysis , the depression had actually developed nine hours earlie[MASK] . Maintaining a west @-@ northwes[MASK]erly track in response to a [MASK]ubtropical ridge to the north , the depression was forecast to move into a favorable environmen[MASK] , characterized by low wind shear and sea surface temperatures up to[MASK]86 ° F ( 30 ° C ) . Three hours after classifica[MASK]ion , the depression strengthened Tropical Storm Beatriz , the second named storm of the season . 
 Early on June 20 , convection increased mar[MASK]edly with several overshooting tops ( deno[MASK][MASK]d by[MASK]cloud @-@ top temperatures be[MASK]ow − 80 ° C ( − 112 ° F ) ) app[MASK]aring on satellite imagery . A notable increase in southerly outflow also took place . As the subtropical r[MASK]dge nor[MASK]h [MASK]f the storm weakened , Beatriz acquired a more norther[MASK]y component to its track , bringing[MASK]the center of the storm closer to Mexico . Convect[MASK]ve bands gradually wrapped around the system throughout the day[MASK]. During the afternoon hours of June 20 , a hu[MASK]ricane hunter aircraft found Beatriz just below hurricane strength[MASK], and subsequently , the system[MASK]was upgraded just a few hours later , wh[MASK]le situate[MASK] roughly 85 mi ( 140 km ) [MASK]outheast of Manzanillo , Mexico . Early [MASK]n June 21 , a[MASK]23 [MASK]o 2[MASK] mi ( 37 to 47[MASK]km ) wide[MASK]eye developed within the central dense overcast . In light of this , the National Hurricane Center esti[MASK]ated [MASK]eat[MASK]iz to have attained winds of 90 mph ( 150 km / h ) along[MASK]with a [MASK]arometric pressure of 977 mbar ( hPa ; 28 @.@ 85 inHg ) ; howe[MASK]er , it was noted that this [MASK]o[MASK]ld be conservative based on estimates of 105 mph ( 165 km / h ) from the University of Wisconsin and the S[MASK]tellit[MASK] Analysis Branch . 
 Throughout [MASK]he morning of June 21 , Beatriz brushed the [MASK]oast of Mexico , with the center passing roughly 15 mi [MASK] 20 km ) south @-@ southeast of La Fortuna , Mexico . Ce[MASK]tered just off the coast of Mexico , the system interacted with land and began weakening . Hours later , convection [MASK]apidly diminished as dry air became entrained in the circulation . In response to quick degradation of the system 's structure , the NHC downgrad[MASK]d Beatriz t[MASK] a tropical storm . Rapid weakening continued throughout the day an[MASK] [MASK]y the evening hours , the storm no longer had a defined circulation . Lacking an organized [MASK]enter and deep convecti[MASK]n , th[MASK] final advisory was issued on Beatriz . The storm 's remnants persisted for several more hours before dissipating roughly 175 mi ( 280 km ) southwest of Cab[MASK][MASK]Corrientes , Mexico . 
 
 = = Prepa[MASK]ations and impact = = 
 
 Following the classification of Tropical D[MASK]pression Two @-@ E on June 19 , the Government of Mexico issued a tropical storm warning for coastal areas between Zihuata[MASK]ejo and Manzanillo . A hurricane watch was also put in place from Tecpán de Galeana to Punta San Telmo . Later that day , the t[MASK]opical st[MASK]rm warning was upgraded to a hurricane warnin[MASK] and the watch was extended westward to La Fortuna . As Beatriz continued to strengthen , the watches [MASK]nd warnings were extended westward to C[MASK]bo Corrientes on June 20 . Early on Ju[MASK]e 21 , the easternmost advisories were discontinued as Beatriz moved away . Later that morning , all watches and warnings we[MASK]e discontinued in light of Beatriz 's rapid weakening . 
 In Colima and Jalisco , residents[MASK]were warned of heavy rains that could trigger flooding and mudslid[MASK]s . School[MASK] across bot[MASK] states cancele[MASK] classes for June 21 . In Colima , 236 shelters were opened to the publ[MASK]c . Additionally , the Mexican Navy[MASK]was plac[MASK]d on[MASK]standby fo[MASK] hurricane[MASK]relief . A total of 980 temporary s[MASK]elters were opened in Guerrero , many of which were in Acapulco , as[MASK]many residents were expected to evacuate fl[MASK]od @-@ prone area . An orange @-@ le[MASK]el alert was issued for portions of Chiapas in light of potentially heavy rains . Throughout Western and Southwe[MASK]tern Mexico , the Servicio Meteorológico Nacional ( National Weather Service ) advised that all air and sea[MASK][MASK]raffic be suspended until the passage of Beatriz . 
 Across Guerrero , Beatriz produced [MASK]eavy rain , p[MASK]aking at 222 @.@ 5 mm ( 8 @.@ 76 in ) in Copala , Guerrero . Several h[MASK]mes across the state were damaged , though none were destroyed . In Acapulco , 380 homes were inundated by flood waters , prompting evacuations in[MASK]areas built in 1999 to relocate residents after Hurricane Pauline . S[MASK]veral landslides blocked off roads and a 100 m ( 330 f[MASK] ) section of a round[MASK]bout was destroyed . In the comm[MASK]nity of Amatillo , three people were kill[MASK]d after being washed away by flood water[MASK] . Heavy rains from Beatriz caused the Sabana River to overflow its banks , placin[MASK] 150 homes across 14 colonias under water . One person drowned in San Agustín after[MASK]falling in the[MASK]swollen river . Twenty @-@ seven colonias in and a[MASK]ound the city lost p[MASK]wer after muddy floodwaters entered a substation . Throughout Oaxaca , at least a dozen homes lost their roofs due to high winds . Portions of Colima , Chiapas , Michoacán and Jalisco experienced heavy r[MASK]ins ; however , in many areas , the rain proved beneficial in mitigating a severe drought . 
 
 
 = The B[MASK]urgeois Blues = 
 
 " The Bourgeois Blues " is a blues song by American folk and blues musician , Lead [MASK]elly [MASK] It was wri[MASK]ten in June 1937 in response to the discrimination and segregation that Lead Bel[MASK]y faced during a visit to Washington , DC to record for Alan Lomax . It rails against racism , the Jim Crow laws , and the condition[MASK] of contemporary African Ameri[MASK]ans in the sou[MASK]hern United [MASK]tates . 
 The song was recorded in December 1938 for the Library of Congre[MASK]s and re @-@ recorded in 1939 for commercial[MASK]release . It has been remi[MASK]ed and covered by a number of artists including P[MASK]te Seeger[MASK], Ry Cooder , Hans Theessink , and Billy Bragg . 
 " The Bourgeois Blues " is rega[MASK]ded as one of Lead Belly 's best origin[MASK]l works , but it also drew controversy . There is doubt over the song 's authorship , with some schol[MASK]rs contending that Lead Belly was unlikely to have written a work in a genre[MASK]new to him wit[MASK]out a[MASK]collaborator . Questions have been raised over his role in the American Communist Party and whe[MASK]her he and the song wer[MASK] used to further the party 's political goals . 
 
 = = Background and [MASK]reation = = 
 
 Most music historians [MASK]ate the w[MASK]iting of " The Bourg[MASK]ois Blues " to L[MASK]ad Belly 's June 1937 trip to Washington , DC , when he was invited by the folklorist Alan Lomax to record for the Library of Congress 's folk music [MASK]ollection . On the first night Lead Be[MASK]ly and h[MASK]s wife Martha spent in the city , they encounte[MASK]ed racially discriminatory Jim Crow laws similar to those found in their native L[MASK]uisiana : most hotel[MASK] refused to rent [MASK]ooms to African Americans and the few that would [MASK]ere [MASK]ither full or refused to serve him because he was with a white man ( Lomax ) . Lomax , in some versions of the story described as an u[MASK]named "[MASK]white friend " , offered to let the couple stay for the night in his apa[MASK]tment near the Supreme Court Building . The next morning , Lead Belly awoke to Lomax[MASK]arguing with his landlord about the presence of[MASK]a black man , with the landlord threatening to call the p[MASK]lice . 
 While in Washington , Lead Belly encountered s[MASK]veral other incidents of segregation that are believed to have contributed to the impetus of the song . For instance , when Lead B[MASK]lly , Lo[MASK]ax , a[MASK]d their wives want[MASK]d to go out to d[MASK][MASK]ner tog[MASK]ther , they discovered that it was impossible for the[MASK]mixed race group to find a[MASK]resta[MASK]rant that would serve them . Lead Belly was told that if he returned later without Lomax , he would be served . 
 In response to one of these incide[MASK]ts , a friend of Lead B[MASK]lly 's , variously identified as either Lomax or Mary Elizabeth Barnicle joked that Washington was a "[MASK]bourgeois town . " Though Lead Belly did not kn[MASK]w [MASK]hat the word " bourgeois [MASK] meant , he was fascinated b[MASK] the sound o[MASK] it , and after its meaning was explained to him he decided to incorporate[MASK][MASK]t into a so[MASK]g about the trip . The song came together quic[MASK][MASK]y ; one account claims that i[MASK] only took a [MASK]ew hours for Lead Belly to write it . Lomax liked it because it was partly based on what happened in his apartmen[MASK] . 
 
 = = Lyrics , themes and music = = 
 
 " The Bourgeois Blues " is a blues @-@ styl[MASK] protest song that [MASK]riticizes the culture of Washington , DC . It protests against both the city 's Jim Crow laws and the racism of its white population . Its structure includes several verses and a refrain that declares that th[MASK] speaker is going to " spread the news all around "[MASK][MASK]bout the racial issues plagui[MASK]g the city . The song , particularly in the ref[MASK]ain , conflates race and economics by referring to Caucasians as[MASK]" bourgeois " . 
 The first two verses speak of the segregation that [MASK]ead Belly encountered in Washington DC : the first recounts the fact that during the trip , Lead Belly was "[MASK]turned down " wherever he t[MASK]ied to get served due to his race , while the second recount[MASK] the argument between Lomax [MASK]nd his landlord o[MASK]er Lead Belly staying in his apartment . The third verse sarcastically cites " the home of the brave , the land of the Free " , juxtaposed with the mistreatment he received at the hands of white [MASK]eople in Washingt[MASK][MASK] , DC . The four[MASK]h verse speaks of the[MASK]racism of the white population of the city , leading to the song 's end , which suggests that African Americans boycott buying[MASK]homes in the [MASK]istrict . 
 The song 's tone implie[MASK] that the speaker feels powerless against the discrimination and racism t[MASK]at he[MASK]encounters ; despite this[MASK], by " spreading the news " of his poor treatment in a song , the speaker uses what power he has to tell both southern African Americans a[MASK]d northern whites that the status quo is deeply flawed and that[MASK]somet[MASK]ing needs to change . 
 " The Bourgeois Blues " follows a traditional twelve @-[MASK] bar blues format . It is written in 4[MASK] time but annotated to note that the song rhythmically should swing at medium shuffle . The song was written i[MASK] B ♭ . It uses twelve measures with [MASK]erses one to four re[MASK]eating , followed by the final two v[MASK]rses and a coda . 
 
 = = Recordings and adaptions = = 
 
 Lead Belly f[MASK]rst recorded " The Bourgeois Blues " in December 1938 in New York City , for donation t[MASK] the Library of Congre[MASK]s . He re @-@ recorded the song in Ap[MASK]il 1939 for Musicraft Records , [MASK]or release the same year a[MASK] a 78 rpm record . The version that was commercially released features Lead Belly singing and playing the twelve @-@ string guitar without any other accompaniment . 
 The song[MASK]has bee[MASK] [MASK]overed [MASK]nd reinterpreted [MASK]y a variety of artis[MASK]s including Pet[MASK] Seeger and Hans [MASK]heessink . Seege[MASK] recorded and released both live and studio versions o[MASK] the song on several of his albums . In Australia , the song w[MASK]s re[MASK]orked as " Canberr[MASK] Blues " by The Bitter Lemons , an R & B ba[MASK]d . The lyrics speak of the [MASK]roblems faced by young Australians in the Australia[MASK] Capit[MASK]l Territory in the 1[MASK]60s . Theessink adapted the song to [MASK]is style [MASK]f European blues for the album Journey On in 1997 . 
 In 2006 , Billy Bragg reworked the song as "[MASK]Bush War Blues " . Bragg 's cover is a topical protest song about the Iraq War . In one verse [MASK] Bragg claims that t[MASK]e Iraq War was not for dem[MASK]cracy but instead was to "[MASK]make the world safe for Halliburton " [MASK] In another , he takes on the Christian right , asking where the moderates are . Finally , Bragg chides the United States g[MASK]vernment for not dealing with poverty at home before going to war . 
 
 = = Legacy = = 
 
 " The Bourgeois Blues " is one of Lead Belly 's most famous songs and is remembered as his most " heartfelt protest song " .[MASK]There is disagreement among music scholars as to its importance . Robert Springer[MASK]claims that the song is " peripheral " to the wider study of the blues , while Lawson points to it as a watershed in the way African Americans see themselves in the fabric of t[MASK]e United States[MASK]. Th[MASK]re is debat[MASK] over the relationsh[MASK]p between[MASK]the song and radical politics . Af[MASK]er its r[MASK]lease , it became p[MASK]pular with left @-@ wing political groups . Lead Belly [MASK]as invited to pe[MASK]form at Camp Un[MASK]ty , the Commu[MASK]ist Party USA 's summer retreat , and the [MASK]BI subsequently opened a file on him [MASK]n the 1940s . This led to the accusations that the Communists were taking advantage of him and using him as a platform . The party claims , to the c[MASK]ntrary , that they were some of the few people who respected him and gave[MASK]him a chance to perform . 
 Jeff Todd Titon and several other writers have suggested that Lead Belly had significant help with its auth[MASK]rship and claim it is not a genuine protest song . This theory stems from the idea that Lead Belly did not have a history of pr[MASK]test music before he was discover[MASK]d by Lomax . Since the music th[MASK]t Lomax recorded was sold to northerners sympathetic to Civil Rights , it has been suggested that Lomax helped him write a song attrac[MASK]ive to a white audience . Lead Belly admitted that the term " bourgeoi[MASK] " was unfami[MASK]iar to[MASK]him , and it seems out o[MASK] place compared to the vocabulary of his past work . 
 
 
 = Sorry ( Madonna song ) = 
 
 " Sorry " is a song by American singer Mado[MASK]na from her tenth studio album[MASK]Confessions on a Dance Fl[MASK]or ( [MASK]005 ) . It was written[MASK]and produced by Madonna and Stuart P[MASK]ice , and released as the second single from the album on[MASK]Febr[MASK]ary 7 , 2006 . It later appeared on Celebration , her 2009 greatest hits album . An uptempo dance song , " Sorry " was one of the first tracks developed for the album and ha[MASK] numerous[MASK]remix treatments before the ultimate version of the track was finalized . One of the remi[MASK]es was done by the Pet Shop Boys , featuring added lyrics by the band . The actual song features a dance groove tempo . It talks about personal empowerment and self @-@ sufficiency . 
 "[MASK]Sorry " received positive reviews from contempor[MASK]ry critic[MASK] , who declared the track the strongest song on Confessions on a Dance Floor . So[MASK]e critics also commented on the song 's disco @-@ influenced be[MASK]ts while comparing it to Madonna 's older dance songs . It achieved commercial success , topping the singles charts in Italy , Spain , [MASK]omania and the U[MASK]ited Kingdom , whe[MASK]e it [MASK]ecame Madonna 's twelfth number one single . Elsewhere , the song was a top ten hit . However , in the United States , the song did not perform well due to an underplay on radio but was able to reach the top [MASK]f Billboard 's dance charts and b[MASK]came one of the decade 's most successful dance[MASK]hits . 
 The accompanying music video , directed by Madonna 's choreographer Jamie King , was a continuation from the " Hung Up " musi[MASK] video . It featured Madonna[MASK]and her dancers roaming around a city in a van , dancing on roller skates and Madonna fighting with a group of men in a cage . She performed the s[MASK]ng on her 2006 Confe[MASK]sions Tour in a similar fight sequence to that shown in the video . An addit[MASK]onal video w[MASK]s created as a backdrop for a remix of the song , which depicted political leaders and scenes of war and destruction . 
 
 = = B[MASK]ckground and comp[MASK]sition = = 
 
 " Sorry " w[MASK]s o[MASK]e of the first tracks developed for Confessions on a Da[MASK]ce [MASK]loor [MASK] along with " Hung Up " and " Future Lovers " . It[MASK]was also[MASK]the one which took the most time to finish because Madonna " thought it was too melodramatic and could never decide when it was r[MASK]ght . " The s[MASK]ngs were developed with a remixed perspective in [MASK]ind . Madonna commented[MASK]that , " Whenever I mak[MASK] records , I often like the remixes better than the original ones . [ ... ] So I thought , sc[MASK]ew that . I 'm going to start from[MASK]tha[MASK] perspective " . She promoted the album at the dance party " Misshapes " held at Luke & Leroy [MASK]s nightclub in Greenwich Village , invited by Junior Sanchez to take over the DJ b[MASK]oth where she mixed[MASK]" Hung Up " with " Sorry " . Musically , " Sorry " is an uptempo dance song containing layers of beats and strong vocal on the chorus . It is set in common time with a moderately fast danc[MASK] [MASK]roove tempo of 132 beats per minute . Composed in the key of C[MASK]minor , Madonn[MASK] 's vocal range spans from [MASK]3 to G4 . It follows the chord progression of E ♭ – Cm – A ♭ – B ♭ during the s[MASK]oken introduction . It then changes to Fm – Gm @-@ Cm in the chorus [MASK] while continuing in [MASK] ♭ – Cm – A ♭ – Fm in the intermediate verses , ultimately ending in repeated lines o[MASK] " I 've heard it all before " . 
 L[MASK]rically the song has excerpts of different languages includin[MASK] Fr[MASK]nch , Spanish , Italian , Du[MASK]ch , Hebrew , Hindi , Polish and Japanese . The song talks about personal empowerment and self @-@ suff[MASK]ciency , denoting a shift in focus of Madonna as an ar[MASK]ist from her previous[MASK]songs about supremacy like " Everybody " ( 1982 ) , " Vogue " ( 1990 ) or " Music " ( [MASK]000 ) which was centered around the subject of mu[MASK]ic itself . Among the various remixes , the Pet Shop Boys remix inc[MASK]rporated Whitney Houston 's " I [MASK]anna Dance with Somebody ( Who Loves Me ) " with a m[MASK]re pr[MASK][MASK]ounced bassline and uses a double breakdown in the introduction . Pet Shop Boys and Madonna had al[MASK][MASK]ys mutually admired[MASK]each other , from the time they wrot[MASK] the son[MASK] " Heart "[MASK]( 1988 ) for Madonna but ne[MASK]er delivered it . The remix had added lyrics [MASK]ung by band member N[MASK]il Tennan[MASK] wh[MASK]ch[MASK]subsequently appeared on their remix[MASK]album Disco Four . Madonna 's voice hits on the first chorus which was remixed to have a masculine synth and a serious hook . A breakdown happens before the [MASK]ifth mi[MASK]ute ends , leading to the entry [MASK]f prog[MASK]ammed drum sounds after which the song ends . 
 
 = = Critical response = = 
 
[MASK]Jennifer Vineya[MASK]d of MTV News wrote that " Sorry " [MASK]s the " album 's strongest track " and that it is a "[MASK]Pet Shop[MASK]Boys @-@ esque " song . Vineyard[MASK]went on to say that it " ... wistfully evokes the sounds of the ' 80s @-@ era dance clubs that [MASK]irst lofted her toward stardom . " According to a review in the BBC 's Collective , " New single ' Sorry ' states Queen Madge 's unapologetic stance , and though the song is wrapped up in relati[MASK]nship sentiment , one cannot help but hear the subtext[MASK], perhaps directed at her more savage critics : ' there are more important things th[MASK]n hearing you speak ' . " Ala[MASK] Braidwo[MASK]d from BBC Music called the song " lethally catchy " . Mike Pattenden of The Times and Sal Cinquemani from[MASK]Slant Magazin[MASK] noted that the bas[MASK]line of the song utilizes The Jacksons ' 1980 song " Can You Feel It " . [MASK][MASK]e song was noted by Slant Magazine as one of the best songs of 2[MASK]06 . In a review of " Sorry " from Virgin Media , it wrote [MASK]hat the song 's musicscape features an " infectious combo of pumping , filtered synths and disco beats " . Keith Caulfield from Billboard commented that , " [ Sorr[MASK] ] should keep fans hung up on Madonna 's ability to create instant radio and club classics . " He also called the song " springy " w[MASK]ile reviewing the album . 
 Ben Williams of New York magazine , wrote that the song is " propelled by a catchy bass melody " . Joan Mo[MASK]gan of The Village Voice , in review of Confessions on a Dance Floor , wrote : " [MASK]he party continues admirably with the multilingual , kick @[MASK]@ your @-@ man @-@ to @-@ the @-@ curb ' Sorry ' . " Stephen M. Deusner of Pitc[MASK][MASK]ork Media wrote , " T[MASK]e cascades of sound wash dire[MASK]tly into ' Sorry ' , setting up the song 's panlingual apologies and shifting bass tectoni[MASK]s . " Jon Pareles of The New York Times wrote that the first half of the album consists of love songs , happy [MASK]nd sad , and included " Sorry " int[MASK] the mix . Alexi[MASK] Petridis from The Guardi[MASK]n called the song as triumphant . K[MASK]tt[MASK] Empi[MASK]e from the same newspaper said that " ' S[MASK]rry ' se[MASK]s Madonna taking a lover to task over an insistent dance @-@ pop rush . " Alan L[MASK]ght fro[MASK] Rolling Stone called the song " throbbing " . [MASK]homas Inksweep from Stylus magazine commented that " Sorry "[MASK]and firs[MASK] single " Hung Up " may not be as sleazy like Madon[MASK]a 's initial singles " Burning Up " ( 1984 ) or " P[MASK]ysic[MASK]l Attraction " ( 1984 ) , but t[MASK]ey have the same modus operandi of being designed for all @-@ night dancing . 
 
 = = Chart performance = = 
 
 In the United States , " Sorry " debuted at number 70 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart for the issue dated March 11 , 2006 and reached a peak of 58 the following week . The same week it reached a peak of 46 on [MASK]he Pop[MASK]100 chart . [MASK]ts low chart performance[MASK]in America was attributed to [MASK]imited radio airplay . A petition was signed by about 3 @,@ 300 fans at petitionline.com. Known as the " End [MASK]he Madonna U.S. Radio Boycott " ; it was addressed[MASK]to [MASK]lear Channel Commu[MASK]ications CEO Mark P. Mays . Message boards at Entertainment Weekly and VH1 were filled with entries by users showing supp[MASK]rt for Madonna , as well as conspiracy theories a[MASK]out why she was [MASK]ot played on radio . The song , howev[MASK]r , reached the top of the Hot Dance Club Play chart for two weeks , as well as Hot Dance A[MASK]rplay chart for five [MASK]eeks . As of April 201[MASK] , the song has[MASK]sold 366 @,@ 00[MASK] digital units in the United States . 
 In the United Kingdom , it debuted at number one on the chart dated February 26 , 2006 . The song became Madonna 's 12th number one sin[MASK]le[MASK]in Britain and second consecutive single from the album to peak the Brit[MASK]sh chart , after " Hung Up . " This made Madonna the female artist with most number one songs in the United Kingdom , while placing her in [MASK]i[MASK]th place in overall tabulation . According to the Official C[MASK]arts Company , the song has sold 200 @,@ 000 digital downloads there and was[MASK]c[MASK]rtified silver by the British Phonographic Indu[MASK]try ( BPI ) . In Australia[MASK], the song debuted an[MASK] peaked at four . 
 The song peaked at number two on the Canadian Singles Chart and was certified platinum by the Canadian Recording Industry A[MASK]sociation ( CRIA ) on April 10 , 2006 for sales of 80 @,@ 000 units of paid digital downloads . " Sorry " debuted[MASK]at numb[MASK]r five in Ireland and was on the chart for 12 weeks . Elsewhere in Europe , the song became a top ten h[MASK]t for Madonna reaching the top ten of countries like Aust[MASK]ia , B[MASK]lgium ( Flanders and Wallonia ) , Denmark , Finland , France , Germany , Netherlands , Norway , Sweden and Switzerland while reaching the top of the charts in Italy [MASK] S[MASK]ain and B[MASK]llboard 's Eurochart Hot 100 Singles . 
 
 = = Music video = = 
 
 The music video incorporated parts of the television show Pim[MASK] My Ride , and was shot by Madonna in London in January 2006 while she was making plans for her then forthcoming Confessions Tour . It was directed by Madonna 's longtime choreographer Jamie King and featu[MASK]ed choreography from The Talauega Brothers . [MASK]any of the performers feat[MASK]red in Madonna 's " Hung Up " video[MASK]were in that of " Sorry " , which was shot as a continuation from the " Hung Up " video [MASK] Ma[MASK]onna 's parts in the video were shot first , followed [MASK]y[MASK]the shot of the skater[MASK] . The shoot took place f[MASK]r over two days[MASK]. 
 The video starts with Madonna standin[MASK] in fro[MASK]t of neon lighted screen [MASK]n a[MASK]purple leotard uttering " Sorry " in different languages . As the music starts she comes out from the gaming parlour of her " Hung U[MASK] " video with her dancers . They board a va[MASK] whe[MASK]e Madonna [MASK]nd her dancers strip of their clothes into new ones . Madonna wears a white leotard with a matching tassled corset with her hair in 1[MASK]70s r[MASK]tro inspired style and pair of knee high silver plat[MASK]orm boots . 
 As they move around the city in [MASK]he van , they pick up different men from the [MASK]treets to join them . These scenes are interspersed with the scenes of Madonna singing in front of the neon screen . The video progresses like this until the intermediate verse whence Madonna is shown standing in a c[MASK]ge opposite to a number o[MASK] men . As the bridge builds up , Madonna starts[MASK]fighting with the men . She starts bending backward[MASK] and tying her[MASK]elf in knot like posi[MASK]io[MASK]s , [MASK]hile d[MASK]ing backf[MASK]ips and somersaults which defeats the men . The chorus starts again and Madonna and her dancers are show[MASK] skating in circles around a rol[MASK]er rink[MASK]. The video ends with the close @-@ up[MASK]of Madonna in the purple leotard and fades into her silhouette .
