 = Upsil[MASK]n Andromedae b = 
 
 Upsilon Andromedae b [MASK] abbreviated υ Andromedae b , υ And b [MASK] , occasionally designated Up[MASK]ilon Andromedae Ab ( t[MASK] distinguish it from the red dwarf Upsilon Andromedae B ) , also named Saffar , is an extrasolar planet approxim[MASK]t[MASK]ly 44 light @-@[MASK]years a[MASK]ay from the Sun in the constellation of And[MASK]omeda . The planet orbits the Solar twin star , Upsilon Andromedae A , approximately every five days . Discovered in J[MASK]ne 1996 by [MASK]eoffrey Marcy and R. Paul Butler , it was [MASK]ne of the first hot Jupiters to be discovered . It is also one of the first non @-@ resolved planets to be detected directly . Upsilon Andromedae b is the innermost known planet in its[MASK]planetary system . 
 In[MASK]July 2014 the In[MASK]ernational Astronomi[MASK]al Union launched a process for giving proper names to ce[MASK]tai[MASK] exoplanets and their host stars . The process[MASK]involve[MASK] publ[MASK]c nomination and voting for the new names . In December 201[MASK] , t[MASK]e IAU[MASK]announced the winning name was Saffar for this planet . The winning name was submitted by the Vega Astronomy Club of Morocco and honours the 11th Century astronomer Ibn al @-@ Saffar of Muslim Spain . 
 
 = = Discovery = = 
 
 Like the majority of known extrasolar planet[MASK] , Upsilon Andromeda[MASK] b was detected by the variations in its star 's radial velocity caused by the pla[MASK]et 's gravity . The variations were detected by making sensitive measu[MASK]emen[MASK]s [MASK]f[MASK][MASK]he Do[MASK]pler shift of Upsilon Andromedae 's spectrum[MASK]. The planet 's existence was announced in January 1997 , together with 55 Cancri b and the planet orbiting Tau Boötis . 
 Like [MASK]1 Pegasi b , the first ex[MASK]ras[MASK]lar planet discovered around a normal star , Upsilon Andromedae b orbi[MASK]s very close t[MASK] its star[MASK], clos[MASK]r than Me[MASK]cury does to [MASK]ur Sun . The planet takes 4 @.@ 617 days to complete an orbit , with a semimajor axis of 0 @.@ 0595 AU . 
 A limitation of the radial velocity method used [MASK]o detect Upsilon Andro[MASK]edae b is that only a lower limi[MASK] on the mass can be found . In the case of Upsilon Androm[MASK]dae b , this lower lim[MASK]t is 68 @.@ 7 % of the mass of J[MASK]piter , though depending on the inclination of the orbit[MASK], the true mass may be much gre[MASK]ter . Ho[MASK]ever , astronomers found re[MASK]ently that inclination of the [MASK]rbital plane is around 25 ° a[MASK]d the tru[MASK] mass may be about 1 @.@ 4 MJ . Cop[MASK]anarity is not to be ass[MASK]med ; the mutual inclination between c and d is 35 degrees . 
 
 = = Physical characteristics = = 
 
 Given the p[MASK]anet 's high mass , it is likely that Upsilon Andromedae b is a gas giant with no s[MASK][MASK]id[MASK]surface . 
 The Spitzer Space Telescope measured the planet temperature , [MASK]nd found that the difference between the two sides of Upsilon Andromedae b of about 1 @,@ 400 degrees Celsiu[MASK] , ranging from minus 2[MASK] to 230 degrees to about 1 @,@ 400 to 1 @,@ 650 degrees Celsius . The temperature difference [MASK]as led to speculation that Upsilon Andromedae b is tidal locked with the sam[MASK] side always facing Upsilon Andromedae A. 
 Sudarsky had , on the assumption that the pla[MASK]et is si[MASK]ilar to Jupiter[MASK]in comp[MASK]sition and that its environment is close to c[MASK]emical equilibrium , pre[MASK]icted Upsilon Andromedae b to have[MASK]reflecti[MASK]e[MASK]clouds of silicates and iron in its upper atmosphere . T[MASK]e cloud deck instead absorbs the sun 's radiatio[MASK] ; between that and[MASK]the hot , high pressure gas surrounding the mantle , exists a stratosphere of cooler gas . The outer shell [MASK]f dark , opaque , hot cloud is[MASK]assumed to consist of vanadium and titanium oxides ( " pM planets " ) , but other compounds like tholins cannot be ruled out yet . 
 The planet i[MASK] unlikely to have large mo[MASK]ns , since tidal forces would either eject them from orbit or destroy them on short timescales compared to the age of the system . 
 The planet ( with[MASK]51 [MASK]egasi b ) was deemed a candidate for direct imaging by Plane[MASK]pol . Prelim[MASK]nary resul[MASK]s from[MASK]polarimetric studies i[MASK]dic[MASK]te that the planet has predominately blue color , is 1 @.@ 36 times [MASK]s[MASK]large and 0 @.@ 74 times as massive as Jupiter , meaning that the mean density is 0.36g / cm3 . It has a geometric a[MASK]bedo of 0 @.@ [MASK]5 in visible light . 
 
 = = Effect on its sun = = 
 
 Upsilon Andromedae b appears to be responsible for increased chromospheric activity on its parent star . Observations su[MASK]gest that there is a " hot spot " on the star around 169 ° away from the sub @-@ planetary point . This may be the result of intera[MASK]tions between the magnet[MASK]c fields of the planet and the star . The mechanism may be similar to that responsib[MASK]e for the activity[MASK]of RS Canum Venaticorum variable stars , or the interactio[MASK] between Jupite[MASK] and its moon Io . 
 
 
 =[MASK]Daniel R[MASK]dcliffe = 
 
 Daniel Jacob Radcli[MASK]fe ( born [MASK]3 July 1989 ) is an Englis[MASK] actor who rose to prominence as the title character in the Harry Potter film series . He made his acting debut at 10 years of age in BBC One 's 1999 television film David Copperfie[MASK]d , followed by his cinematic debut[MASK]in 2001 's The Tai[MASK]or of[MASK]Panama . At age 11 , he was cast as Harry Potter in the first Harry Potter fil[MASK] , and starred in the series for 10 years until the release of the eighth[MASK]and final film in 2011 . 
 Radcliffe began to branch out to stage [MASK]cting in 2007 , starring in the Londo[MASK] and New York productions of Equus , and in the 2011 Broadway revival of the musical How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying . He starred in the 2012 horror film The Woman in Black , and played beat poet Allen Ginsberg in the 2013 indepe[MASK]dent fil[MASK] Kill Your Darlings . 
 He has [MASK]ontributed to many charities , including D[MASK]melza Hospice Care for Chi[MASK]dren , and The Trevor Project for sui[MASK]ide prevention among LGBTQ[MASK]youth , which gave him [MASK]ts Hero Award in 2011 . 
 
 = = Ea[MASK]ly l[MASK]fe = = 
 
 R[MASK]dcl[MASK]ffe wa[MASK] born in West Lo[MASK]don , England . He is the o[MASK]ly child of Alan George Radcliffe , a literary agent , and Marcia Jeannine Gresham ( née Marcia Gresham Jacobson [MASK] , a casting agent who was involved in several films for[MASK]the BBC , including The Inspector Lynley Mysteries and Walk Away and I S[MASK]umble . His father , who was[MASK]r[MASK]ised in Banbridge , County Down , No[MASK]thern Ireland , is from " a very working[MASK]@-@ class " Protestant background [MASK] His mother is [MASK]ewi[MASK]h , and was born in South Africa and raised in Westcliff @-@ o[MASK] @-@ Sea , Essex . Her family had originally come from Poland and Russia . Radcliffe 's parents had both acted as children . 
 In a 2[MASK]12 interview , Radcliffe stated : [MASK] There was never[MASK][MASK] religious ] faith in the house . I think o[MASK] myself as being Jewish and Irish , despite the fact that I 'm English . " He has stated : " We were Christmas tree Jews " , and that he is " very proud of being Jewish " . 
 Radcliffe first expressed a desire to act at the age of five , an[MASK] in December[MASK]1999 , aged 10 , he made his acting debut in BBC One '[MASK] televised two @-@ part[MASK]adaptation of the Charles Dickens novel David Copperfield[MASK], portraying the title character as [MASK] y[MASK][MASK]ng boy . He was educated at two independent schools for [MASK]oys : Sussex House Scho[MASK]l , a day school in Chelsea 's Cadogan Square , and the City of London School , a day school on the No[MASK]th Bank of the River Thames in London '[MASK] financial district ( known as the City of London ) . Attending school became difficult for Radcliffe afte[MASK] the release of th[MASK] first Har[MASK]y Potter film , with some fe[MASK]low pupils [MASK]ecoming [MASK]ostile , thoug[MASK] he says it was people just trying to " have a crack at the k[MASK]d that plays Harry Potter " rather than jealousy[MASK]. 
 [MASK]s his acting career began to consume his [MASK]chedule , Radcliffe continued his educatio[MASK] through on @-@ set tutors . He admitted he was not very good at school , considering it useless and finding the work " really difficult . " He achieved A gra[MASK]es in th[MASK] three AS @-@[MASK]level exams that he took in 2006 , but decided to take a bre[MASK]k from education and did not go to college or university . Part of his reaso[MASK]ing was that [MASK]e already knew he wanted to act [MASK]nd write , and [MASK]hat it would be difficult to have a normal [MASK]ollege experie[MASK][MASK]e . " The paparazzi , they 'd love[MASK]it , " he told Details magazine in 2007 . " If there were any parti[MASK]s going on , they 'd be tipped off as to where they we[MASK]e . " 
 
 = = Career = = 
 
 
 = = = Harry Potter = = = 
 
 In 2000 , producer David Heyman asked Radcliffe to audition for the role of Harry Potter for the film adaptation of Harry Potter and t[MASK]e Philosopher 's Stone , [MASK]he best @-@ selling book by British author J. K. [MASK]owling . [MASK]owling had been searching f[MASK]r an unknown British acto[MASK] to personify the character , and the movie 's director Chris Columbus recalled thinking , " This is what I want . [MASK]his is Harry Potter " , after he saw a video of the youn[MASK] actor in David Copperfield . Eight months later , and after several auditions , Radcliffe was selected to play the part . Rowling also endorsed the selection saying , " I don 't think Chris Columbus could have [MASK]ound a better Harry . " Radcliffe 's parents originally turned down the offer , as they[MASK]had been told that it would involve six films shot in Los Angeles . Warner Bros. instead offered Radcliffe a two @-@ mov[MASK]e contract with shooting in the UK ; Radcliffe was unsure at the[MASK]time if he would do any more than that . 
 The release of Harry Potter and the Philosopher 's Stone [MASK] released as [MASK]arry Potter and the Sorcerer 's Stone in the United St[MASK]tes ) took p[MASK]ace in 2001 . Radcliffe received a seven figure salary for the lead role , but asserted that the fee wa[MASK] " not that important " to him ; his parents chose to invest the money for him . The[MASK]film was highly popu[MASK]ar and was met with positive rev[MASK]ews , and critics took notice of Radcliffe : " Ra[MASK]cliffe is the embodime[MASK]t of every reader 's [MASK]maginati[MASK]n . It is wonderful to see a [MASK]oung hero who is so scholarly looking and filled[MASK]with curiosity and who connects with very real emotions , from solemn intelligence[MASK]and the deli[MASK]ht of discovery to [MASK]eep family longing , " wrote Bob Graha[MASK] of the San Francisco Chron[MASK]cle . 
 A year later Radcliffe starred in Harry Pott[MASK]r and the Chamber of Secrets , the second inst[MASK]llment of the series . Reviewers were [MASK]ositive about[MASK]the lead actors ' performances but had polarised opinions[MASK]on the movie as a whole . The 2004[MASK]release Harry Potter and the Pri[MASK]oner of Azkaban was the third film in the series . Radcliffe 's performance was panned by New Yo[MASK]k Times journalist A. O. Scott , who wrote that Watson had to carry him with her performance . Next was Harry Potter[MASK]and th[MASK] Goblet of Fire [MASK]n 2005 . The film was the second @-@ highest grossing Harry Po[MASK]ter film at that point , and Radcliffe singled out the humour as being a reason for the m[MASK]vie 's creative success . 
 The future of the franchise was put into question when Radcliffe and his co @-@ leads Emma [MASK]atson and Rupert Grint hesitated signing on to continue their[MASK]roles for the fin[MASK][MASK] two episodes ; howev[MASK]r , b[MASK] March 2007 Radcliffe had signed for the fin[MASK]l films , which[MASK]put an end to weeks of press " speculation that he would be [MASK]enied the role due to his involvement in[MASK]Equus " , in which he had perfor[MASK]ed nude on stage . [MASK]adcliffe reprised his role for the fourth time in[MASK]Harry[MASK]Potter and the[MASK]Order of the Phoenix ( 2007 ) . Radcliffe stated tha[MASK] director David Yates and actress Imelda Staunton made Order of [MASK]he Phoenix the " most fun " film in the seri[MASK][MASK] to work on . His performance[MASK]earned several a[MASK]ard nominations , and he[MASK]received the 2008 National Movie Award for " Best Male Performance . " As his fame and the series continued , Radcliffe , Grint , and Watson left imprints of the[MASK]r hands , feet , and wands in front of Grauman 's[MASK]Chinese Theatre in Hollywood . In July 2009 Ha[MASK]ry [MASK]otter and the Half @-@ Blood Prince was released , the series ' sixth instalment . Radcliffe received nominations for " Best Male Performance " and " Global Su[MASK]erstar " at the 2010 MTV Movie Awards . 
 For financial a[MASK]d scripting [MASK]easons t[MASK]e last book was divided into two films , shot back to back , whic[MASK] drew criticism from the series ' fanbase . Radcliffe defended the split , stating that i[MASK] would have been impossi[MASK]le to properly adapt the final novel into a single film . [MASK]e added that the last movie was going to be extremely fast @-@ paced with a lot of action , while the[MASK]first part would be f[MASK]r more sedate , focusing on character development ; he added that [MASK] had they combined them , those things would not have made it to the final cut . Filmi[MASK][MASK] lasted [MASK]or a year , concluding in June 2010 and on the last da[MASK][MASK]of shooting , like most of the c[MASK]st and crew , Radcliffe openly wept . 
 The final film , Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2 , was released in July 2011 . [MASK]adcliffe , along with [MASK]he film , was critically acclaimed : Ann Hornaday of The Washington Post a[MASK]ked , " Who cou[MASK]d [MASK]ave predicted that Radcliffe , Grint and Watson would turn out[MASK]to be good actors ? " ; similarly , Rex Reed said : " Frankly , I ’ m sorry to see [ Radcliffe ] go " ; wh[MASK]le Rolling Stone critic Peter[MASK]Travers commented on Radcliffe : " Well played , sir . " Roger Ebert gave the film a highly positive review , but felt that Radcliffe , Grint and Watson were " upstaged by the supporting [ a[MASK]tors ] . " 
 Radcliffe admitted[MASK]that so[MASK]e people would never be able to[MASK]separate him from the character , but also said he is " proud to be associated with this film series fore[MASK]er . " Despite positive f[MASK]elings about the movies , he has no interest in doing more Harr[MASK] Potter films . After Rowling hinted about writing an eighth book , Radcliffe was asked if he wo[MASK]ld do another film to which he replied : " [ It is ] very doubtful . I think 10 years is a long time to spen[MASK] with on[MASK] character . " Despite devoting so much time to the series , Radcliffe has asserted that he[MASK]did not miss out on a childhood like ot[MASK]er child actors : " I ’ ve been given [MASK] much better perspective on life by doing Potter . " 
 
 = = [MASK] 2001 – 09 = = = 
 
 Radcli[MASK]fe[MASK]made his film debut in The Tailor of Panama , an American 2001 film based on John le C[MASK]rré 's 1996 spy novel , [MASK]n[MASK] a moderate commercial success . In 2002 he made his[MASK]stage debut as a celebrity guest in a West End theatre pro[MASK]uction of The Play What I Wrote , directed by Kenneth Branagh – who also[MASK]appeared with him in the second Harry Potter film . In 2[MASK]07 he app[MASK]ared in the film December Boy[MASK] , an Australian family drama about[MASK]four orphans that was shot in 2005 an[MASK] released to theatres[MASK]in mid @-@ September 2007 . Also in 2007 , Radcliffe co @-@ starred with Carey Mulligan in My Boy Jack , a television drama film shown on ITV on Remembrance Day . The fil[MASK] received mostly positive reviews , with sev[MASK]ral critics praising Radcliffe 's performance as an 18 @-@ year @-@ old who goes missing in action during a battle . Ra[MASK]cliffe stated , " For many people [MASK]y age , the First World War is just a topic in [MASK] history book . But I[MASK]'ve always been fascinated b[MASK] the subject and think it [MASK]s as relevant today as it ever was . " 
 At age 17 , in a bid to show people h[MASK] was prepared for adult roles , he performed [MASK]nstage in[MASK]Peter Shaffer 's play Equus , which had n[MASK]t been revived since its first run in 1973 , at[MASK]the Gielgud Theatre . Radcliffe took [MASK]n the lead role as Alan Strang , a stable boy who has an obsession with h[MASK]rses . [MASK]dvance sales topped £ 1 @.@ 7 million , and the role generated significant pre @-@ opening media interest , as Radcliffe appeared in a nude scene . Equus opened on 27 February 2007 and ran until 9 June 2007 . Radcliffe 's performance received positive reviews as critics were impressed by the nuance and depth of his against @-@ type role . Charles S[MASK]encer of The Daily Telegraph wrote that he " disp[MASK]ays a dramat[MASK]c power and an electrifying stage presence that marks a trem[MASK]ndous leap f[MASK]rward . " He add[MASK]d : " I never thought I would find the diminutive ( but perfectly formed ) Radcliffe a sinister figure , but as Alan Strang ... there are moments when he seems genuinely scary in his r[MASK]ge and confusion . " Th[MASK] production then transferred to Broadway in September 2008 , with Radcliffe [MASK]till in the lead role . Radcliffe stated he was nervous about repeating the role on Broadway because h[MASK] considered American audiences more discerning than those in London . Radcliffe 's performa[MASK]ce was nominated for a Drama Desk Award . 
 
 = = = 2010 – present = = = 
 
 Aft[MASK]r voicing a char[MASK]cter in an episode of the animated television series The Simpsons in late 2010 , Radcliffe debuted as J. Pierrepont Finch in the 2011 Bro[MASK]dway reviva[MASK] How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying , a role previously held by Broadway [MASK]eterans R[MASK]bert Morse an[MASK] Matthew[MASK]Broderick . Other cas[MASK] members included Joh[MASK] Larroquette , Rose H[MASK]mingway and Mary Faber . Both the actor and production received favourable reviews , with USA[MASK]Today commenting : " Radcliffe u[MASK]timately succeeds not by overshadowing his fellow cast members , but by working in conscientious harmony with them – and havi[MASK]g a blast in th[MASK] process . " Radcliffe 's performance in the show earned him Drama Desk Award , Drama League Award and Outer Critics Circle Award nominations . The production [MASK]tself later received nine Tony Award nominations . Radcliffe left the show on 1 January 2012 .[MASK]
 His first post @-@ Harry Potter project was the 2012 horr[MASK]r film The Woman in Black , adapted from the 1983 novel by Sus[MASK]n Hill . The film was released on[MASK][MASK] February 2012 in the United States and Canada , and was released on 10 February in the UK . Radcliffe portrays a man sent to deal with the legal matters of a mysterious woman who has just died , and soon after he [MASK]egins to experience [MASK]trange events [MASK]nd hauntings from the ghost of a woman d[MASK]e[MASK]sed in black . He has said he was " i[MASK]credibly excited " to be part of the film and described the script as " bea[MASK]tifully written " .[MASK]
 In 2013 , he portrayed [MASK]merican poet [MASK]llen Ginsberg in the thriller drama Kill Your Darlings [MASK] directed by John Krokidas . He also starr[MASK]d in an Irish @-@ Canadian romantic comed[MASK] film The F Word directed by Michael Dowseand written by Elan Mastai , based [MASK]n TJ Dawe and Michael Rinaldi 's play [MASK]oothpaste and Cigars and then he starred in an Amer[MASK]can dark fanta[MASK]y horror film directed by Alexandre Aja Horns[MASK]. Both of the films premie[MASK]ed at the 38th Toront[MASK] International Film Festival . 
 Radcliffe also perform[MASK]d at the Noël Coward Theatre in the stage play revival of Martin McDonagh 's dark comedy The Cripple of Inishmaan as the le[MASK]d , Billy Claven , for which he won the WhatsOnSta[MASK]e Award for Best Actor i[MASK] a Play . In[MASK]2015 , Radcliffe [MASK]tarred as Igor in a science fiction horror film [MASK][MASK]ctor Frankenstein directed by P[MASK]ul McGuigan and written by Max Landis , which was based on contemporary adaptations of Mary Shelley 's 1[MASK]18 novel Frankenstein . In 2016 , Radcliffe portrayed Manny , a talkative corpse , in the indie film Swiss Army Ma[MASK] . 
 [MASK]e is set to star as American reporter Jake Adelstein in Tokyo Vice . In November 2015 he joined the ensemble cast of Shane Carruth 's th[MASK]rd film , The M[MASK]dern Ocean alongside Anne Hathaway , Keanu Reeves , Tom Holland , Chloë Grace Moretz , Asa Butt[MASK][MASK]field , Jeff Goldblum and Abraham Attah .

 = = Personal life = = 
 
 In 2008 , Radcliffe [MASK]evealed that he has a mild form of the neurological disord[MASK]r developmental coordination disorder . The motor skill disorder sometimes prevents him from doing simple act[MASK]vities , [MASK]uch as writing or tying his own shoelace[MASK] . " I w[MASK]s having a hard time at schoo[MASK] , [MASK]n terms of being cra[MASK] at everything , with [MASK]o discernible talent , "[MASK]Radcliffe commented . In August 2010 , he stopped drinking alcohol after fi[MASK]ding himself becoming too reliant on it . 
 In November 2007 Radcliffe pub[MASK]ished several poems under the pen name Jacob Gershon – a combination of his middle name and the Jewish version of his mother 's maide[MASK] name Gresham – in Rubbish , an underground[MASK]fashion ma[MASK]azine . He has a close friendship with his Harry Potter co @-@ stars Tom Felton and Emma Watson , and is tight @-@ knit with his family , whom he credits for keeping him grounded . 
 Sources disagree about Rad[MASK]liffe 's pers[MASK]nal wealth ; he was reported to have earned £ 1 million for the first Harry Potter film and a[MASK]ound £[MASK]15 mi[MASK]lion for the s[MASK][MASK]th . Radcliffe appeared on the Sunday Times Rich List in 2006 , whic[MASK] estimated his personal fortune to b[MASK] £ 14 [MASK]illion , making him one of the rich[MASK]st young p[MASK]ople in th[MASK] UK . In March 2009 he was ranked number one on t[MASK]e Forbes " Mos[MASK] Valuable Young Stars " list , and by April The Daily Telegraph measured his net worth at £ 30m , mak[MASK]ng him the 12th richest young perso[MASK] in the UK . Radcliffe was co[MASK]sidered to be the richest teenager in England lat[MASK]r that year . In February 2010 he was named the sixth highest paid Hollywood male star and placed at number five on Forbes 's December list of Hollywood 's highest @-@ g[MASK]ossing actors with a film revenue o[MASK] US $ 780 million , mainly due to Harr[MASK] Potter and the Deathly Hallows [MASK]eing released that year . 
 Radcliffe maintains a home in the West Village of L[MASK]wer Manhattan in New York City . As of October 2012 , Radcliffe has been dating American Erin Darke , whom he met on the se[MASK] of Kill Your Darlings . There were rumours and stories of a possible engagement in mid @-@ 2014 [MASK] but Darke 's father Ian Darke denied there were any such p[MASK]ans in December 2014 . 
 
 = = = Views and activism = = = 
 
 Radcliffe is an atheist . He has been quoted as saying : " I 'm an atheist , and a militant atheist when religion starts impacting on legislation " , and in a separate interview , he stated ; " I 'm very relaxed about it [ being an ath[MASK]ist ] . I don 't preach my atheism , but[MASK]I have a huge amount of respect for people like Richard Dawkins who do . Anything he does on television , I will watch " . 
 Radcliffe is a supporter of the Labour Party . Until 2012 Radcliffe had publicly supported the Liberal Democrats , and before t[MASK]e 2010 general election Radcliffe endorsed Nick Clegg , the Lib De[MASK] leader . In 2012 , however , Radcliffe switched his a[MASK]legiance to Labour , cit[MASK]ng disappointment with [MASK]he performance of Nick Clegg and the Lib Dems in government , and approving of the Labour leader , Ed Miliband . In September 2015 , he end[MASK]rsed Jeremy Corbyn in the 2015 leadership contest to succeed Miliband . He is a supporter of a British republic . At [MASK]he age of sixteen , Radcliffe became the youngest non @-@ royal ever to have an individual portrait in Britain 's National Portrait Gallery ( NPG ) . On 13 April 2006 his portrait , drawn by Stuart Pearson Wright , was unveiled as part of a ne[MASK] exhibition opening at[MASK]the Royal National Theatre ; it was then moved to the NPG where it resides . 
 Speaking out agai[MASK]st homophobia , Radcliffe began filming public service ann[MASK]uncements in 2009 for The Trevor Project , promoting awareness of gay teen sui[MASK]ide prevention [MASK] He first learned of the organisation [MASK]hile working on Equus on Broadway[MASK]in 2008 and has contributed financially to it . " I have always h[MASK]ted a[MASK]ybody who is not tolerant of gay [MASK]en or lesbians [MASK]r bisexuals . Now I am in the[MASK]very[MASK]fortunate positi[MASK]n where I can actually help or do something about it , " he said in a 2010 interview . In the same interview , he spoke of the importance of pu[MASK]lic figures advocating for equal rights . Radcliffe co[MASK]siders his involvement to be one of the most important things in his career and , for his work for the organisation , he was given the " Hero[MASK]Award " in 2011 . 
 Rad[MASK]liffe has supported various charities . He designed the [MASK]u @-@ Bed for Habitat 's VIP Kids range ( a cube made of eight [MASK]maller ones which can be mad[MASK] into a bed , chaise @-@ longue or [MASK]hair ) with all the royalties from the sale of the bed going directly to his favourite charity , Demelza House Children 's Hospice in Sittingbourne , Kent . Radcliffe has urged his fans[MASK]to make donations , in lieu of Ch[MASK]istmas presents to him , to the charity 's [MASK]andle for Care program . In 2008 he was among several celebrities who donated their old glasses to an exhibit honouring v[MASK]ctims of the[MASK]Holocaust . During the Broadway[MASK]run of Equus he auctioned off a pair of jeans and other items worn in the show , for [MASK]ew @-@ York @-@ based Broadway [MASK]ares / Equity Fights AIDS. and presentin[MASK] at the 2011 Gypsy of the Year competition . H[MASK] has also donated money to Get Connected [MASK]K , a London @-@ based free confidential national helpline for troubled[MASK]youth . 
 Radcliffe is a f[MASK]n of the De[MASK]roit Red Wings of the National Hockey League . 
 
 = = Filmogr[MASK]ph[MASK] = [MASK] 
 
 
 = = Aw[MASK]rds and nominations = = 
 
 
 
 =[MASK]... Thirteen Years Later = 
 
 " ... Thirteen Years Later " is t[MASK][MASK] fifth episode of the[MASK]third season of the American crime @-@ thriller television s[MASK]ries Millennium . It premiered o[MASK] the Fox network [MASK]n Octo[MASK]er 30 , 1998 . The episode was written by Michae[MASK] R. Perry , and directed[MASK]by[MASK]Thomas J. Wright . " ... Thirteen Years Later " featured guest appear[MASK]nces by the members of the b[MASK]nd Kiss , performing both a[MASK] themselves and as minor characters . 
 In this ep[MASK]sode , Federal Bureau of Investigation agents Frank Black ( Lance Henriksen ) and Emm[MASK] Hollis ( Kle[MASK] Scott ) investigate a [MASK]eries of murders on the set of a horror film — and realize that the p[MASK]oduction [MASK]s based on a case Black solved several years earlier . 
 " ... Thirteen Years Later " proved a difficult episode to produce , with filming req[MASK]iring a large number of shots to be completed and the script to be adjusted on short notic[MASK] . It has evoked[MASK]mixed responses fr[MASK]m critics [MASK] although the guest appearances by [MASK]he members of Kiss have been more universally criticized . 
 
 = = Plot = = 
 
 Federal Bureau of Investigat[MASK][MASK]n agents Frank Black[MASK]( Lance Henriksen ) and Emm[MASK] Hollis ( Klea Scott ) travel[MASK]to Travelers Rest [MASK] South Carolina to investigate the deaths of film director Lew Carroll ( Paul Stanl[MASK]y ) and Marta [MASK]anbury , the leading actress in his newest film . As the local sheriff guides Black and Hollis through the mur[MASK]er scene , Black realizes that the film is based on a real murder case he investig[MASK]ted thirteen years previously ; he is shocked to learn that the true st[MASK]ry [MASK]s being sensationalized for the screen . 
 The pair in[MASK]erview the cast and crew as suspects , dis[MASK]overing that many [MASK]ould benefi[MASK] from either of the deaths — producer Kenny Neiderman had bee[MASK] having an affair with Danbury ; Rowdy Beeman replaced Carroll as director ; Rub[MASK] Dahl and Ramona Tangent , whose roles in the film will expand wit[MASK]out Danbury ; and Mark Bianco , a method actor relishing the opportunity to meet Black , whose role he plays . Also questioned is Hugo Winston , the man whose partner was murdered in the earlier case and who is campaigning against what he sees as a disrespectful production . 
 The production [MASK]ontinues , and after th[MASK] filming of a pool sc[MASK]ne the crew gather[MASK]in cate[MASK]ing ; Beeman discovers a severed finger in his sandwich , recognizing from its ring that it belonged to Niederman . When[MASK]the sheriff shuts down production , Black theorizes that the killer may [MASK]arget the crew 's hotel ; he[MASK]and Hollis arrive to f[MASK]nd the body of the [MASK]ilm 's publicist hanging from a rope . Th[MASK] next day , a film extra[MASK]( Gene Simmons ) con[MASK]esse[MASK] to the [MASK]illings ; Bla[MASK]k[MASK]pokes holes in[MASK]his story and discovers he is not a credible perpetrator . Regardless , production is resumed — and shortly afterwards , several crew members are found with their throat[MASK] cut , while Winston 's body hangs nearby in an a[MASK]parent murder @-@ suicide . 
 Black doubts that Winsto[MASK] is the killer , and while Hollis stays in the h[MASK]tel , he visits the production 's climactic shoot , set during a perfor[MASK]ance by the band Kiss . As he looks around him , the sheriff 's body is thrown down from the rafters ; as the pandem[MASK]niu[MASK][MASK]settles , Black realizes that horror films [MASK]nd with the leading l[MASK]dy being targeted — the killer is after Hollis . Racing back to her hotel , Black disco[MASK]er Holli[MASK] fending [MASK]ff a chainsaw @-@ wielding Bia[MASK]co . Black is a[MASK]le to subdue Bia[MASK]co [MASK]fte[MASK] Hollis disables the chainsaw ; the actor then explains that he lacked Black 's insight and had to commit the crimes i[MASK] order to see thr[MASK]ugh the eyes of a killer . 
 
 = = Production = = 
 
 " ... Thirteen Years Later " is the second episode of Millennium to have been written by Michael R. Perry , who had previously penned the second season episode " The[MASK][MASK]ikado " , and would provide a further three scripts in the third seaso[MASK][MASK]. The episode was directed by Thomas J. Wright , who helmed a total of twenty @-@ six episodes across all three seasons . Wright would also go on to direct[MASK]" Millennium " , the series ' crossover episode with its sister show The X @-@ Files . 
 The episode features guest appearances by the members of the band Kiss — Peter Criss , Ace [MASK]rehle[MASK] , Gene Simmons and Paul Stanley —[MASK]who each portray bot[MASK] themselves and a sm[MASK]ll cam[MASK]o role . However , the band members[MASK]insisted dur[MASK]ng filming that the[MASK]r roles be[MASK]given an equal amount of dialogue , which led to Perry being asked to amend scenes on short notice and fax updated scripts to the shooting locations ; ultimately m[MASK]c[MASK] of this additional material was filmed but not used in the episode . Ace Frehley was also [MASK]n[MASK]nt[MASK][MASK]siastic towards his role[MASK], and requested to play a " 300 @-@ pound black man " instead , wishing to w[MASK]ar a fat suit like those used in the 1996 Eddie Murphy film The Nutty Professor ; he was eventually convinced that such a suit would take too long to fabricate . 
 Perry has descr[MASK]bed the production " ... Thirteen Ye[MASK]rs Later " as being " one of the most gruelling " of the series ' r[MASK]n , citing [MASK]ts abundance [MASK]f stunt work and physical effects as the cause of this . Perry praised Wright for his ability to direct the episode within the usual tim[MASK] con[MASK]traints , as he felt the number of shots involved was more akin to a feature[MASK][MASK]ilm than a television episode . Gu[MASK]st star Jeff Yaghe[MASK] , who played killer Mark Bianco , is [MASK]he husba[MASK]d of actress Megan Gallagher , who star[MASK]ed in the first two seasons of Millennium as Black 's wife Catherine . 
 
 = = Br[MASK]adcast and recep[MASK]ion = = 
 
 "[MASK]... Thirteen Years Later " was first broadca[MASK]t on the [MASK]ox network on October 30 , 19[MASK]8 . The episode earned a Nielsen rating of 5 @.@ 4 [MASK]uring its original broadcast , meaning t[MASK]at 5 @.@ 4 percent of households in the United States viewed the episode . This represented ap[MASK]roximately 5 @.[MASK] 3[MASK] million households . 
 " ... Thirteen Years Later " received mi[MASK]ed reviews from critics . The A.V. Club 's Todd VanDerWerff rated the episode a " B " . VanDerWerff felt tha[MASK] the episode[MASK]'s comedic slant was necessary within the wider series , as he considered Millennium 's dark tone to be prone to unintentional comedy and that a comic episode provided an outlet for this . VanDerWerff found the script to[MASK]be at its strongest when satirizing the character of Frank Blac[MASK] , but[MASK]admitted that it " falls apart [MASK] when att[MASK]mpting to[MASK]send up other [MASK]ubjects ; he also felt t[MASK]at the guest appearance b[MASK] K[MASK]ss felt unnecessary and contrived . Robert Shearman and Lars Pearson , in their book Wanting to Believe : A Critical Guide to The X @-@ Files , Millennium & The Lone Gunmen , rated " ... Thirteen Years Later " one star out of five . Shearman felt that the episode [MASK]ad the potential to be much b[MASK]tter , but that " the whole concept drowns in overkill " . He considered [MASK]he [MASK]pisode 's characters to too shallow and its commentary to be too heavy @-@ handed to fully[MASK]execute anything meaningful ; criticism was also levelled at the guest roles by the memb[MASK]rs o[MASK] Kiss . 
 
 
 = New Jersey Route 29 = 
 
 Route 29 is [MASK] state highway in the[MASK]U.S. state of New Jersey . It runs 34 @.@ 76 mi ( 55 @.@ [MASK]4 km ) from an interchange with Interstate 295 ( I @-@ 295 ) in Hamilton Township in Mercer County , where it continues as I @-@ 195 , to R[MASK]ute 12 ( Bridge Stre[MASK]t / Race Street ) in Frenchtown , Hunterdon County . Between the southern terminus [MASK]nd I @-@ 95 ,[MASK]the route is a mix o[MASK] freeway and four @-@ lane divided h[MASK]ghway that runs along the Delaware Ri[MASK]er through Trenton . This sect[MASK]on includes a truck @[MASK]@ restricted tunnel that was built along the river near his[MASK]oric houses and Riverview Cemetery . North of I @-@ 95 , Route 29 turns into a scenic an[MASK] mostly two @-@ lane highway . Nort[MASK] of the South Trenton Tunnel , it is designated the Delaware River [MASK]cenic Byway , a New Jersey Scenic Byway and National Scenic Byway , that follows the D[MASK]laware River in mostly rural sections of Mercer County and Hunterdon County . The obsolete Delawar[MASK] & Raritan Canal usually stands between the river and the highway . Mo[MASK]t [MASK]ections of this portion of Route 29 are completely shaded due to the tree canopy . Route 29 also has a spur , Route 129 , which co[MASK]nects Route 29 to U.S. Route 1 ( US 1 ) in Trenton . 
 Route 29 was initially designated in 1927 to run from downtown Trenton t[MASK] Newark , following present @-[MASK] day Route[MASK]179 and US 202 between Lambertville and Somerville and US 22 between Some[MASK]ville and Newark . The route [MASK]etween Lambertville and Frenchtown was originally Route 29A . In 1953 , Route 2[MASK] was shifted to follow the alignment of Route 29A [MASK]o a[MASK]oid the concurrencies wi[MASK]h the U.S. Routes . Route 29 between South Warren S[MASK]reet in Trenton and I @-@ 95 in Ewing[MASK]Townshi[MASK] was upgraded to a four @-@ lane highway , with a portion of freeway , in the 1950s and 1960[MASK] . In 1995 , the southern freeway part of Route 29 between I @-@ 195 / I[MASK]@-@ 295 and Route 129 in Hamilton Township was com[MASK]leted . This freeway section was linked to the rest of Route 29 by a tunnel completed in 2002 . A realign[MASK]ent of Route 29 in Lambertville by the 2000s made the route concurrent with the entire length of 0 @.@ 26 @[MASK]@ mile @-@ long ( 0 @.@ 42 km ) Route 165 . 
 
 = = Route description = = 
 
 
 = = = Mercer County = = = 
 
 Route 29 begins at a modified cloverleaf interchange with Interst[MASK]te 195 and Inter[MASK]tate 295 in Hamilton Township , and it serve[MASK] as the western continuation of Interstate 195 , heading to the northwest as a six @-@ lane freeway [MASK] The route interchanges with Route 129 , a spur of Route 29 whi[MASK]h conne[MASK]ts to U.S. Route 1 , at a partial in[MASK]erchange with a northbound exit and southbound entrance . Rou[MASK]e 29 narrows to four lanes past this interchange and cr[MASK]sses int[MASK] Trenton . The route comes to a southbound exit and entrance for Lamberton Road . At this point , Route 29 becomes t[MASK]e D[MASK]laware River Scenic Byway , a state scenic byway that was also de[MASK]ignated a National S[MASK]enic Byway in 2009 [MASK] Route 29 runs along the bank of the Delaware River a[MASK]d enters a truck @-@ restricted tunnel that passes by historic hou[MASK]es and [MASK]iverview Cemetery . Within this tunnel , Route 29 features a southbound exit and northbound entranc[MASK] for Lalor Street . The route emerges from the tunnel as the John Fitch Parkway , passes by[MASK]Arm & Hamme[MASK] Park , and comes to a traffic light at Thunder Road / Cass Street where it widens back to six lanes . Route 29 meets South Warren Street at another traffic light . The median widens and it passes u[MASK]der the Morris[MASK]ille @-@ Trenton Railroad Bridge[MASK], which carries the Amtrak North[MASK][MASK]st Corridor over the Delaware River . 
 Route 29 passes unde[MASK] the[MASK]Trenton @-@ Morrisv[MASK]lle Toll Bridge , which carries U.S. Route 1 over the Delaware River . Access to[MASK]U.S. Route 1 southbound is provided by ramps from Route 29 while access t[MASK] Route 29 from northbound U.S. Route 1 is provided by South Warren Street [MASK][MASK]Route 29 pas[MASK]es under the Lower Trento[MASK] Brid[MASK]e and the median narrows again . I[MASK] interchanges w[MASK]th Market[MASK]Str[MASK]et , which provides access to Route 33 , and then features [MASK]n int[MASK]rchange which pro[MASK]ides access to the [MASK]ew Jersey [MASK]tate House with a [MASK]orthbound exit and southbound entrance . Route 29 crosses the Assunpink Creek and features an interchange which provides access to South Warren Street[MASK]with exits in both dire[MASK]tions but only a northbound en[MASK]rance . Rou[MASK]e 29 continues to a cloverleaf interchange with Calhoun Street ( [MASK]ounty Route 653 ) , which provides access to the Calhoun Street [MASK]ridge over the Delaware River . Riverside Avenue exits as a frontage road paralleling the northbou[MASK]d lanes of Route 29 before the road features a northbound exi[MASK] for Hermitage Avenue . Rou[MASK]e 29 [MASK]omes to a partial interchange with Parkside Avenue ,[MASK]with a northbound exit and southbound entrance , and then features a northbound exit for South Eastfield Avenue . 
 The freeway portion of Route 29 ends at the intersection with Lee Aven[MASK]e and it[MASK]continues northwest [MASK]long the Delaware River as a four @-@ lane divid[MASK]d highway . The route meets t[MASK]e southern terminus of County Route 579 ( Sullivan Way ) . The median widens again and then narr[MASK]ws as the route meets the southern terminus of Route 175 , a for[MASK]er alignment of Route 29 that [MASK]urrently serves[MASK]as a frontage road . Route 29 crosses i[MASK]to Ewing Township and becomes [MASK]he Daniel Bray Highway . It passes under the West Trenton Railroad Bridge , which carries CSX and SEPTA ’ s West Trenton Line over the Delaware River . Rou[MASK][MASK] 29 intersects Route 175 again and then comes to a complex in[MASK]erchange with Interstate 95 , with the ramps wi[MASK]hin the median of Route 29 , just to the east of the Scu[MASK]der Falls Bridge . 
 Upon crossing the Delaware and Raritan Canal , Route 29 narrows down to a two @-@ lane undiv[MASK]ded road called River Road . It continues along the Delaware River , next to the D[MASK]laware and Raritan Canal , which runs between Route 29 and the river . The route intersects the northern terminus of Route 175 . Farther north , [MASK]oute 29 enters Hopewe[MASK]l Township a[MASK]d [MASK]ontinues int[MASK] a more rural setting s[MASK]aded with tr[MASK]es . Route 29 heads to Washington Crossing State Park , where it inters[MASK]cts County Route 546 , which heads east on Washington Crossing @-@ Pennington Road , and the approach to the Washington Crossing Bridge ,[MASK]which continues into Pennsylvania as Pennsylvania [MASK]oute 532 . Route 29 continues north along the Delaware River through Titusville , passing by [MASK]ashington Crossing State Park . 
 
 = = = Hunterdon County = = = 
 
 Route 29 crosses into West Amwell Township in Hunterdon County . It enters Lambertville , where Route 29 becomes a f[MASK]ur @-@ lane divided highway . At the inters[MASK]c[MASK]ion[MASK]of South Main St[MASK]eet , Route 29 becomes concurrent with Route 165 . The route becomes a[MASK] undivided highway again and meets the western terminus of County Route 518 ( [MASK]runswick Street ) . It meets Route 179 ( Bridge Street ) , where Route 165 ends and Route 29 turns west for a one @-@ block wro[MASK]g @-@ way concurrency with the two @-@ lane , undivided Route 179 , lasting to the intersection of Main Street , where Route 29 turns north on Main Street . 
 Route 29 follows Main Street nort[MASK] through Lambertville , cro[MASK]sing into Delaware Township . It comes to an interchange with [MASK].S. Route 202 just east of the[MASK]New Hope @-@ La[MASK]bertville Toll Bridge , with access to northbound U.S. Route 2[MASK]2 and from southbound U.S. Route 202 provided by way of Al[MASK]xauken Creek Road . Route 29 continues[MASK]along the Delaware River and en[MASK]ers S[MASK]ockton . The route intersects Brid[MASK]e Street , wh[MASK]ch crosses the Delaware River on the Centre Br[MASK]dge @-@ Stockton[MASK]Bridge and continues into [MASK]ennsylvania [MASK]s Pennsylva[MASK]ia Route 263 . Shortly after[MASK]that intersection , Route 29 intersects the southern terminus of County Route 523 ( Stockton @-@ Flemington Road ) . Route 29 crosses b[MASK]ck into Delaware Township , where it meets[MASK]the south[MASK]rn terminus of County Route 519 ( Kingwood @-@ Stockt[MASK]n Road ) . 
 Route 29 makes a sharp left turn and heads west along the river as a rur[MASK]l road , crossing into Kingwood Township , where the name[MASK]of the road changes from Main Street to Daniel Bray Highway . Here , it intersects with[MASK]County Route 651 ([MASK]Byram[MASK]@-@ Kingwood Road ) . The route bends to the north and continues along the Delaware River for several miles[MASK], crossing into Frenchtown , where the route becomes Trenton Road . Upon entering Frenchtown , an end shield for northbound Route 29 is posted to mark the end of state[MASK]maintenance , which officially en[MASK]s at the Washington Street intersection , where maintenance is transferred to the county . Despite t[MASK]is , Ro[MASK]te 29[MASK]officially continu[MASK]s farther north along Trenton Road to its northern terminus at Route [MASK]2 ( B[MASK]idge Street / Race S[MASK]reet ) , a short distance east o[MASK] Route 12[MASK]’ s wester[MASK] terminus at the Uhlerstown @-@ French[MASK]own Bridge . The southern ter[MASK]inus of County Route 513 is located[MASK]a block north of the northern terminus of Route 29 along Route 12 . 
 
 = = History = = 
 
 The current route was originally legislated in 1911 as p[MASK]rt of the Delaware River Drive , a n[MASK]med state highway that was proposed to run from along the Delaware River from Trenton to[MASK]the New York border in Montague Township . R[MASK]ute 29 was originally defined in 1927 to run from Trenton to Newark . The original route ra[MASK] from downtown Trenton along State Street and Sanhican Drive . From there , it followed its current alignment to Lambertville , where it followed present @-@ day Route 179 to Ringoes to present @-@ da[MASK] County Route 514 , which it followed to Woods Tave[MASK]n . The route turned north on U.S. Route 206 ( also designated Route 31 ) and followed that route to Somerville , wh[MASK]re it followed[MASK]U.S. Route 22 to Newark . The current alignment of Rou[MASK]e 29 from Lambertville to Route 12 in Frenchtown was designated Route 29A in [MASK]927 . 
 The alignment of Route 29 between Ringoes and Somerville [MASK]as eventually shifted to follo[MASK] present @-@ day U.S. Route 202 , which was also Route 30 ( now Route 31 ) between Ringoes and Flemington and Route 12 betwee[MASK] Fl[MASK]mington and Somerville . In 1938 , Route 29B was planned as an extension of Route 29A from Frenchtown to Route 28 ( now Route 122 ) in Alpha . While this road was never built , much of the alignment north of Milford is served by County Route [MASK]19 . In 1948 , a spur route , Route S29 , was created , running along U.S. Route 202 ( Bridge Street ) in Lambertville to the New Hope @-@ Lambertville Bridge . In the 1[MASK]53 New Jersey state highway renumbering , Route 29 was redefined to [MASK]ontinue north from Lambertville to Frenchtown on Route 29A , and the Route 29 designation between Lambertville and N[MASK]wark was removed in favor of U.S. Route 202 betw[MASK]en Lambertville[MASK]and Somerville and U.S. Route 22 between Somerville and Newark . The section of former Route 29 between Route 29A and Route S29 became Route [MASK]65 . 
 Plans for a limited @-@ access route along the Route 29 corridor go back to 1932 , when a parkway[MASK]was proposed along the Delaware River between Trenton and L[MASK]mbertville ; this proposal never materialized . Plans for a freeway were resurrected in the early 1950[MASK] to construct a road , the John Fitch Park[MASK]ay , that was to run from Hami[MASK]ton Township to Interstate [MASK]5 in Ewing Township . [MASK]his road was bui[MASK]t between [MASK]954 and 1957 from South Warren Street in Trento[MASK] to present @-@ day Interstate 95 in Ewing Township . Construction of this portion John Fitch Parkway took up much of Trenton ’ s [MASK]va[MASK]lable waterfront along the Delaware River . The former alignment of Route 29 in the nort[MASK]ern part of Trenton and in Ewing Town[MASK]hip became Route 175 . 
 Between 1990 and 1995 , the Rout[MASK] 29 freeway was built between the Interstate 195 / Interstate 295 interchange and Route 129 in Hamilton Town[MASK]hip . A two @-@ lane street , Lamberton Road , connected the two freeway sections . Plans were then made to fill the gap between the two freeway sections in Trenton . Construction began in 1997 on the Route 29 fr[MASK]eway between Rou[MASK]e 129 and the Morrisv[MASK]lle @-@ Trenton Railroad Bridge . The road was to include two traffic lights at Cass Street and South Warren Street and a tunnel which was to be built as a covered roadway on the bank of the Delaware River . The tu[MASK]nel was originally schedul[MASK]d to be complete by [MASK]001 but was delayed[MASK]after the Army Corps of Engineer[MASK] discovered many environmental violations[MASK]that occurred with construction of the tunnel .[MASK]The roof w[MASK]s put in place in October 2001 and the tunnel of[MASK]icially opene[MASK] to traffic on March 2 [MASK] 2002 . A restriction to trucks over[MASK]13 tons was put in place and made permanent in November 2002 . 
 By the 2000s , the[MASK]state gave the part of Route 29 ( South Main Street ) between Route 165 and Route 179 in Lambertville to the city , and Ro[MASK]te 29 was rerouted to use a[MASK]l of Route 165 and one block of Route 179 . [MASK]rior to this , South Main Street had been turned one @-@ way southbound . Route 165 , which is only signed on overhead street signs , still exists , though it is fully concurrent with Route 29 . 
 
 = = Major intersections = = 
 
 
 
 = First Mongol invasion of Burma = 
 
 The[MASK]first Mongol [MASK]nvasions of[MASK]Burma ( Myanmar ) ( Burmese : မွန ် ဂို – မြန ် မာ စစ ် ( ၁၂၇၇ – ၁၂၈၇ ) )[MASK][MASK]ere a series o[MASK] military[MASK]conflicts between Kubl[MASK]i Khan 's [MASK]uan dynasty , division of the Mongol Empire , and the Pagan Empire that took place between 1277 and 1287 . The invasions toppled the 250 @-@ year @-@ old Pagan Empire , and the Mongol army seized Pagan te[MASK]ri[MASK]ories in prese[MASK]t @-@ day Dehong , Yunnan and northern Burma to Tagaung . The invasions ushered in 250 ye[MASK]rs of political fragmentation in Burma and the[MASK]rise of Tai @-@ [MASK]han states throughout mainland Southeast Asia . 
 [MASK]he Mongols fir[MASK]t demanded tribute from Pagan in 1271 – 72 , as part of their drive to encircle the Song dynasty of China . When King Narathihapate refused , Emperor Kublai Khan himself sent another mission in 1273[MASK], again demanding tribute . It too was rejected . In 1275 , the emperor ordered the Yunnan government to s[MASK]cure the border[MASK]an[MASK]s in order to block an escape path for the Song ,[MASK]and permitted a limite[MASK] border war if Pagan contested . Pagan did contest but i[MASK]s army was driven back at [MASK]he frontier[MASK]by the Mongol Army in 1277 – 78 . Af[MASK]er a brief lull , Kublai [MASK]han in 1281 turned his attention to Southeast Asia , demanding tribute from Pagan , the Khmer Empire , Đại Việt and Champa . When the B[MASK]rmese king again refus[MASK]d , the emperor ordered an invasion of northern Burma . Two dry se[MASK]son campaigns ( 1283 – 85 ) later , the Mongols[MASK]had occupied down to Taga[MASK]ng and Hanlin[MASK], forcing the Burmese king to flee to Low[MASK]r Burma . The Mongols organized northern Burma as the province of Zhengmian . 
 Ceasefire negotiations began in 1285 , and ended with Narathihapate[MASK]finally agreeing to submi[MASK] in June 1286 . The Burmese embassy , received by the emperor in Beijing in January [MASK]287 , agreed to a treaty that acknowledged [MASK]he suz[MASK]rainty of the Yuan dynasty or the Mongol Empire over the Pagan Empire and annual payments in taxes to the Yunnan government in [MASK]xchange for the evacuation of[MASK]Mongol troops from northern Burma . But the treaty never really took effect as Narathihapate was assassin[MASK]ted in July 1[MASK]87 , and no authority who could honor the treaty emerged . The Mongol command at Yunnan now deemed the imperial order[MASK]to withdraw[MASK]void , and ordered an invasion of central Burma . They may not have reached Pa[MASK]an , and even if they did , a[MASK]ter having suffered heavy [MASK]asualties , they returned to Tagaung . 
 Th[MASK] Pagan Empire disintegrated and an[MASK]rchy ensued . The Mongols , who probably preferred the[MASK]situation , did nothing to restore order in the next ten years . In Mar[MASK]h 1297 , they accepted the voluntary submission of King Kyawswa of Pagan although he control[MASK]ed little beyond the capital city of Pagan ( Bagan ) . But Kyawswa was overthrown nine months later ,[MASK]and the Mongols were forced to intervene , leading to their second invasio[MASK] i[MASK] 1300 – 01 . 
 Marco Polo reported the first invasions ( 1277 – 87 ) in his travelog[MASK]e , Il Milione . The Burmese referr[MASK]d to the invaders as the Taruk ( after the central Asian Turkic tr[MASK]ops that largely made up the Mongol invasion[MASK]army ) ; today , the term[MASK]Taruk ( တရုတ ် ) refers to the Han Chinese instead . King Narathihapate is unkindly remembered in Burmese h[MASK]story as Taruk @-@ Pye Min , ([MASK]" the King who Fled fro[MASK] the Taruk " ) . 
 
 = = Background = = 
 
 
 = = = Pagan and Dali = = = 
 
 In the 13th century[MASK], the Pagan Empire , along with the Khmer Empire [MASK] was one of the two main empires in mainland Southeast Asia . For much of its history , Pagan 's neighbor to the northeast was not China but the independent Dali Kingdom and its predecessor Nanzhao , both with Dali as their capital city . Dali @-@ based kingdoms were a power[MASK]in their own right , at times allying themselves with the Tibetan Empire to their [MASK]est and at other time[MASK] wit[MASK] China 's Tang and Song dynasties . Ind[MASK]ed , Nanzhao 's mounted armies ve[MASK]tured deep into what is today Burma and may have been behi[MASK]d the founding of th[MASK] medieval city of [MASK]agan and the Pagan Dynasty itself . 
 Between the newly conquered Mongol territory and Pagan were a wide swat[MASK] of borderlands stretching from present @-@ day Dehong , Baoshan and Lincang prefectures in Yunnan as well as [MASK]he Wa and Palaung regions ( presumably in present @-@ day northern [MASK]han State ) , which Pagan and Dali had both claimed and exercised overlapping spheres of influence . Then as now , the borderlands mostly consist of forbidding terrains of high mount[MASK]in ranges . 
 
[MASK]= = = Mongol conquest of Dal[MASK] = = = 
 
 The Mongol Empire first arrived at the doorstep of the Pagan Empire in 1252 by invading the Dali Kingdom in its attempt to outflank Song China . The Mongol armies captured the capital , Dali , on 7 January 1253 , and wen[MASK] on to pacify much of the kingdom by 1257 . 
 The arrival of the Mongols did not initially upset the existing order at the borderlands as the Mongols were intent o[MASK] finishing off[MASK]the Song . For the next dozen years , they consolidated their hold over the newly conquered land , which not only provide[MASK] them with a base from which to attack the Song from the rear but also w[MASK]s strate[MASK]ically located on the trade route[MASK] from China to Burma and India . The Mongols set up military garrisons , mann[MASK]d mostly by Turkic @-@ speaking Muslims from Central Asia [MASK] in 37 ci[MASK]cui[MASK]s[MASK]of the form[MASK]r[MASK]Dali Kingdom . 
 
 = = [MASK] Decl[MASK]ne of Pagan = = = 
 
 By then , the Pagan Empire , despite o[MASK]tward appearances of calm , had b[MASK]en in long an[MASK] slow decline since the [MASK]arly 13th century . The continuous growth of tax @-@ free[MASK]religious wealth [MASK]ad greatly reduced the tax base of the kingdom . The crown had lost resources needed to retain the loyalty of courtiers [MASK]nd military servicemen , inviting a vicious circle of internal disor[MASK]ers and external challenges . Although it was able to put down the f[MASK]rst batch of serious rebellions in 1258 – 60 in [MASK]outh Arakan and Martaban[MASK]( Mottama ) , the decline continued . On the eve of the Mongol invasions , be[MASK]ween one[MASK]and two @-@ thirds of Upper Burma '[MASK] cultivable land had been donated to relig[MASK]on . The crown 's ability to mobilize defenses was in serious jeopardy . 
 [MASK] = = Prelude to war = = 
 
 
 = = = First Mongol mission ( [MASK]271 – 72 ) [MASK] = = 
 
 [MASK]he period of c[MASK]lm for Pagan ended in the early 1270s . By then , the Song were on the ro[MASK]es , and Em[MASK]eror Kublai Khan , who officially founded the Yuan dynasty on 18 December 1271 , sought to cut off th[MASK] retreat of Song refugees in all[MASK]direct[MASK]ons . In Pagan 's case , he had ordered[MASK]the [MASK]ongol governor of Dali to tighte[MASK] control of th[MASK] borderlands , and [MASK]n January 1271 to send a mission [MASK]o [MASK]agan to demand tribute . The tribute he demanded was nominal . Given his higher priority preoccupations elsewhere , the emperor was not looking to repl[MASK]ce the regime at Pagan . At the border , the ruler of the Wa and Palaung region[MASK] submitted to the Mongols . 
 When the Mo[MASK]gol[MASK]envoys led by Qidai Tuoyin showed up , the Pagan court led by Chief Minister Ananda Pyissi was well aware of the military power of the Mongols and advised King Narathihapate to use diplomacy . The ki[MASK]g was furious at the demand and ke[MASK]t t[MASK]e Mongol envoys waiting for weeks . The court finally devised a compromise : the[MASK]envoys[MASK]were sent back without ever seeing the king[MASK][MASK] Accompanying them was a Burmese envoy who carried a letter expressing fri[MASK]ndly sentiments and the [MASK]urmese king 's wish to one day worship a Buddha tooth at Beijing . The king then promptly ordered an expediti[MASK]n , which retook the rebellious borderland [MASK]egions in April 1272 . The rebel le[MASK]der A @[MASK]@ Pi ( အပိ ) was brought back to Pagan . Dali relayed the news to Beijing but [MASK]id not carry out any milit[MASK]ry[MASK]acti[MASK]n . 
 
 = = = [MASK]econd Mongol mission ( 1273 ) = = = 
 
 At Beijing , Kublai Khan , who[MASK]was preparing an invasion of Japan , de[MASK]ided again[MASK]t a war with Pagan — for the time being . On 3 March 1273 , he sent [MASK] 4 @-[MASK] member d[MASK]legation led by an imperial ambassador , the First[MASK]Secretary to the Board Rites , to Pagan . The delegation carried a letter from the emperor . Th[MASK] [MASK]et[MASK]er says : 
 " If you have finally decided to fulfill your du[MASK]ies towards the All [MASK]-@ Highest , send one of your brothers or senior ministers [MASK] to show men that all the world is linked with U[MASK] , and enter into a perpetual alliance . This will add to your reputation , and be in your own interests ; for if it com[MASK]s to war , who will be the victor ? Ponder w[MASK]ll , O king , Our words . " 
 This time , the Burmese k[MASK]ng received the imperial envoys b[MASK]t still refused to sub[MASK]it . ( [MASK]he Burmese chronicles say that the king was so insult[MASK]d that he had th[MASK] envoys executed . But both Burm[MASK]se inscriptional evidence and Yuan records indicate that the envoys were not executed . ) At any rate , the imperial envoys did not get back to Yun[MASK]an in due time . The newly formed Yunnan g[MASK]vernment sent another delegation to inve[MASK]tigate the whereabouts of the delegation , but the delegation could not reach Pagan because of an ongoin[MASK] rebellion en [MASK]oute . 
 
 =[MASK]= = Mongol consolidation of borderlands ( 1[MASK]75 – 76 ) = = = 
 
 Meanw[MASK]ile , in 1274 , the former Dali Kingd[MASK]m was officially reorganized as the Province of [MASK]unnan , with Sayyid Ajjal Shams[MASK]al @-@ Din Omar a[MASK] governor . In May 1275 , the governor sent a report to the emperor stating that the em[MASK]assy had not returned ; that the Burmese evidently had no intention of submitting ; and[MASK]tha[MASK] war was the[MASK]only way forward . 
 But th[MASK] emperor rejected an outright invasion . Just coming off a disastrous Japanese campaign , the emperor was unwilling to commit the central [MASK]overnment troops to[MASK]what he considered a[MASK]low priority affair . He was now focu[MASK]ed on delivering the final blow against the Song ; the emperor ordered the Yunnan provincial army to s[MASK]cure the borderlands in order[MASK]to block the escape path of the Song refugees . H[MASK] also sanctioned a limited border war if P[MASK]gan contested the takeover . As planned , the Yunnan army proceede[MASK] to consoli[MASK]ate the borderlands in 1275 – 76 . ( Els[MASK]w[MASK]ere , the main Mongol armies had captured most of the Song territory by 1276 . ) 
 By 1277 , at least one Burmese vassal sta[MASK]e named " Gold Teeth " ( modern Yingjiang ) had submitted to the Mongols [MASK] Like in 1272 , the Burmese government responded by sending an army to [MASK]eclaim the rebellious state ; but un[MASK]ike in 1[MASK]72 , the Mongo[MASK]s had posted a sizable garrison there . Though it was ultimately under Mon[MASK]ol c[MASK]mmand , many of the officers and most of the soldiers of the garrison were Turkic @-@ speaking peoples or people from the further [MASK]est : [MASK]urks from Samarkand , Bukhara , Merv and Nishapur , but also captive soldiers from the Persian Khwarazmid empire , the Kipchaks , and even Bulgars from the lower Volga . 
 
 = = Borde[MASK] war ( 1277 – 78 ) = = 
 
 What followed was a border war in 1277 – 78 . It was repor[MASK]ed mainly in the Yuan dynasty chronicle and the travelogue of Marco Polo . Although the B[MASK]rmese chronicles have no record of the border war , a 1278 Burmese inscript[MASK]on mentions the army 's defeat at Ngasaunggyan . The Mongol accounts of the border war contain certain errors of location and numb[MASK]rs although the overall narrative is probably accurate . 
 
 = = = Battle of Ngasaunggyan = = = 
 
 According to the Yuan dynasty chronicle and Marco Polo 's accounts , a Burmese army " invaded " the Mongol territory of Gold Teeth , and was defeated by the Mongol army in April 1277 . The battle took place either at [MASK]he Vochang valley ( in pre[MASK]e[MASK]t @-@ day[MASK]Baoshan Prefecture ) or 110 km southwest at Kanngai ( present @-@ day Yingjiang , Dehong [MASK]refecture ) , [MASK]hich the Burmese called Ngasaun[MASK][MASK]yan . 
 The Yuan Ch[MASK]onicle reports that only 700 men defeated a Burmese army of 40 @,@ 000 to 50 @,@ 000 with 10 @,@ 000 horses and 800 elephants . It also reports o[MASK]ly one Mongol was kille[MASK] , in tryi[MASK]g to catch an elephant . According to Marco Polo , the Mongol army consisted of 12 @,@ 000 mounted archers , and the Burmese army number[MASK]d 60 @,@ 000 me[MASK] with 2000[MASK]elephants , " on each of which was set a tower of timber , well @-@ frame[MASK] and strong , and carryin[MASK] from 12 to[MASK]16 well @-@ armed fighting men . " Even then , the 40 @,@ 000 to 60 @,@ 000 figures of the Bur[MASK]ese army strength were likely eye estimates and may still be too hig[MASK] ; the Mongols may have erred " on the side of generosity " not to " diminish their glory in defeating superi[MASK][MASK] numbers . " 
 According to Marco Polo 's account ,[MASK]in the early stages of the batt[MASK]e , the Turkish and[MASK]Mongol horsemen " to[MASK]k such fright at the sight of the elephants that they would not be got to face the foe , but always swerved and turned back , " while the Bur[MASK]ese forces pressed on . But the Mongol commander Huthukh did not panic ; he ordered his troops [MASK]o dismount , and from the cover of the nearby treeline , aim their bows directly at the advancing elephants . The Mongol ar[MASK]hers ' arrows threw the animals into such pai[MASK] that they fled . 
 
 = = = Raid of Kaungsin = = = 
 
 The Mongol army pressed on after the monsoon sea[MASK]on . In the following dry season of 1277 – 78 , c . Dec[MASK]mber 1277 , a Mongol army of 3800 led by Nasr al @-@ Din , son of Gov. Sayyid Ajjal , advanced to Kaungsin , which defended the B[MASK]amo Pass . They occupied the fort and destroyed a larg[MASK] number of abandoned stockades . But they found the heat excessive and returned . 
 
 = = Interlude ( 1278 – [MASK]3 ) = = 
 
 Despite the Mongol military success , the control of the borderla[MASK]ds remained contested . Pagan [MASK]id not relinquish its cla[MASK]m to the frontier regions , an[MASK] the Burmese , app[MASK]rently taking advantage of Mongol preoccupations elsewhere , rebuilt their forts at Kaungsin and Ngasaunggyan later in 1278 , posting permanent garrisons commanded by Einda Py[MASK]ssi . But their co[MASK]trol was short @-@ lived . The Grea[MASK] Khan 's attention turned to Southeast Asia once more in 1281 . He ha[MASK] had mixed success : his vaunted[MASK]forces had fi[MASK]ished off the last of the Song in 1279 but had again failed to take Japan in 1281 . That year , the Mongol emperor sen[MASK] anothe[MASK] mission to[MASK]Pagan , demanding tribute yet again . T[MASK]e Burmese king was to send his ten senior ministers accompanied by one thousand cavalry officers to the emperor 's court . ( With Champa , the emperor summoned the king of Champa himself to Beijing . ) 
 At Pagan , Narathihapate[MASK]de[MASK]ibera[MASK]ed with his c[MASK]urt for an appropriate response but ultimately ref[MASK]sed to submit . The Burmese court may have been counting on another limited border war but the emperor now ordered an invasion of nort[MASK]ern Burma . ( He also ordered an invasion [MASK]f Champa , whose king too had refu[MASK]ed to submit . ) The Burmese king 's troubles did not go unnot[MASK]ced[MASK]elsew[MASK]ere in the kingdom . In the same year , a usurper named Wareru seized[MASK]the southern port city of Martaban ( Mottama ) by killing its Pagan @-@ appointed govern[MASK]r . Although the king 's three sons were vicer[MASK]ys of the nearby[MASK]Lower Burma cities ( in Bassein ( Pathein ) , Pro[MASK]e ( Pyay ) , and Dala ) , the king , preoccupied with much more serious threat in the north , did not ( or could not ) take any actio[MASK] on Martaban . 
 Throughout 1282 , the Mongol command[MASK]mad[MASK] preparations for the upcoming invasions of Champa and northern B[MASK]rma . The objective of the Burma campaign was to t[MASK]ke over northern Burma but no further ; the emperor did not sanction an attack on Pagan itself . At least one army consisted of 14 @[MASK]@ 000 men of the erstwhile Persian Khwarezmid [MASK]mpire under the command of Yalu Beg was sen[MASK] to Yunnan [MASK]o reinforce the Bu[MASK]ma invasion force , [MASK]hich again was made [MASK]p of Turks and other central Asians . On the Burmese side , the king ma[MASK]aged to r[MASK]ise an [MASK]rmy although giv[MASK]n his low standing with his vassals , he probably could not have raised a large one . By mid @-@ 1283 , a Burmese army led by generals Ananda Pyissi and Yanda Pyissi was deployed at a fort at Ngasaunggyan . 
 
 = = Invasion ( 1283 – 85 ) = = 
 
 
[MASK]= = = Battle of Ngasaunggyan ( 1283 ) = = = 
 
 The invasion began on 22 September 1283 . Prince Sangqudar was the commander @-@ in @-@ chief of the invasion force ; his deputies were Vice Governor Taipn , and commander Yagan[MASK]Tegin . T[MASK]e Mongol armies marched to the border in two columns . O[MASK]e column advanc[MASK]d along the Taping River using over 200 boats [MASK] the othe[MASK] proceeded by land and[MASK]joined the first column at the B[MASK]rmese fort at Ngasaunggyan .[MASK]The Burmese chronicles report an overwhel[MASK]ing number of Mongol forces laying [MASK]iege to the fort although their numbers are greatly [MASK]xaggerated . ( The chronicles say that the Burmese army numbered 400 @,@ 000 men while the [MASK]ongol army numbered 20 million men and 6 million horses . ) The Burmese withstood the siege for over two months but the fort fell on 3 December 1283 .[MASK]
 
 = = = Invasion of northern Burma = = = 
 
 The defeat at Ngasaunggyan broke the[MASK]back of[MASK]Burmese defenses . The Burmese army lost several t[MASK]ousand men as well [MASK]s sen[MASK]or commanders . Kaungsin ,[MASK]the next fort inline , fell just six days later on 9 December 1283 . The Mongol sourc[MASK]s say that the B[MASK]rmese los[MASK] 10 @,@ 000 men at Kaungsin . The Mongol armies pushed farther south i[MASK]to the Irrawaddy valley . They took the ancient Burmese capital of Tagaung , about 380 km north of Pagan on 5 February 1284 . Th[MASK]re , the invaders paused their adv[MASK]nce . They found the heat of t[MASK]e searing Irrawaddy valley excessive , and ev[MASK]cuated Tagaung , allowing the Burme[MASK]e to return to Tagaung on 10 May 1284 . But the Mongol army renewed their offensive in the following dry season . They re[MASK]ook Tagaung , and defeated an[MASK]ther Burme[MASK]e[MASK]stand south of Tagaung , probably near Hanlin , on 26 January 1285 , opening the way to Pagan , about 270 km south . After[MASK]the defeat , the king panicked , and fled to Lower Burma . The evacuation pr[MASK]ved premature . The M[MASK]ngol forces did not[MASK]advance on Pagan as it was not part of their invasion plan . 
 The country fel[MASK] in[MASK]o chaos . In Lower Burma , the king found himself isolated , let alone[MASK]pla[MASK] a counterattack . Although his sons ruled the key Lower Burma ports ( Prome , Dala and Bassein ) , the king did not trust any of the[MASK] , and he and his court settled at Hlegya , west of [MASK]rome . Without the[MASK]full support of his s[MASK]ns , the presence of the king and his small ar[MASK]y impressed no one . The governor of Pegu revolted that same year . The king managed to send two small expeditions to Pegu but they both fa[MASK]led . Now , the entire eastern half of Lower Burma ( Pegu and Martaban ) was in open revolt . 
 
 = = Peace negotiations ( 1285 – 87 [MASK] = = 
 
 
 = = = Ceasefire = = = 
 
 Given his[MASK][MASK]recarious position , Narathihapate decided to[MASK]buy time , and sue for peace with the Mo[MASK]gols . In November /[MASK]December 1285 , the king ordered his gener[MASK]ls Ananda Pyis[MASK]i and Maha Bo to enter into ceas[MASK]fire [MASK]egotiations . The Mongol commanders at Hanlin , who had organized northern Burma as a protectorate named Zhengmian ( Chine[MASK]e : 征緬 ; Wade – Giles : Cheng @-@ Mien ) , agreed to a ceasefire but ins[MASK]sted on a full submission . They repeated their 1281 demand that the Burmese king s[MASK]nd a [MASK]ormal delegation to [MASK]he emperor . [MASK]he two sides had reached [MASK] tentative agreeme[MASK]t by 3 March 1286 , which calls for a full submission of th[MASK] Pagan Empire , and central Burma to be organized as the province of Mianzhong ( Chinese : 緬中 ; Wade – Giles : Mien @-@ C[MASK]ung ) . After a long deliberatio[MASK] , the king agreed to submit but wanted the Mongol troops to withdraw . In June 1286 , he sent an embassy led by Shin Ditha Pamauk , [MASK] learned monk , to the emperor 's co[MASK]rt . 
 
 = = = Treaty of Beijing = = = 
 
 In January 1287 , the embassy arrived at B[MASK]ijing , and was received by the Yuan emperor . The Burmese delegat[MASK]on formally acknowledged Mongol suzerainty of their [MASK]ingdom , an[MASK] agreed to pay annual tribute tied to the agricultural output of the country [MASK] ( Indeed , the tribute was n[MASK] longer nominal . ) In exchange , the emperor a[MASK]reed to withdraw his tro[MASK]ps . For the emperor , the B[MASK]rma campaign was the only bright spot ; [MASK]is other Southeast Asian expeditions had [MASK]one badly . He did not want[MASK]to invest more troops pacify the rest [MASK]f the kingdom . He preferred[MASK]a vassal ruler . The Burmese embassy arrived back at Hlegya in May 1287 , and reported the terms to the king . 
 
 = = = Breakdown = = = 
 
 But [MASK]he agree[MASK]ent broke do[MASK]n a month l[MASK]ter . In late June , the defeated king and his small re[MASK]inue left their temporary capital for Pagan . But on 1 July 1287 , the king was c[MASK]ptured en route and assassinated by his second son T[MASK]ihathu , the Viceroy of Prome . Anarchy ensued . Each region in the country which had not[MASK]revolted broke away . No successor to Narathihap[MASK]te , who could honor and enforce the terms of the treaty of Beijing [MASK] emerged . Indeed , a ki[MASK]g would not emerge until May 1289 . 
 
 = = Mongol intervention ( 1287 ) = = 
 
 Given the chaos , the gove[MASK]nor of Yunnan ignored the imperial orders of [MASK]vacuation . The Mongol arm[MASK] commanded by Prince Ye @-@ sin Timour , a grandson of the emp[MASK]ror , marched south toward Pagan . According [MASK]o mainstr[MASK]am traditional ([MASK]British colonial era ) scholarship , the Mongol army ignored the imper[MASK]al orders to evacuate ; fought its way down to Pagan with the loss of 7000 men ; occupied the city ; and sent ou[MASK] detachments to receive homage , one of which reached south of Prome . But not all colonial period scholars agreed with the assessment as none of the contemporary Mongol / Chinese records specifical[MASK]y [MASK]entioned the conquest of Pagan or the temporary completeness of the conquest .[MASK]
 Recent [MASK]esearch shows that the Mongol forces most pr[MASK]bably never reached Pagan . They were held at [MASK]ay by the Burmese defenses led by commanders Athinkhaya , Yazathingyan[MASK]and Thihathu , and probably never got closer [MASK]han 160 km north of Pagan . ( An ins[MASK]ription dated 16 February 1293 by the three brothers claimed[MASK]that they defeated the Mongol army . ) Even if t[MASK]e Mongols did reach Pa[MASK]an , the damage they inflicted was probably minimal . At any rate , the Mongol army suffered heavy casualties , and retreated north to Tagaung . They remained there as the treaty was now void . 
 
 = = Aftermat[MASK] = [MASK] 
 
 The disintegration of the P[MASK]gan Empire was now complete [MASK] But the Mongols refused to fill in the power vacuum they had created . They would send no more expediti[MASK]ns to restor[MASK] [MASK]rder . The emperor apparently had no interest in committing troops that w[MASK]uld be required to pacify the fragmented country . [MASK]ndeed , h[MASK]s r[MASK]al aim all along may h[MASK]ve been "[MASK]to keep the entire region of South[MASK]ast Asia broken and fragmented[MASK]. " It would be another[MASK]two years until one of Narathihapate 's sons , Kyaws[MASK]a , emerged as king of Pagan in May 1289 . But the new " king " controlled just a small area aroun[MASK] the capita[MASK] , and had no real army . The real power in central Burma now reste[MASK] with the three commander brothers . 
 [MASK]he uneasy arrangement would persist until 1297 . The Mongols continued to occupy northern Burma to Tagaung as the province of Zhengmian ( Cheng @-@ Mien ) but ended the [MASK]iction[MASK]l central Burma p[MASK]ovince of Mianzhong on 18 August 1290 . Meanwhile , the power[MASK]struggle in central Burma continued with the three brothers bla[MASK]antly consolidating support . To che[MASK]k their rising pow[MASK]r , Kyawswa submitt[MASK]d to the Mongol[MASK] in January 1297 , and was re[MASK]ognized by[MASK]the Yuan emperor Temür Khan as King of Pagan on 20 March[MASK]1297 . The emperor al[MASK]o [MASK]ave Chinese titles to the brothers as subordinates of Kyawswa . The brother[MASK] resented the new arrangement as it directly reduced their power [MASK] On 17 December 1[MASK]97 , the three brothers overthrew Ky[MASK]wswa , and founded the [MASK]yinsaing Kingd[MASK]m . The dethronement forced the Mongol government to intervene again , leading[MASK]to the second Mongol i[MASK]vasion of Burma ( 1300 – 01 ) . The invasion failed . Two years [MASK]ater , on 4 April 1303 , the Mongols abolished the province of Zhengmian ( Cheng @-@ Mien ) , evacuated Tagaung , and ret[MASK]rned [MASK]o Yunnan [MASK] 
 
 = = Legacy = = 
 
 The w[MASK]r was one of several near simul[MASK]aneous wars waged by the Mongol Empire and t[MASK]e Yuan dynasty in the late 13th century . Thoug[MASK] it was never more than a [MASK]inor frontier war to the Mongols , the war s[MASK]t off a series of enduring developments in[MASK]Burma .[MASK]The invasions ushered in a perio[MASK] [MASK]f political fragmentation , and the rise of Tai @-@ Shan states throughout mainland Southeast Asia . 
 
 = = = Age o[MASK] political fragmen[MASK]ation = = = 
 
 The immediate result[MASK]of the war was the collapse of the Pagan Empire . However , the war merely accelerated the collapse but did not cause it . Pagan '[MASK] disintegration was " in[MASK]fa[MASK]t mor[MASK] p[MASK]olonged and agonized . " The kingdom had been in long gradual decline since the early 13th century . Had Pagan possessed a str[MASK]nger central government , the coll[MASK]pse could have been temporary , and the country “ could[MASK]have risen again ” . But[MASK]the dynasty could[MASK]not recover , and because the Mongols refused to fill the power vacuum , no viab[MASK]e center emerged in the immediate aftermath . As a result , several minor states fought it out for s[MASK]prema[MASK]y for the bet[MASK]er part of the 14th century . It wa[MASK] only in the[MASK]late 14th century that two relatively strong pow[MASK]rs emerged in the Irrawaddy basin , restoring some semblance of normalcy . The vast region surrounding the Irrawaddy valley would continue to be made up of several small Tai @-@ Sh[MASK]n states [MASK]ell in[MASK]o the 16th century . 
 
 = = = Ris[MASK] of Tai @-@ Shan states = = = 
 
 Perhaps the most enduring legacy of the Mongol invasions was the emergen[MASK]e of[MASK]Tai @-@ Shan states in mainland Southeast Asia[MASK]. The Tai @-@ Shan pe[MASK]ple who came down with the Mongol invasions stayed . By the early 14th century , sever[MASK]l Tai @-@ Shan states had come to dominate a vast [MASK]egion from pr[MASK]sent @-@ day Assam to northern and eastern Myanmar to northern and central Thailand and Laos . Their rise was encouraged by the Mongols , who viewed the states as a use[MASK]u[MASK] buff[MASK]r between Yunnan and [MASK]he rest of Southeast Asia . The Mongols , who were still trying to incorporate Yunnan into the central administrati[MASK]n , were unwilling or unable to make necessary sustained investments to bring the vast regions south of Yunnan into[MASK]the fold . ( The integration of Yunnan itself into “ Chin[MASK] Proper ” was to take several more centuries , [MASK]nd continues to today . ) As such , from the newly[MASK]formed Tai @-@ Shan states in w[MASK]stern and central Southeast Asia t[MASK] Dai Viet and Champa in eastern Southeast Asia , the Mongols elected to receive nomi[MASK]a[MASK] tri[MASK]ute [MASK] Though the [MASK]ulers of these st[MASK]tes were technically governors of the Yuan government , they were the native chieftains , “ who would have ruled there in any case , and they did as they pleased . ” 
 
 = = = Arrival of China on the Burmese border = = = 
 
 The war also marked the arrival of China at [MASK]he doorstep of Burma . The old Dali K[MASK]ngdom , known to the B[MASK]rmese as [MASK]andala[MASK]it[MASK]( ဂ[MASK] ္ တလရာဇ[MASK]် , after Gandhara Raj ) was now a Mongol Chinese province . ( The Burmese now called the new powers at Yunnan " Taruk " after the Turkic @-@ speaking sold[MASK]ers of Yunnan . Over the years , the term Taruk came to be used to refer to the Han Chinese . Today , King Narathihapate is remembered as Taruk @-@ Pye Min , ( " the King who [MASK]led from the Taruk [ Chinese ] ) . ) From a geopolitical standpoint [MASK] the Mongol – Chinese presence in Yunnan pushed the Shan migrations in t[MASK]e di[MASK]ection of Burma ( and parts of the Khmer Empire ) . The raids by various Shan states into Upper Burma would continue until the mid @-@ 16th century . 
 
 = = Mo[MASK]golia – Myanm[MASK]r relations = = 
 
 During the official visit by the President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj to Myanmar in Nove[MASK]ber 2013 ,[MASK]Aung San Suu Kyi , the chairperson of National League for Democracy , said this was the first ever Mongol mission since the Mongols came 730 years earlier . 
 
 
 = Battle of Edson 's Ridge =[MASK]
 
 The Battle of Edson 's Ridge , also known as[MASK]the Battle o[MASK] the Bloody Ridge , Battle of Raiders Ridge , a[MASK]d Battle of the Ridge , was a la[MASK]d battle of the Pacific campaign of World War II between Imperial Japanese Army and Allied ( mainly United States Marine Corps ) ground forces . It took place from 12 – 14 Sep[MASK]ember 1942 , on Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands , an[MASK][MASK]was the second of three separate major Japanese ground offensives during the Guadalc[MASK]nal Campaign .
