 Japanese forces had landed on Bougainville in early 1942 , captu[MASK][MASK][MASK]g it from the small force of Aus[MASK]ralians garrisoning the island . They had subsequently developed several airbases on the i[MASK]land[MASK], using it to [MASK]onduct operations in the northern Solomon I[MASK]l[MASK]nds and to attack the Allied lines of communication between the United States , Australia and the Southwest Paci[MASK]ic Area . Th[MASK]se bases also helped protect Rabaul , the major Japanese garrison and naval base in Papua New Guinea , and th[MASK]oughout 1943 , Allied planners determined that Bougainville was vital for neutralising the Japanese base around Rabaul . 
 US Marines [MASK]onducte[MASK] an amp[MASK]ibious landin[MASK] at Cape[MASK]Torokina , on the western c[MASK]ast of [MASK]he island , north of Empress Augusta Bay , in November 1943 . After an initial cou[MASK]ter @-@ attack , the US Marines had been repla[MASK]ed by a garrison of US Army troops who began con[MASK]olidating their position arou[MASK]d Torokina , establishing a strong perimete[MASK] . In March 1944 , the Japanese launched [MASK] heavy counter @-@ attack , which was turned[MASK]back with heavy casualties . After this , the situation on Bougainv[MASK]lle became largely static , as the Japanese [MASK]ocused primarily on s[MASK]bsistence , and the US forces chose to adopt a mainly defensive postu[MASK]e focused on main[MASK]aining the perimeter around Torokina . 
 In late [MASK]944 , as [MASK]art of plans to free US troops up for the [MASK]hilippines campaign , the Australian II Corps — c[MASK]nsisting of mainly Militi[MASK] troops under the command of Lieutenant General Stanley Savige — took over[MASK]responsibility fo[MASK] [MASK]llied operatio[MASK]s on Bougainville from the American XIV Corps . Australian forces began arriving[MASK]on the island between November and December 1944 ,[MASK]initially establishing themselves around the US base at Torok[MASK]na . Due to[MASK]inaccurate intelligence , Savige mistakenly believed that the Japanese forces on the island numbered just 17 @,@ 500 men , and he consequently decided that the Australians would pursue an aggressive campaign to clear the Japanese from Bougainville in order to fr[MASK]e their troops for subsequent operations elsewhere ,[MASK]rather than maintaining t[MASK]e defensive[MASK]post[MASK]re the US forces had [MASK]dopted . However , Allied estimates of Japanese strength were l[MASK]ter found t[MASK] be grossly inaccurate a[MASK]d a[MASK]ter the war it was found that the number of Japanese on the island at this time was closer to 40 @,@ 000 . 
 The campaign that Austr[MASK][MASK]ian planners developed entailed thre[MASK] separate drives : in the north , it was planned that Japanese f[MASK]rces would be forced into [MASK]he narrow Bonis Peninsula and con[MASK]ained ; in the centre the seizure of Pearl Rid[MASK]e would give the Australians control of the east – west avenues of approach , as well as affording them prote[MASK]tion against further coun[MASK]er @-@ attac[MASK]s , while also opening the way for a drive to the east coast ; and the main campa[MASK]gn in the south , where the bulk of the Japanese forces were concentrated around Buin[MASK]. 
 
 = = = Preliminary moves = = = 
 
 Following the capture of Pearl Ridge in December 1944 , the[MASK]Australian 7th Brigade had been moved south and al[MASK]ocated to the drive towards Buin . In[MASK]late March a[MASK]d early April 1945 , they had fought the Battle of Slater 's Knoll after which a brief lull followed as the Australians paused to shorten their supply lines . Meanwhile ,[MASK]the survivors of the Japanese force , heavily demoralise[MASK] by [MASK]heir defeat , withdrew towards the Hongo[MASK]ai River . The Australian 3rd Division was then ordered to resume its a[MASK]vance sou[MASK]h , being tasked with capturing the Hari River , while the Hongorai [MASK]as also included as an " in[MASK]ermediate objective " . Japanese stren[MASK]th[MASK]in the southern sector was estimat[MASK]d by the Australians at about 10 @,@ 500 men , of which 2 @,@ 300 were beli[MASK]ved to be[MASK]directly opposing t[MASK]e 3rd Division . The 15th Brigade was considered to be the m[MASK]st experienced of the Australian units on Bougainville at the time and was moved [MASK]p to relieve the 7th [MASK]rigade , which was in need of rest . 
 Under the command of Brigadier Heathcote Hammer the 15th Brigade consisted of t[MASK]ree infantry battalion[MASK] as well as two troops of tanks from the 2 / 4th Armoured Regiment , engineer[MASK] from the 15th Field Company , a battery of 155 @-@ mm guns from ' U ' Heavy Battery , field artillery from the 2nd Field Regiment , and a number of smaller support units . The 58th / 59th Infantry Battalion took over responsibility for Slater [MASK]s Knoll replacing the 25th Infantry Battalion while the 24th Infantry Battalion took [MASK]p a position across the Buin Road . The brigade 's third battalion — [MASK]he 57th / 60th Infantry Battalion — did not join them until the beginning of May , and so the 7th Brigade 's 9th Infantry Battalion continued patrolling operations north of the Huio River , in the Rumiki area , until the 57th / 60th could dispatch[MASK]elements to relieve [MASK]h[MASK]m . Further inland , the 2 / 8th Commando Squa[MASK]ron advanced in a wide arc to the s[MASK]uth @-@ east [MASK] defending th[MASK] brigade[MASK]'s left , or eastern , flank . 
 The Japanese forces opposing the Australians belonged to the 6th Division , under the command of Lieutenant General Tsutomu Akinaga . Akinaga had been ordered to dela[MASK] the Australian advance between the Hongorai and the Hari for as long as possible , and with th[MASK]se orders in m[MASK]nd he had installed a nu[MASK]ber of stron[MASK] points along the Australian 's expected line of advance . The division 's infantry had suffered heavily in the previous battle [MASK]roun[MASK] Slater 's Knoll and as a consequence [MASK] several units had to be reorganized or amal[MASK]amated . The front line [MASK]ositions were assigned to the 6th Field Artillery Regiment , while the 13th Infantry Regiment was to[MASK]hold five strongpoints to their rear along [MASK]nd astride the Buin Road , designated ' A ' th[MASK]ough to ' E ' . The 6th Field and 4th Field Heavy Artillery Regi[MASK]ents both held strongpoints further back , designated ' F ' and ' G ' . [MASK]he 23rd Infantry Regiment was placed in the rear , where it [MASK]as [MASK]eing re[MASK]onstituted following losses suffered during the attack on Slater 's Knoll . 
 
 = = Battle = = 
 
 
 = = = Advan[MASK]e to the Hongorai = = = 
 
 The 15th Brigade took over the forward pos[MASK]tions from the 7th Briga[MASK]e on 17 April . Initial dispositions had the 24th Infantry Battalion on t[MASK]e Buin Road around Kero Creek , with the 58th / 59th around Barara , [MASK]orth @-@ eas[MASK] of Slater 's Knol[MASK] , and the 57th / 60th , when it arrived to relieve the 9th , would be positioned further east astride a seco[MASK]dary [MASK] parallel track known to the Australians a[MASK] the Commando Road . Two days later[MASK], Hammer received the order to commence the advance towards the Hongor[MASK]i from Sa[MASK]ige , who offered him the support of the 29th Brigade as a mobile reserve in case of sudden count[MASK]r @-@ attack . In a change to the tac[MASK]ics th[MASK]t the[MASK]Australians had pr[MASK]viously employed prior to the fighting around Slater 's Knoll , from early May they advanced on a two @-@ battalion front , instead of one . The 24th Infantry Battalion was in the van , moving along the Buin Road with the 58th / 59th protecting its flank and[MASK]rear ; while 5 [MASK],@ 000 yd ( 4 @,@[MASK]600 m ) further inland the[MASK]57th / 60th Infantry Battalion[MASK], com[MASK]encing on 3 May , advanced along the Commando Road from Rumiki , after t[MASK]king over from the 9th Infantry Battalion . 
 Moving forward under a creeping barrage as they moved beyond Tokinotu , the 24th Infantry Battalion was the first to contact the Japanese , carrying out an attack against Japanese positions around Dawe 's Creek on 17 April . Sup[MASK]orted by a troop of Matilda tanks from the 2 / 4th Armoured Regiment , an artillery barrage which fired over 700 shells , two infantry companies — ' C ' and ' D ' — from the 24th attacked the position while another — ' A ' Compa[MASK]y — carried out a flanking manoeuvre to cut another tra[MASK]k further north towards Kindara and Hat[MASK]i . The left forward company — '[MASK]D ' Company — reached it[MASK] objective without trouble[MASK]; however , ' C ' Company — on the right along [MASK]ith the troop o[MASK] tanks — came up against stiff Japanese resistance and became bogged down[MASK]. ' A ' Company also became embroiled in heavy fighting along the Hatai track . In support of ' A ' Company , Mat[MASK]lidas came forward and raked the jungle , hacking through the undergrowth to reveal several Japanese pillboxes , which were destroyed by the Australian armour . As nigh[MASK] fell , ' C ' Company dug in before resuming the attack the next morning[MASK]. Engineers were brought forward , as was a bulldozer , and the ga[MASK] was bridged . Amidst heavy fighting , the Australians forced their way across the creek . By the time that the p[MASK]sition had been taken in the afternoon and the infantry had advanc[MASK]d to the line of exploitation 400 yd [MASK] 370 m ) beyond the creek , 37 Japanese had been[MASK]kil[MASK]ed for the loss o[MASK] seven Australians killed and 19 wounded . After [MASK]his , the Austral[MASK]ans continued thei[MASK] advance towards S[MASK]ndou Creek , which was a further 1 mi ( 1 @.@ [MASK] km ) to the southeast . In response , the Japanese launched a number of determined counterattacks over the course of the fol[MASK]owing week , althoug[MASK] these were turned back . During this time , the Australians sent a number of patrols out in front of the[MASK]r[MASK]forward element[MASK] , on[MASK] of whic[MASK] managed to slip through the Japanese defensive positions either side of the Buin Road and carried out a reconnaissance of the Hongorai River about 1[MASK]@,@ 000 yd ( 910 m ) south of the main crossing . Further patrol[MASK] were carried out , as well as a numbe[MASK] of ambushes , before the advance was resumed on 26 April . 
 Resuming their advance , the Australians were supported by three squadrons of Corsairs from t[MASK]e Royal New Ze[MASK]land Air Force — Nos. 14 , 22 and 26 Squadrons — w[MASK]ich bombed and strafed the ground in front of the advancing infantry , as well as a creeping barrage[MASK]of artillery and mortar fire . With suc[MASK] strong support the Japanese offered little resistance and over the[MASK]course of two days the 24th Infantry Battalion covere[MASK] almost a third of the di[MASK]tanc[MASK] to the Hongorai , [MASK]or just one man[MASK]wounded . Further progress was made [MASK]ver the next week , but on 4 May [MASK]he advance was slowed when the[MASK] encountered a roadblock defended by a field gun along wi[MASK]h a machine gun , mines and othe[MASK] improvised explos[MASK]ve devices . After this , the 15t[MASK] Brigade 's engineer support w[MASK]re called upon to regularly carry out route cleara[MASK]ce and proving operations as the Japanese became increasingly desperate to destroy the Australian armour , to the extent that they were prepared to sacrifice an artillery piece in order t[MASK] lure the Australian tanks into a trap where they could be destroyed by mines . The Japanese began to adapt their tactics in other ways also . To negate the effectiveness of the Australian ta[MASK]ks , the Japanese began to position themselves [MASK]ff the r[MASK]ads , forcin[MASK] the infantry to fight without their armoure[MASK] support . Additionally , the Japanese began to concentrate their[MASK]artillery with increa[MASK]ing accuracy upon the advancing infantry , which they kept under constant observation and fire . 
 Meanwhile [MASK] the previous day , 3 May , the 57th / 60th Infan[MASK]ry Battalion had begun operati[MASK]g along the parallel Commando Road to the north . Here they had a number of encounters and suffered casualties due to their inexperience[MASK]in patrolling , which resulted in them being ambushed . They also kept up a steady advance and eventually[MASK]beat the main force in reaching , and cr[MASK]ssing the river , arriving there [MASK]n 6 M[MASK]y . On 5 May , [MASK]long the Buin Road , th[MASK] 24th Infantry Battalion had pressed forward again . Advancing wit[MASK] a tank troop in support , they came up against a concealed field gun d[MASK]fended by approximately 100 Japanese . After the lead Matilda 's machine gu[MASK] jammed , the field gun opened fire on it , damaging it and wounding its crew . Moving around the stricken tank , t[MASK]e second Matilda , armed with a howitzer , opened fire and destroyed t[MASK]e field gun before sw[MASK]eping the Japanese defenders from the position . That night , the[MASK]Japanese artillery opened up on the Austra[MASK]ian position with a heavy barrage , and the following morning put in a company @-@ sized counter @-@ attack . [MASK]he fighting lasted for over two @-@ and @-@ a @-@ half hou[MASK]s , but whe[MASK] it was over the Australians remained in possession of the position having repulsed the attack . In doing so , they suffered one killed and nine wounded , while the attacking Japanese had suffered heavily , losing 58 men killed . It was the biggest loss s[MASK]nce the action at Slater 's Kno[MASK]l and it spelt[MASK]the end of [MASK]heir attempt[MASK]to defend the Hon[MASK]orai . 
 After this , the Australians were able to resume their advance to the river on 7 May without further opposition . Th[MASK] previous three wee[MASK]s in[MASK]which they had [MASK]dvanced 7 @,@ 000 [MASK]d ( 6 @,@ 400 m ) to the Hongorai had[MASK]been c[MASK]stly for them , h[MASK]wever , with th[MASK] Austral[MASK]an 24th Infantry Battalion losing 25 killed and 95 wound[MASK]d . Against this , the Japanese had lost at[MASK]least 169 killed . 
 
 = = = Crossing the Hongorai = = = 
 
 Following the advance to the Ho[MASK]gorai , there was a pa[MASK]se of about a[MASK]week as the Australians had to wait for roads to be improved an[MASK] supplies to be brought up , before a[MASK]tempting to cross the Hongorai en ma[MASK]se . This allowed Savige to[MASK]re @-@ evaluate the situation and to issue new orders for the advance towards the Hari and Mivo Rivers . As they waited for the advance to resume , the Australians carried out reconnaissance patrols [MASK]eep into Japanese held territory and there were a c[MASK][MASK]ple of significant engageme[MASK]ts during this time . As a part of these , the 24th Inf[MASK]ntry Battalion sent a company across the Hongorai and subsequently located a strong Japanese position on a feature that became known as Egan 's Ridge , which , due to its location , commanded the main Australian axis of advance . 
 The main crossing was planned for 20 May , with the 58th / 5[MASK]th Infantry Battalion on the right tasked to cut the Bu[MASK]n Road and the Aitara Track to the eas[MASK] of the river[MASK], while on the left the 57th / 60th Infantry Battalion would divert the a[MASK]tention of the Japanese [MASK]ff the 24th Infantry Battalion which would make the main frontal assault from the centre of the Australian line , crossing [MASK]t the Pororei ford , advancing stra[MASK]ght up the Buin Road .[MASK]Preliminary moves began before this , and on 15 M[MASK]y a platoon from the 24th Infan[MASK]ry Battalion along with two tanks attempt[MASK]d to carry out an attack on Egan 's Ridge .[MASK]After one of the tanks was held up and knocked out by a Japanese field gun , they were forced to withdraw . Meanwhile[MASK], th[MASK] RNZAF[MASK]Corsair squadrons — now reinforced by No[MASK][MASK]16 Squadron — began an eight @-@ day aerial campaign , attacking along the length of the Buin and Commando Roads . During this period , the New Zealanders flew 381 sorties , while artillery and mortars fired " thou[MASK]ands of rounds " . 
 T[MASK]o days later , on [MASK]7 [MASK]ay , the 57th / 60th Infantry Battali[MASK]n began its div[MASK]rsionary move on th[MASK] left flank , crossing the Hongorai inland and advanci[MASK]g along the Commando Road with 32 Corsairs and two batteries of[MASK]a[MASK]tiller[MASK] in support . Cros[MASK]ing 500 yd ( 460 m ) north of the ford , the centre company [MASK]arried out an [MASK]ttack along the far bank of[MASK]the river withou[MASK] i[MASK]s armoured support which had been unable to negotiate the crossing . Nevertheless , shortly before noon they had secured the crossing and began to fan o[MASK]t , carrying[MASK]out further flanking move[MASK] before establishing a firm base t[MASK] receive[MASK]supplies and [MASK]rom wher[MASK] it began patr[MASK]lling operations on 20 May . 
 In the centre , th[MASK] main a[MASK]tack along the Buin Road began at 08 : 30 on 20[MASK]May af[MASK]er 20 minutes of strafing by New Zealand Corsairs had prepared the ground . Advancing under a creeping barrage , and with morta[MASK] and machine gun support , th[MASK] 24th Infantry Battali[MASK]n moved forward with three compan[MASK]es up front and o[MASK]e held back in reserve , along with two troops of Matilda tanks . Mostly the forward companies reach[MASK]d their objec[MASK]ives , but one of the companies was halted just short of their objective and was forced to dig @-@ in overnight aft[MASK]r coming under heavy small arms and artillery fire and losing four killed and five w[MASK]unded . The attack was resumed the following day , and the Australians [MASK]ere able to advance to the Por[MASK]rei ford ; h[MASK]wever , they were prevented from moving [MASK]ny further as the Japanese were still conc[MASK]ntrated in large numbers furt[MASK]e[MASK] to the west where an Australian patrol encountered 70 Japanese and were forced to go to ground . Finally , a company from the 24th Infantry Battalion was able to move on to the high ground on Egan 's Ridge , which they found to be heavily mined and booby t[MASK]apped . Engi[MASK]eers and a[MASK]sault pioneers were called up to clear[MASK]the feature . 
 On the rig[MASK]t flank , the 58th / 59th Infantry Battali[MASK]n carried out a wide flanking move along a track that had been carved out of the west bank of the Hongorai by bulldozer . Beginning their move two days earlier , a number of patrols had had contacts with t[MASK]e Japanese . Meanwhile , using tractors to drag the tanks through the mud , the A[MASK]stralian armour had crossed the river also and by 16 :[MASK]00 on 20 M[MASK]y the battalion had[MASK]manag[MASK]d to est[MASK]blish itself in an assembly area to th[MASK] east of the river , [MASK]nbeknown to the Japanese [MASK] The following day , the battalion left the line of departure and began to advance on its primary objective , which it[MASK]reached in the early afternoon d[MASK]spite being held up while the tanks attempted to affect a creek crossing , and further[MASK]delayed by stiff resistance . Later , after one of the battalion 's patrols came under heavy fire , the tanks moved up and[MASK]attacked a Japanese gun position which the defenders[MASK]quickl[MASK] abandoned , leaving behind a 7[MASK] mm gun and a large amount of ammuni[MASK]ion . 
 By 22 Ma[MASK] , although there were still a number of Japanese in the area which continued to harass and ambush their line of communications , most [MASK]f the Austra[MASK]ian objectives had been secured and mopping up operations began . The last remaining defensive location before the Hongorai was Egan 's Ridge , where the Japanese were sheltering i[MASK] tunnels . A heavy aerial and artillery bombardment devastated the position and forced them [MASK]o aban[MASK]on the ridge . It was subsequently occupied by a company of Australian infantry . Wi[MASK]hin a short perio[MASK] of [MASK]ime the Buin Road was subsequently opened , providing the [MASK]ustralians with[MASK]the means with which to bring up sup[MASK]lies for the next stage of the campaign , bei[MASK]g the advance to the Hari , Mobiai , and Mivo Rivers . The final phase of the battle cost the Japanese 106 killed , while the Australians lost 13 killed and 64 wounded . 
 
 = = Aftermath = = 
 
 During the course of the fighting around the Hong[MASK]rai , the Australians lo[MASK]t 38 m[MASK]n killed and 159 wounded , while the Japanese lost at least 275 men k[MASK]lled . Following the battle , the Aus[MASK]ralians continued their advance towards Buin at the southern end of the island [MASK] Throughout the rem[MASK]inder of the month and[MASK]into June , the 15th Brigade advanced along the Buin Road , crossing the Hari on [MASK]0 June . Beyond the river , the Japanese resolve[MASK] to hold the food growing areas in orde[MASK] to protect t[MASK]eir precarious food supply , and they consequently occupied a series of deep entrenchments . Thes[MASK] were steadily reduced with airstrikes and artillery , and the 15th Brigade s[MASK]bsequently crossed Mobiai River before b[MASK]ing relieved by Brigadier Noel [MASK]impson 's 29th Brigade in[MASK]early July . 
 As [MASK]he 29t[MASK] Bri[MASK]ade advanced toward the Mivo River , torrential [MASK]ain and flood[MASK]ng ultimately brought the advance to a[MASK]halt . The height of the riv[MASK]r rose 2 metres ( 6 @.@ 6 ft ) . [MASK]he Buin Road was reduced , in the words of Gavin Long , "[MASK]t[MASK] a sea of mud " [MASK]nd many of the bridges upon which the Australian supply system was dependent were [MASK]ashed away[MASK]. This rendered large @-@ scale offensive infantry operat[MASK]ons impossible and as the situation worsened [MASK]or a period of time [MASK]he Australians even ceased patrolling operations across the Mivo ; meanwhile , the Japanese continued to harass the Australians , probing[MASK]their positions and setting mines and traps , targeting the Australian line of communications . On 9 July , the 15th I[MASK]fantry Batta[MASK]ion fought off a series of attacks aro[MASK]nd Siskatekori , at the junction of the Mivo River and th[MASK][MASK]Buin Road , which included a heavy Japanese artillery bomb[MASK]rdment . Australian patrols were resumed in[MASK]late July and continued into August . These attacks proved very costly , particularly amongst the[MASK]Australian engineers that were tasked with rebuilding the bridges and roads that had been destroyed in the flooding . 
 Fighting in the northern sector cont[MASK]nued during this time also , and although preparations in the south for the final advance towards Buin co[MASK]tinued into August , combat operations on the island ceased as the war[MASK]came to an end before these were completed . As a result , the final Australian operations on Bougainville took place on the Ratsua front i[MASK] the northern sector , where the Australians had been conducting a holding action since the failed landing at Porton Plantation ha[MASK] force[MASK] them to abandon plans for an advance into the Bonis Penin[MASK]ula . By mid @-@ August , however , following the dropping of two atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki and Japan 's subsequent unconditional surrender , a cease fire [MASK]as ordered on the island and[MASK]although there were minor clashe[MASK] following this , [MASK]t spelt an end[MASK]to major combat operations . 
 Following the end[MASK]of the war , the Australian Army awarded three battle honours for the fig[MASK]ting around the Hongorai River . The 2 / 4th Armoured Regiment , and the 9th , 24th , 57th[MASK]/ 60th and 58th / 59th Infantry Battalions received the battle hono[MASK]r " Hongorai River " . A second battle honour — "[MASK]Egan 's Ridge – Hongorai F[MASK]r[MASK] " — was also awarded to the 2 / 4th Armoured Regiment , and the 24th and 58th[MASK]/ 59th Infantry Battalions fo[MASK] the second stage of the fighting , while the 57th / 60th Infantry Battalion received the separate battle honour of " Commando Road " for this period . 
 
 
 = Sonic [MASK]he Hedgehog ( 1991 v[MASK]deo game ) = 
 
 Sonic the Hedge[MASK]og is a platform video game developed by Sonic Team and publ[MASK]shed by Sega for the Sega Genesis console . The game was first released in North Ameri[MASK]a , Europe a[MASK]d Australia in June 1991 [MASK] and in Japan the following month . The game features an [MASK]nthropomorphic hedgehog named Sonic i[MASK] a quest to defeat Dr. R[MASK]b[MASK]tnik , a scientist who has imprisoned animals in robots and stolen the magical Chaos Emeralds . Sonic the Hedgehog 's gameplay involves collecting rings as a form of health and a simple control scheme , with jumping and attacking[MASK]controlled by a single butt[MASK]n . 
 The game 's development began in 1990 , when Sega or[MASK]ered its AM8 development team to create a game featuring a mascot for the co[MASK]pany . After considering a n[MASK]mber of suggestions , the[MASK]developers decided on a blue hedgehog wi[MASK]h spikes along his head and spine and renamed them[MASK]elv[MASK]s " S[MASK]nic Team " to match their character . Sonic the[MASK]Hedgehog , designed for fast gameplay , w[MASK]s influen[MASK]ed by the games of Super Mario series creator , Shigeru Miyamoto . Sonic the Hedgehog uses a novel technique that allows Sonic 's sprite to roll a[MASK]ong cur[MASK]ed scenery , which originated in a tech [MASK]emo created by the game 's programmer , Yuji Naka . 
 The game was well received[MASK]by critics , who prais[MASK]d its visual[MASK] , m[MASK]sic [MASK] and speed of gamep[MASK]ay . The game was also commercially successful , establishing the [MASK]enesi[MASK] as a key pl[MASK]yer in the 16 @-@ bit era and allowing it to compete with Nintendo and their Super NES console . It has been ported a number of times , and inspired several clones , a successful franchise , and adaptations by other media . 
 
 = = Plot = = 
 
 In an attempt to steal the s[MASK]x Chaos Emeralds and harness their power , the game 's antagonist , Dr. Ivo Ro[MASK]otnik , h[MASK]s trapped the animal inhabitants of South Island in aggressive robots and stationary metal capsules . The pla[MASK]er controls Sonic , who aims to halt Robotnik 's plans by freeing his animal friends and collecti[MASK][MASK] the emeralds himself . 
 If the player collects all the Chaos Emeralds and completes the game , a reward ending [MASK]equence is shown . If a[MASK]l the emeralds are not c[MASK]llected , Robotnik taunts the player while juggling the Chaos Emeralds instead . 
[MASK][MASK] = = Gameplay = = 
 
 Sonic the Hedgehog is a 2D , side @-@ scrolling platformer , whose gameplay centers around[MASK]Sonic '[MASK] ability to run at high speed through levels incorporating springs , slopes , high falls , and loop @-@ the @[MASK]@ loops . The levels contain hazards in the form of robots ( " bad[MASK]iks " in the Western game manuals )[MASK]inside of which Dr. Robotnik has trapped animals . Although destroying a robot frees the animal w[MASK]thin , [MASK]his is not required to complete the game . The player mu[MASK]t avoid rows of sharp spikes , falling into bottomless pits , being crushed by moving wall[MASK] or platforms , and drowning ( which can [MASK]e avoided by breathing air bubbles per[MASK]odically released from ven[MASK]s ) . Sonic 's main attack is his spin , where he curls into a ball and rotates rapidly ( damaging enemies and some obstacles ) . This can be performed by jumping in the air or rolling on the ground . 
 Scattere[MASK] around each level map are gold rings , and collecting 100 rings [MASK]ewards the player with [MASK]n extra life .[MASK]Rings are a layer of protection ag[MASK]inst haz[MASK]rds ; if Sonic has at le[MASK]st one ring when he[MASK]collides with an enemy ( or ob[MASK]tacle ) , he will survive . However [MASK] all his rings will be scattered ; they will flicker and disap[MASK]ear in a few seconds if they are not picked up [MASK]gain . [MASK]f Sonic is hit [MASK]ithout any rings [MASK] he loses a life . Altho[MASK]gh shields and temporary invincibility may[MASK]be collected [MASK]o provide additional protection , certain hazards ( such as drowning , being crushed , falling down [MASK] bottomless pit or ru[MASK]ning out of time ) will cost Sonic [MASK] life regardless[MASK]of rings or other protection . 
 The game is divided into six zones ( Green Hill , Marble , Spr[MASK]ng Y[MASK]rd , Labyrinth , Star Light , [MASK]nd Scrap Brain ) , each with its own visual style and enemi[MASK]s . A player must navigate thr[MASK]ugh each zone ( subdivide[MASK] into three acts ) to progress . At the end of each zone 's third[MASK]act , the player co[MASK]fronts Dr. Robotnik ( who [MASK]ilots a different vehicle each time ) in[MASK]a boss f[MASK]ght . After the sixth zone , the player continues directly to the Final[MASK]Zone for a last encount[MASK]r with Robotnik . 
 The player begins with three lives ( power @-@ ups and rings add more ) , which are [MASK]ost when Sonic collides with hazardous enemies ( or objects ) without rings , fall[MASK] off [MASK]-@[MASK]screen or exceeds an act 's ten @-@ minute time limit[MASK]. Lampposts acting as checkpoints allow Sonic to return to the most @-@ recently activated post when he loses a life . If he loses a life as a result of tim[MASK] run[MASK]ing out but has [MASK]nother life , the timer will reset to 0 : 00 when he returns to the checkpoint . If all lives are lost at [MASK]ny point in the game , the game over screen will appear ( when the player can r[MASK]turn to the beginning of th[MASK] act with thr[MASK]e[MASK]lives , if they have any continues ) . 
 When Sonic reaches the end of act one or act two of a zone with at least fifty rings , a large ring appears through which he can jump to enter a Special Stage ( a " Secret Zone " in the original Genesis manual ) [MASK] In each of six Special Stages , Sonic bounces off the bump[MASK]rs and walls of a rotating maze in spin attack . Although the player earns a continue with each 50 rings found , their main goal i[MASK] to obta[MASK][MASK] the Chaos E[MASK]erald at the end of the maze without colliding with[MASK]a [MASK] goal block " ( which ends the level ) . 
 
 = = D[MASK]velopment = = 
 
 
 = [MASK] = Background and chara[MASK]ter design = = = 
 
 In 1990 , Sega ordered its in @-@ house development studio , AM8 , to develop a game featuri[MASK]g a mascot for th[MASK] company . This was a po[MASK]ition [MASK]lready held by the character Alex Kidd , but he was considered simi[MASK]ar to Mario and deemed unsatisfactory ; Sega p[MASK]eside[MASK]t Hayao Nakayama wanted a character as iconic as Mickey Mouse . Sega had competitio[MASK] from Nintendo and its mascot , Mario , in mind ; Nintendo was dominant at the time , particularly after the release of the successful Super Mario[MASK]Bros. 3 , and Sega wanted a foot[MASK]old in the industry . Althou[MASK]h the company had some [MASK]uccess with Gene[MASK]is ports of its arcade titles , it knew this would not be enough .[MASK]
 AM8 developed ideas for characters , an engine , and gam[MASK]play mechanics . Development emphasized speed , so AM8 eliminated character designs not assoc[MASK]ated [MASK]ith fast animals , as wel[MASK] as f[MASK]st creatures like kangaroos and squirrels . One idea , a rabbit able to grasp objects with[MASK]prehensile ears , showed promise at first but was too complex for the available hardware . The team narrowed its search to[MASK]anim[MASK]ls that can roll into a ball , their idea for an attacking move . Designers then realized that this would not seem aggressive enough , so they f[MASK]cused on two [MASK]nimal[MASK] with s[MASK]ikes : armadillos and hedgehogs . The hedgehog character , fir[MASK]t proposed by Naoto Ohshima , prevailed , although the a[MASK]madillo would later become the basis for Mighty the [MASK]rmadillo ( who firs[MASK] appeared in 1993 's SegaSonic the Hedgehog ) . Ohshima has admitted since th[MASK]t he created Sonic 's basic design by c[MASK]m[MASK]ining Felix the Cat 's head with Mickey Mouse 's body . 
 Sonic was originally teal @-@ colored , t[MASK]en a light shade of blue , but he [MASK]as changed to dark blue so he would stand out against certain background[MASK] and to match the Sega logo . His shoes were colored [MASK]ed through the inspiration of Michael Jackson 's boots on the al[MASK]um cover for Bad and the outfit of Santa Claus , whom Ohshima saw as the most " famo[MASK]s character in the worl[MASK] " . Sonic 's spikes were emphasized to make him look sleeker , and he was given the ability to spin while jumping ( so attacking and jumping could be controlled with one butto[MASK] ) . The ne[MASK] character was originally named " Mr. Needlemouse " , but the eight @-@ member AM8 changed his name to " Sonic " and their studios to Sonic Team . Ideas proposed to fl[MASK]sh out the character included pl[MASK]cing him in a rock b[MASK]nd , giving him vampire fangs , and giving him a human girlfriend n[MASK]med Madonna , but Sega of America scrapped these ideas to keep his identity simple . Sega of America also expre[MASK]sed concerns that most Americans would not know what a hedgehog is [MASK]nd in[MASK]tially proposed a full @-@ scale recreation[MASK]of the character , but compromised with Sonic Team to simply make design changes . The antagonist ended up being named " Dr. Eggman " in Japan and " Dr. Robotnik " in other regions as a result of a dispute between Sega 's Ameri[MASK]an and Japanese divisions . 
 
 = = = Programming and prototyping = = = 
 
 With a satisfying protagonist com[MASK]leted , Sega turned to esteemed programmer Yuji Naka , who had impr[MASK]ssed them through his work on Phantasy Star and the G[MASK]nesis port of Ghouls ' n Ghosts . The gamepl[MASK]y originate[MASK] with a tech demo by Naka , who developed an algorithm allowing a sprite to move smoo[MASK]hly on a curve by determining its position with a dot matrix . Naka 's prototype was a platform game with a fa[MASK]t @-@ moving character rolling in a ball throug[MASK] a long , winding tube , and this concept was fleshed out with Ohshima 's character designs and level[MASK] by designer Hirokazu Yasuhara . Yasuhara originally intended to work on the game for three months due to the delay of hi[MASK] p[MASK]anned move to the United States by the outbreak of the Gulf War , but was engros[MASK]ed in the project for nearly a year . His designs for levels were intended to a[MASK]tract both hardcore and casual gamers by integrating occasional challenging set pieces into the mos[MASK]ly accessible level des[MASK][MASK]n . The game 's col[MASK]r scheme was influenced by th[MASK] work of pop artist Eizin Suzuki[MASK], and the[MASK]aesthetics of Green Hill were influenced by the geogra[MASK][MASK]y of California . 
 In designing the game mechanics , Naka was inspired by Shigeru Miyamoto , whose games he had enjoyed playing years e[MASK]rlier . Admiring the simplicity of Miyamo[MASK]o 's [MASK]echanics in complex environments , Naka decided that Sonic would be controlled with only a directional pad for movement and a single button for jumping . He also wanted his creation to be more action @-@ oriented than the Mario series ; while playing Super M[MASK]rio Bros. ,[MASK]he had wondered why the levels could not be cleared more quick[MASK]y . [MASK]ue to the need t[MASK] demonstrate the Ge[MASK]esis ' technological prowess , the developing game[MASK]underwent extensive testing and rede[MASK]ign , a process taking over six months . Th[MASK] developers ' effo[MASK]ts were rewarded ; according to [MASK]uji Naka , the game had t[MASK]e fastest @-@ ever character s[MASK]eed in a video game and a rotation effect in t[MASK]e special stages that was considered impossible on the co[MASK]sole . The team inte[MASK]ded to add a two @-@ player mode displayed via split[MASK]@-@ screen , but Naka 's programming knowledge was insufficient to implement this feature . However , such a mo[MASK]e would later appear in sequel Sonic the Hedgehog 2 ( 1992 ) , where the[MASK]secon[MASK] player would control Sonic 's b[MASK]st friend Miles " Tails " Prower . Na[MASK]a , Oshi[MASK]a , and Yasuhara work[MASK]d 19 hours a day[MASK]on the project for several months . 
 Naka 's relatio[MASK][MASK]hip with Sega of Japan was tenuous during this time ; he received little credit for his involve[MASK]ent in the game . He left the company shortly after the game 's r[MASK]lease , although Sega of America hired him later . B[MASK][MASK]o[MASK]e leaving , however , he def[MASK]ed Sega of Japan 's prohibition of developer credits b[MASK] displaying a f[MASK]w names in black text on a black background , ide[MASK]tifiable only by lookin[MASK] at the game 's code . 
 
 = = = Music = = = 
 
 The music[MASK]for Sonic the Hedgehog was composed and produced by Masato Nakamura[MASK], bassist an[MASK] lead songwriter of the J @-@ pop band Dreams Come True . The game uses onboard Yamaha YM2612 and SN76489 programmable sound generators to produce a variety of stereo sound effects and music . I[MASK] was originally intended to have a sound test menu with anim[MASK]tions of Sonic breakdancing to[MASK]the music of a " Sonic Band " of Sharps Chicken on guitar , Max Mo[MASK]key on bass , Mach R[MASK]bbit [MASK]n drums , an[MASK] Vector the Crocodile on keyboard . The playable Vector became a recurring character in the s[MASK]ries , also appearing in Knuckles ' Chaotix , Sonic Heroes , and Sonic Free Riders[MASK]. The development schedule sc[MASK]apped the feature , and Yuji Naka replaced the test with the " Se @-[MASK] ga ! " chant used in TV commercials ( which reportedly used one @-@ eighth of the memory of the four @-@ megabit cartridg[MASK] ) . 
 On October 19 , 2011 , twenty years after the game 's release , a three @-@ disc compilation of music from Sonic the Hedgehog an[MASK] Soni[MASK] the Hedgehog 2 was released in Japan . The first disc features original tracks[MASK]from bo[MASK]h games , the second contains Masato Nakam[MASK]ra 's demo recordings and the third comprises songs by Dreams Come True and their Akon remixes . 
 
 = = = Packaging and release = = = 
 
 Game @-@ package illustrator Akira Watana[MASK]e said that his goal was to make the characters " colorful [MASK] , [MASK]sing clear lines and gradation to " finish them neatly " . According to Watanabe , the developers asked him to crea[MASK]e a package design " similar to pop art ... without being particular to convent[MASK]onal packages " – something " origin[MASK]l " and " stylish " . The game was released in North America , Europe , and Australia on June[MASK]23 , 1991 , and in Japan on July 26 . Sega of America packaged it with American Genesis consoles , replacing Altered Beast . Genesis owne[MASK]s who bought their consol[MASK]s before the switch could request free co[MASK]ies of Sonic the[MASK]Hedgehog by mail . Sega of America created a large @-@ scale marketing campaign to promote the game and Sonic as a mascot for the company . 
 
 = = Alternate versions and ports = = 
 
 
 = = = 8 @-@ bit version = = = 
 
 A version of Sonic the Hedgehog was developed by Ancient and released in 1991 [MASK]or Seg[MASK] 's 8 @-@ b[MASK]t console[MASK] , the Master System and Game Gear . Its plot and ga[MASK]eplay mechanics a[MASK]e similar to[MASK]the [MASK]6 @-@ bit version , with different[MASK]level themes and digital assets . The level design is flatter , with no vertical loops , and Sonic cannot re @-@ collect his rings after being hit . The game has a different soundtrack , composed by chiptune musician Yuzo Koshiro and including his compositions and adaptations of music from t[MASK]e [MASK]6 @-@ bit version . It was the final game r[MASK]leased for the Master Syst[MASK]m[MASK]in North America . [MASK]he Master Sy[MASK]tem version was re @-@ release[MASK] for Wii 's Virtual Console service in North America on August 4 , 2008 , and in Europe on August 8 . The Game [MASK]ear version was re @-@ re[MASK]eased for th[MASK] Nintendo[MASK]3DS Virtual Console on June 13 , 2013 , and included as [MASK]n unlockable game in Sonic Adventure DX : Director 's Cut for GameCube and Windows and Sonic Mega Collection Plus [MASK]or PlayStat[MASK]on 2 , Xbox , and Windows . 
 
 = = = Sonic the Hedgehog Genesis = = = 
 
 [MASK] port , Sonic the Hedgehog Genesis , was released for the Game Boy Advance ( GBA ) on No[MASK]ember 14 , 2006 in United[MASK]State[MASK] to mark the game 's fifteenth anniversary . It included s[MASK]veral new features , such as the ability to save game pro[MASK]ress [MASK] a level select option , and an Anniversary Mode with the Spin [MASK]as[MASK] move ( not originally implemented until Sonic the [MASK]edgehog 2 ) . Its screen is slightly zoomed in , and adapted to the G[MASK]A 's widescreen aspect ratio . The game received poor reviews , wit[MASK] a Met[MASK]critic score of 33 percent ; the chief complaints concerned its poor conversion to the Game Boy Advance ( resulting in a slow frame rate ) , remixed chunky music , and[MASK]poor pre[MASK]ervation of the original gamepl[MASK]y . 
 
 = = = C[MASK]mpilation rel[MASK]ases = = = 
 
 With its sequels for the Genesis , Sonic [MASK]he Hedgehog has been ported for a wide r[MASK]nge of home and handheld consoles and personal computers . It has appeared in Sonic Compilation ( 1995 ) for the Genesis , Sonic Jam ( 1997 ) for the Sega Saturn and Game.com , Son[MASK]c Mega Col[MASK]ection ( 2002 ) , Sonic Mega [MASK]ollection Plus ( 2004 ) , Sonic 's Ultima[MASK]e Genesis Collect[MASK]on ( 2009 ) for the[MASK]Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 , and Sonic Clas[MASK]ic [MASK]ollection ( 2010 ) for the Nintendo DS . Additionally , the game is an unlockable reward in the console[MASK]versions of Sonic Gener[MASK]tions . 
 
 = = = Downloadable releases = = = 
 
 [MASK]onic the Hedgehog has been available for all three major seventh @-@ gen[MASK]rat[MASK]on video game console[MASK] . It was part of the[MASK]Wii Virtual Conso[MASK]e at the service 's 2006 introduction , and was released for the Xbox Live Arcade and PlayStation Network shortly afterwards . The game was released fo[MASK] the iPod Classic , iPod video , and video @-@ capable iPod Nano models in 2007 and for Apple 's iOS service ( compatible iPhone[MASK]and [MASK]Pod touch models ) in April 2009 . Sonic the Hedgehog became avail[MASK]ble on GameTap in September 2009 . In Octob[MASK]r 2010 , it was relea[MASK]ed a[MASK] a Microsoft Windows download which was ported to Steam . The game was [MASK]orted to[MASK]two online app services ( Google Play and the Amazon Appstore ) in December 2012 . [MASK] remastered mobile port , created using Christian Whitehead 's Retro Engine previously used in the 2011 rerelease of Sonic CD , was released on iOS , replacing the original port , on May 15 , 2013 with an Android version released the following day . The port features widescre[MASK]n graphics , the optional abil[MASK]ty to spin das[MASK] , a t[MASK]me attack [MASK]ode , and the unlockable option to play as [MASK]ails or Knuckles the Echidna . The game was also released as part of the Nintendo 3DS 3D C[MASK]assics line i[MASK] May 2013 in Japan [MASK] and worldwide in December . 
 
 = = Reception = = 
 
 Soni[MASK] the Hedgehog was critically praised at its release and in retrospective reviews , with an 86 @-@ percent approval rating at the review aggregator GameRankings based on nine[MASK]reviews . The game rivaled the Mario series , particularly Super Mario World ( which was recently released for Genesis rival Super Nintendo Entertainment S[MASK]ste[MASK] ) . Paul Rand of Computer and Video Games compared [MASK]he two in dep[MASK]h and chara[MASK]terized Sonic the Hedgehog as being faster , with br[MASK]ghter co[MASK]ors , and Super Mario World as having more " depth[MASK]of play " . 
 Reviewers noted the game 's col[MASK]rful , detailed graphics . Rand [MASK]alled its color scheme " lively , but ne[MASK]er garish " , praising the interaction of color with detail in the sprites , backgrounds , and animation[MASK] and describing its graphics as the b[MASK]st available for the Genesis . Reviewer Boogie Man of GamePro called the intricate backgrounds " eye @-@ p[MASK]pping " and " gorgeous " , which was echoed by Mean Machine[MASK] . According to the Le[MASK]sers ( Hartley , Patricia , and Kirk ) of Dragon , " The graphics and animation in Sonic the Hedgehog make this a serious contender for the best video game of the year " and GameZone called the animation " some of the smoothest and fastest ... ever seen " . The music and sound effects were also well received ; Dragon called them " great " , and GameZone " amazing " . Rand noted " stacks of catchy tunes and jingles " , calling some of th[MASK] sound effects " absolutely brilliant " . Alt[MASK]ough Mean Machines called the songs " vaguely appealing " , the game 's sound effects were better appreciated . 
 Critics cited the fast gameplay , unprecedented in platformers . GamePro 's Boogie Man noted its " lightning @-@ fast action " and , according to Electronic Gaming Monthly ( EGM ) , " If you thought the Enterprise was quick , wait till you see Sonic at warp speed . " The game[MASK]'s difficulty was disputed , described as " impossible " by Rand and " average " by EGM . Rand said about the gameplay in general that it " pla[MASK]s like a dream " ; acc[MASK]rding[MASK]to Game[MASK]one it would enchant players for hours , and Boogie Man praised Sonic Team 's ability[MASK]to provide an engaging experience primarily from running and jump[MASK]ng . Although EGM , Dragon , and Paul of Mean Machines praised the level design ( especially the hidden rooms ) ,[MASK]Paul found losing all of one 's rings f[MASK]ustrating . 
 Sonic[MASK]the Hedgehog has maintained its popularity , appearing[MASK]on lists of the greatest video games of [MASK]ll time . Frank Provo of GameSpot described the game as " one of the[MASK]best platformers[MASK]of all time " , noting that despite technical[MASK]issues in the Game Boy Adv[MASK]nce port [MASK] after all these years , the unde[MASK]lying gr[MASK]phics , audio , and gam[MASK][MASK]lay still hold up " . Lucas M. Thomas of IGN agreed that[MASK]it stood the test of time : " You '[MASK]l be impressed by the clarity and color that come through ... Few[MASK]people realize ho[MASK] difficult it was to[MASK]create Sonic 's graphics engine , which all[MASK]wed for the incredible rat[MASK] of speed the game 's known for . But the technical achievement impressed back in ' 91 [MASK] and still does so today . " Mega ranked the g[MASK]me its third @-@ favorite Genesis title , and in 2001 Game Informer called it the 24th @-@ greatest game of all time . Sonic the Hedgehog has been a commercial success ; the o[MASK]iginal[MASK]Genesis version sold o[MASK]er 15 million cop[MASK]es by F[MASK]bruary 2009 , and the mobile version had eight million [MASK][MASK]id downloads by 2008 [MASK] 
 
 = = Leg[MASK]cy = = 
 
 [MASK] = = = Effect on the industry = = = 
 
 Prima[MASK]ily because of its Genesis bundling , Sonic [MASK]he Hedgeho[MASK] [MASK]o[MASK]tributed to the console 's[MASK]North American popularity . During Octob[MASK]r – December 1991 , the Genesis outsold the Super NES by a two @-@ to @-@ one ratio , an[MASK] at its J[MASK]nuary 1992 peak claimed 65 percent of t[MASK]e market for 16 @-@ bit consoles . Although Nintendo eventua[MASK]ly[MASK]again overtook Sega , this was the first[MASK]time since December 1[MASK]85 that the company di[MASK] not lead the console market . 
 Sonic the Hedgehog added speed and m[MASK]mentum @-@ based physics to the standard platform [MASK]ormula . Set @-@ pieces and mec[MASK]anics introduced by the game ( such as loops , springs , and acceleration pads ) have a[MASK]peared in other games a[MASK]d become associated with the Sonic series . 
 A flood of " animal with attitude " platformers , each featuring a[MASK]cartoon mascot , were released aft[MASK]r Sonic the He[MASK]gehog : Bubsy , A[MASK]ro the Acro @-@[MASK]Ba[MASK] , James Pond 3 , Earthworm Jim , Zero the Kamikaze Squirrel , [MASK]we[MASK]ome Possum , Ty the Tasma[MASK]ian Tiger , Gex . This carried into the PlayStation era with games [MASK]ike [MASK]unky Skunk a[MASK]d Crash Bandicoot . 
 
 = = = Sequels and other media = = = 
 
 The game 's success led Sega to develop an extensive media franchise . A 1992 sequel , Sonic the Hed[MASK]e[MASK]og 2 , gave Sonic[MASK]a best friend ( and sidekick )[MASK]named[MASK]Miles " Tails " Prower and[MASK]continued the fight against Dr. Robotnik [MASK] S[MASK]nic has generated[MASK]doz[MASK]ns of additional games and a large cast of recurring characters ( keeping Sonic and[MASK]Robo[MASK]nik as m[MASK]insta[MASK]s ) , sur[MASK]iving the end of Sega console manufacturing after the Dreamcast . The series has ventured from platformers to fighting , racing , role @-@ playing , and sports games , and has expanded into anime and manga , cartoons and comic books , n[MASK]vels , and toys . Sonic the Hed[MASK]ehog has become one of [MASK]he best @-@ s[MASK]lling video game franchises of [MASK]ll ti[MASK]e , with over 150 million copies sold by May 2014 . The game 's first stage , Green Hill Zone , has[MASK]also bee[MASK] re @-@ purposed for use in several oth[MASK]r titles such as Sonic Adventure 2 , Son[MASK]c Generations and the Super Smash Bros. series . 
 
 
 = T[MASK]e Same Old [MASK]tory = 
 
[MASK]" The Same Old Story " is the [MASK]econd episode of the [MASK]irst season of the American science fiction drama television series Fringe . The episode was written by executive producer Jeff Pinkner an[MASK] co @[MASK]@ creators J. J. Abrams ,[MASK]Alex Kurtzman , and Roberto Orci . When developing the s[MASK]ries , they sought to find a med[MASK]um between serialized drama and the crim[MASK] procedural . " The Same Old [MASK]tory " wa[MASK] the first regular episode of Fringe , and journalists viewed it as[MASK]an exam[MASK]le of what they could expect from the series . It was directed [MASK]y Paul A. Edwards . 
 After a newborn baby[MASK]r[MASK]pidly ages into an 80 @-@ ye[MASK]r @-@ old[MASK]man , Fringe division agent Olivia Dun[MASK]am ( Anna Torv ) and [MASK]onsultants Peter ( Joshua Jackson ) and Walter Bis[MASK]op ( John Noble ) investigate . They tie the case to the murders of young women , who have all [MASK]ad th[MASK]ir pituitary glands rem[MASK]ved . It is revealed that Dr. Claus Penrose ( Mark Blum ) , an expert in progeria , is working to help his son Christ[MASK]pher ( Derek Cecil ) stay [MASK]live , as he suffers from rapid aging syndrome . 
 " The Same Old Story " first aired in the United States on September 16 , 2008 on Fox . An estimated 13 @.@ 272 million viewers watched the episode , a 45 percent increase from the series premiere . The episode r[MASK]ceived mixed reviews from television critics – reviewer[MASK] thought it was an improvement from the pre[MASK]ious episode but faulted it for containing plot contrivances . 
 
 [MASK] = Plot [MASK] = 
 
 A prostitute is abandoned by an unknown man at a hospital , dan[MASK]erously in labor . She dies[MASK]as the doctors perform a caesarean section , but the child ages rapidly in minutes , soon dead having aged to the likes of an 80 @-@ year @-@ old man . Olivia Dunham ( Anna Torv ) , Peter Bishop ( Joshua Jackson ) , and Walter Bishop ( John Noble ) , new members of the Frin[MASK]e division , are ca[MASK]led to investigate by division head Phillip Broyles ( Lance Reddick ) , believing the case to be part of " The Pattern " ,[MASK]a string of mysterious incidents . The woman is identi[MASK]ied as ha[MASK]ing recently left a local motel , and Olivia finds evidence that points to a past [MASK]erial murder case she and her former partner John[MASK][MASK]cott were not able to solve . Olivia explains to Peter [MASK]hat their murderer would paralyze his victims , young women , then make [MASK]n incision along [MASK]heir face to extract a piece of brain material , [MASK]i[MASK]ling the victim[MASK]in the process . Walter t[MASK]kes [MASK]oth corpses back to his lab an[MASK] determines that the woman had only been pregnant minutes before giving birth , her child having accelerated agi[MASK]g disease . Walter is reminded of having previously done work in this field , and remembers where he stashed his car that contains the related files . Once they are[MASK]retrieved , Olivia makes a connection[MASK]to the pituitary gland which controls growth in humans , and informs Charlie F[MASK]ancis ( Kirk Acevedo ) to monitor r[MASK]cent cases where the victims ' pituitary gland has been removed . 
 Olivia and Peter turn to an expert in progeria [MASK] Dr. Penrose ( Mark Blum ) , to trying t[MASK] learn more about rapid aging , but Dr. Penrose cannot help t[MASK]em further , though Peter s[MASK]sp[MASK]cts he is hiding something . Uns[MASK]en by the Fringe division , Dr. Penrose visits an abandoned warehouse and meets the murderer , Christopher ( Derek Cecil ) , his son , who suffers from rapid aging syndrome . Penrose warns Christopher to be careful and that they only need one more woman to [MASK]omplete the process . B[MASK] this time , Charlie has found a recent murder victim killed in [MASK]he same fashion as Olivia 's serial murdere[MASK] . At Walter 's [MASK]ab , th[MASK]y identify the pituitary gland has bee[MASK] removed . The[MASK] rationalize the murderer must extract hormones from the glands to slow down his own[MASK]aging process . Walter hypothesizes they can discov[MASK]r the location of the crime by looking at the im[MASK]ges left in the woman 's optical nerves induced by the paralyzing sedative . Borr[MASK]wing an electronic pulse[MASK]camera from Massi[MASK]e Dynamic , they discover the image of a suspension bridge[MASK]near Stoughton and identif[MASK] the likely location from which it was viewed — the same warehouse that Dr. Penrose visited . The FBI[MASK]converge on the building , and Olivia and Peter find Penrose abou[MASK] to cu[MASK] i[MASK]to another victim . Ol[MASK]via chases off after Christopher , who eventual[MASK]y succumbs to his rapid aging and dies , while Peter , after nicking Penrose with a bullet , confers with Wa[MASK]ter to apply a makeshift defibrillator to bri[MASK]g the victim back to life . 
 As they wrap up the case , Olivia , Peter , and Walter complete forms to finalize their position in the Fringe division . When Peter is out of earshot , Walter learns from Olivia that the FBI medical files on Peter 's childhood are void of any details . 
 
 = = Production = = 
 
 Co @-@ creators J. J. Abrams , Alex Kurtzman and Roberto Orci , and executive producer Jeff Pinkner w[MASK]ote the ep[MASK]sode . Paul A. Edwards s[MASK]rved as th[MASK] director , his first such credi[MASK] for the serie[MASK] . In developing Fringe , the co @-@ creators did not want to make[MASK]the series too serialized , as[MASK]th[MASK]s was a co[MASK]plaint often directed at Abrams ' television series Alias . T[MASK]ey wanted to find a balance between standalone stories and serialized content , and studied p[MASK]ocedural dramas such as Law and Order and CSI : Crime Scene Investigation for inspiration . Kurztman explained , " While we make sure that our episodes are sel[MASK] @-@ contained – have a beginning , a middle , and an end – the c[MASK]aracter stories can be serialized . They don 't h[MASK]ve to resolve[MASK]themselves over the course of on[MASK] show . " " The Same Old Story " was Fringe 's first regular episode , an[MASK] some journalists viewed it as an example of how the series would be structured . 
 The episode was based [MASK]n actual rece[MASK]t[MASK]research and involved much collaboration among the ser[MASK]es ' different departments . For the s[MASK]ene in wh[MASK]ch they remove the victim 's[MASK]eyeball , the special effect[MASK] crew created a mold based on actress Elizabeth[MASK]Stanl[MASK]y 's head . Using plaster to mak[MASK] a prosthetic , they " drilled out the eyeball and sculpt [ ed ] it open and [ went ] through a series of molds . " Stanley stated that " it 's really cool to see the head because it really do[MASK]s look just [MASK]ike me , even though it 's very gruesome because the eyeball 's popping out . " The prop department rigged [MASK] weap[MASK][MASK] which they called a " photon gun " ; according to pro[MASK] master Peter Gelfman , this gun was based on real [MASK]evices employed in airport security that look th[MASK]ough people[MASK]'[MASK] clothing for concealed weapons . VFX Supervisor Christopher Scollard explained that for the eye 's last v[MASK]sion , t[MASK]ey used " a lot [MASK]f actual photo[MASK]raphic referen[MASK]e on the [MASK]et and on the location , " which they then used to " take that imag[MASK]ry and composite it into the various computer monitors and dis[MASK]lays in the lab .[MASK]" 
 " The Same Ol[MASK] Story " featured guest appearances by actors Der[MASK]k Cecil as Christopher Penrose and Mark Blum as his father , Dr. Claus Penrose . Ot[MASK]er guest actors included Betty Gilpin as Loraine " Amber " Daisy Alcott , Bernie McInerney as old Christopher Penr[MASK]se , Carmen Goodine [MASK]s Amy , Ty Jones as a doctor , and Karin Agst[MASK]m as John Scott 's sister . 
 
 = = Reception = = 
 
 
 = [MASK] = Ratings[MASK]= = = 
 
 " The Same Old Story " was watche[MASK] by 13 @.@[MASK]272 million viewers in the United States , a 45 percent increase of four million from the pilot . Fox claimed that this ratings improvement was the best [MASK]or any new network drama series in over five years .[MASK]Its high @-@ rated[MASK]lead @-@ in , House , helped[MASK]boost Fringe 's ratin[MASK]s for the night , [MASK]s 93 percent of House 's total audience and 95 percent of 18- [MASK]o 49 @-@ year @-@ olds stayed to watch Fringe . Fringe was also the highest rated program for male 18- to 54 @-@ year @-@ olds that evening . 
 
 = = = Reviews = = = 
 
 " The Same Old Story " received mixed reviews from television critics . TV Squad writer Jane Boursaw thought [MASK]he episode seemed " all over the place " , and wasn 't sure what to think . She stated the two most interesting parts of the episode were when Walter remo[MASK]ed the girl 's eye in order to iden[MASK]ity her killer , and the cliffhanger at[MASK]the very end , when Walter states " If yo[MASK] 've read [MASK]y file , then you know the t[MASK]uth about Peter 's m[MASK]dical histor[MASK] " . Travis Fickett of IGN thought it was better than the pil[MASK]t ; though it[MASK]was " laden with lots of clunky[MASK]ex[MASK]osition and clichéd dial[MASK]gue , " Fickett understood that it was needed to acquaint new viewers to the show . Fickett concluded his review by[MASK]saying Fringe has t[MASK]e potential to be a " gre[MASK]t show " , and he a[MASK]so praised the[MASK]production level as " top notch " , and Torv 's performance as " very good " as she " brings a unique presence to t[MASK]e show " . The A.V. Club critic[MASK]Noel Murray ga[MASK][MASK] the episode a C + , while Television Without Pity graded it with a B. 
 Josh Jackson of [MASK]aste Magazine disliked the " deus ex machina " as[MASK]ects that " neatly solved the puzzles of the first two episodes " , and also criticized per[MASK]eived " plot[MASK]contrivances " like how the serial[MASK]murderer immediately began aging once interr[MASK]pted from killing his last [MASK]ictim . Despite these flaws , Jackson said he would tune in[MASK]next week because he would " rat[MASK]er hav[MASK] a show err on the side of unbelievable than unremarkable ,[MASK]and I 'm interested to[MASK]see if Abrams has any more tricks up his sleeve " . Erin Fox of TV Guide also liked " The Same[MASK]Old Story " better than the pilot because[MASK]she thought that it " had really cool special effects , awesome Walter @-@ isms , and actual chemistry forming between [MASK]livia and Peter " , and " we also got to delve more into the conne[MASK]tions [MASK]etween Walter , Nina Sharp , Massive Dynamic and the government and the experiments they conducted before Walter was institutionalized " . 
 A UGO Network[MASK] columnist was concerned that the expensive pilot would be har[MASK] to translate into weekly episodes , but " after sitting down to w[MASK]tch Fringe 's secon[MASK] episode , [MASK] The Same Old Story " , my concerns have vanished . Fri[MASK][MASK]e 's second episode represents all that is holy about genre programming without sacrificing any of Fringe 's eleven @-@ herbs and spices . In fact , the subtle framework of what makes Fringe not X @-@ Files is[MASK]even bette[MASK] defined in the first weekly @-@ episode . I 'd struggl[MASK]d to find the word to describe it , and the winner is[MASK]' condensed ' . " The Same Old Story " has all of the sense of mystery , discov[MASK]ry , and humor that the pilot[MASK]had [MASK]ust in a smaller , mo[MASK]e combustible space . " Another UGO writer , Alex Zalben , later compared " The Same Old Story " to the similarly @-@ plotted The X @-@ Files episode " Død Kalm " . Zalben conclud[MASK]d that " Fringe wins this one , just for having a slightly less st[MASK]pid e[MASK]planation [MASK] " 
 
 
 = Randy Blythe manslaughter case = 
 
 The Randy Blythe manslaughter case w[MASK]s a court case in the Czech Republic , stemming from a 2010 Lamb of God concert in Prague , wherein[MASK]19 @-@ year @-@ [MASK]ld fan Daniel Nosek sustained head injuries leading to a coma and[MASK]subseque[MASK]t death . During the inve[MASK]tigat[MASK]on , Czech police unsuccessfully asked United States authorities for cooperation [MASK] When the band returned to th[MASK] [MASK]zech Republic for anot[MASK]er concert [MASK]wo years later , [MASK]ts vocalist Randy Blythe was arrested , charged[MASK]with causing Nosek 's de[MASK]th , and remanded in custody for five weeks . 
 According to a ver[MASK]ict delivered by the Municipal Court in Prague on[MASK]March 5 , 2013 , it was[MASK]p[MASK]oven that Blythe had thrown Nosek offstage and thus had moral responsibility for his death . However , d[MASK]e to the circumstances , Blythe was not held criminally liable , and most of the blame lay with promoters and security members . The acquittal was upheld b[MASK] the Prague High C[MASK]urt on June 5 , 2013 . 
 
 = = 2010 concert incident = = 
 
 During a concert on May 24 [MASK] 2010[MASK], in the Prague club , Abato[MASK] , Blythe was invo[MASK]ved in an incident that resulted in the death of Daniel Nosek , a 19 @-@ year @-@ old attending fan . According to eyewitness statemen[MASK]s cited by the Czech online daily newspaper aktuálně.cz following Blythe 's arrest , Blythe was chanting " Come on up " between songs , which , the newspape[MASK] stated , may have been intended to invite applause from the aud[MASK]ence and n[MASK]t a direct invitation [MASK]o fans . The newspaper went on to report that the fan tried to climb [MASK]n[MASK]tage and was thrown by the singer from the stage , falling backwards directly on his head . According to the same paper , Nosek was not under the influence o[MASK] drugs[MASK]or alcohol[MASK], suffered serious brain trauma , fell into a coma , and died weeks later from his injuries . 
 A report about the concert at[MASK]issue released on May 26 , 2010 by topzine.cz stated that " one of the things that was unexpected was the behavior of the singer Randall Blythe , w[MASK]o on a few occasions struck some fans in a relatively[MASK]brut[MASK]l way off the stage . " The article also contains pictures , one of them showing Blythe holding a fan down on the ground . Meanwhile , another[MASK]report released two days after the concert by metalopolis.net alleged that " Randy in a totally uncompromising way took down an impertinent fan , who has climbed the podium several times . The front @-@ man clearly showed that it is his te[MASK]ritory , he struck the intruder down , punched him a couple of times and sent him through the air off [MASK]he podium , without even stopping singing ([MASK]! ) " On May 28 , 2010 , t[MASK]e report b[MASK] marastmusic.com stated that " some [MASK]roken head was a testimony to the fact that the band does not like anybody on the stage " , while abysszine.com stated th[MASK]t " the only negative thin[MASK] [MASK]bout the concert was , to say it mildly ,[MASK]disputable approach of the band towards the stage[MASK]@-@ divers ... when somebody t[MASK]ied to climb t[MASK]e stage , he w[MASK]s brutally swept down . " 
 Follow[MASK]ng Blythe 's arrest , Tomáš Fiala , a promoter of the concert , said that there was no fight between the fan and Blythe , and that " it was an unfortunate incident which [MASK]appened during the concert when someone climbed onto the stage whe[MASK]e he was not supposed to be . " According to the Lamb of God publicist Adrenaline[MASK]PR , " [ the ] incident[MASK]deals with a fan that three times [MASK]uring[MASK]the[MASK]c[MASK]ncert jumped the barricade and rushed Randy during the performance . It i[MASK] alleged that the third time , security was not able to reach him and that Randy pushed h[MASK]m back into [MASK]he audience where supposedly he [MASK]ell and hit[MASK]his head . " However , it was[MASK]revealed during the trial [MASK]hat it was a different fan who previously got into contact with Blythe than Nosek . Guitarist Willie Adler said , " I can 't recall that particular show , let alone a fan being beaten on the stage . I think I w[MASK]uld 've noticed somethi[MASK]g like that considering the Dime thing [MASK] " 
 According to Blythe 's attorney Martin Radvan , the police launched an investigati[MASK]n following the death of Nosek , about a month after the concert and following a coma . [MASK]fter in[MASK]erviewing several eyewitnesses from the concert , the police asked the United States Department of Justice to take part in the investigation ; however , they refused to coo[MASK][MASK]rate and , moreover , did not notify anyone from L[MASK]mb of God or its management . 
 
 = = Arrest and charges = = [MASK] 
 On June 27 , 2012 , Blythe was arrested by the Czec[MASK] police [MASK]n [MASK]uspicion of manslaughter . Lamb of God was prepared to play in Prague[MASK]on June 28 , 2[MASK]12 , but Blythe[MASK]'s arrest upon arrival at Ruzyně Airport caused the concert to be canceled . 
 According to TV[MASK]Nova , [MASK]lyth[MASK] stated that he had[MASK]not been a[MASK]are of Nosek 's death and expressed his remorse . 
 A police sp[MASK]kesperson [MASK]tated on June 29 , 2012 that[MASK]the police had formally charged Blythe un[MASK]er se[MASK]tion 146 ( 4 ) [MASK]f the Czech Crimin[MASK]l Code , which contains intention[MASK]l infliction of bodily ha[MASK]m resulting in death ( i.e. manslaughter ) . He faced 5 – 10 years of imprisonment if found guilty . Randy 's brother Mark Blythe said the charge was " bogus and outrageous and will be dropped im[MASK][MASK]diately . " 
 
[MASK]=[MASK]= Court remand and bail = = 
 
 On June 30 , 2012 , the St[MASK]te Attorney brought a motion to reman[MASK] Blythe in pre @-@ trial detention , as he considered Blythe a flight risk . During a hearing conducted the same day , judge Petr[MASK]Fassati of the Prague 8 District Cour[MASK] ru[MASK]ed that Blythe will be held on remand , with the[MASK]possibility of a bail of CZK 4 @,@ 000 @,@ 000 ( ~ US $ 200 @,@ 000 ) , Blythe 's alleged annual income ; Blythe[MASK]w[MASK]s held[MASK]i[MASK] Pankrác Prison . Bail was deposited in the court 's bank account on mid @-@ day of July 3 , 2012 . After this , the State Attorney had three working days to either accept the bail or to challenge it by f[MASK]ling a complaint . Due to public holidays it was not until July 9 , 2012 , that the State [MASK]ttorney filed his complaint , which was to be deal[MASK] with by appellate court , the Prague Municipal Court . 
 On July 17 , 2012 , Prague Municipal Court 's panel of three judges headed by ju[MASK]ge Luboš Vrba overturned the bail decision by doubling the bail amount to CZK 8 million ( ~ US $ 400 @,@ 000 ) . After this[MASK], the State Attorney challenged the conditions of release , trying to achieve that the bail is subject to B[MASK]ythe staying in the country and / or Blythe havin[MASK] to report at a given police station regularly until the criminal proceedings are[MASK]finished . [MASK]n Augu[MASK]t[MASK]2 , 2012 , the appellate court rejected the State Attorney 's second complaint and ordered Blythe 's immedi[MASK]t[MASK] release . Blythe left the Czech Republic the n[MASK]xt da[MASK][MASK], claim[MASK]ng in an interv[MASK]ew with TV Nova that he would return for [MASK]he trial . 
 
 = = Indictment and trial = = 
 
 On November 13 , 2012 , the spokesperson of the Prague State Attorney 's Office announced t[MASK]at the police had formal[MASK]y cl[MASK]sed their investigation and proposed to the S[MASK]ate Atto[MASK]ney to indi[MASK]t Blythe[MASK]. After reviewing the case file , the State Attorney indicted Blythe on the aforementioned c[MASK]arges on November 30 , 2012 . Two weeks later , a judge set the trial to commence on February 4 , 2013 , with a[MASK]plan to conduct the hearings in four consecutive days . Blythe was summoned to attend the hea[MASK]ing in person . 
 The case was heard by a panel of the Pragu[MASK] Municipal Court , consisting of presiding professional judge Tomáš Kubovec and two[MASK]lay judges[MASK]. Trials in the Czech Republic are public . In [MASK]eneral , the co[MASK]rt is bound to decide on the deed as stated in the indictment ;[MASK]however , it is [MASK]ot bound by its legal ass[MASK]ssment by the State Attorney . 
 Both the defendant and the [MASK]tate Attorney may appeal the decision ; the appeal would be heard by a panel of the Prague High Court , consisting of three professio[MASK]al judges . A decision of second instance cou[MASK]t is final and enforceable . Nevertheless , an extraordinary appeal may be lodged by the defendant or the Supr[MASK]me State Attorney , whi[MASK]h would be heard by the Supreme Court of the Czech Republic in Brno ; an extraordinary appeal may , however , r[MASK]st only on issues of law and does not provide for full r[MASK]view of the case . After exhausting all of these remedies , the defendant may also lodge [MASK] petition to the Constitutional C[MASK]urt of the Czech[MASK]Republic . The pe[MASK]ition may b[MASK] bas[MASK]d on allegation of violation of rights under the Czech Constitution and Charter of Fundamental Rights and Basic Freedoms . 
 
 = = = State Attorney Vladimír Mužík = = = 
 
 Indictment against Blythe was brought by State Attorney Vladimír Mužík . Mužík had tried a number of murderers [MASK] such as Luboš Mika ( life in prison ) , Ro[MASK]an [MASK]idler ( life imprisonment at 1st instance , 25 years on ap[MASK]eal )[MASK], Maria Zolotukinová ( 13 years imprisonment ) and Petr Pr[MASK]cházka ( 1[MASK] years imprisonment ) . He also [MASK]ried a case against [MASK]ndranik Soghojan , an alleged h[MASK]ad of Russian mafia , requesting 25 years in pri[MASK]on for ordering a murder . The Municipal Court in Prague acquitted Soghojan due to lack of evidence ; however , the decision was rep[MASK]aled [MASK]n appeal by the High Court , and the[MASK]case will be heard again by a different tribunal of the Municipal Court . Another of Muží[MASK] 's m[MASK]rder cases which ended in acquittal due to insufficient evidence is that of Miroslav Rus , who was indic[MASK]ed[MASK]in connection with[MASK]disappearance of Miroslav Kříž , a vice @-@ chairman of the Czec[MASK] Football Associ[MASK]tion . 
 
 = = = [MASK]efense lawyers = = = 
 
 Randy Blythe was represented by Prague [MASK]awyers Martin Radvan and Vladimír Ja[MASK]lonský . R[MASK]dvan studied law at the Faculty of Law of[MASK]Charles University and at the New York University . From 1990 to 1992 , he served as external advisor of the then Prime Minister Marián Čalfa . A former partner at Baker & McKenzie , Rad[MASK]an established Radvan &[MASK]Co. in 1996 . He [MASK]s also a member of board of directors of Forum 2000 . 
 Jablonský gained fame a[MASK] attorney of Y[MASK]kta Uzunoglu , a Kurdish national who was first charged in 1994 with preparing to commit three murders and [MASK]ommitting blackmail and torture . It became one of the longest cr[MASK]minal cases in the Czech history , as the witnes[MASK]es and alleg[MASK]d victims gradually withdrew or changed their testimonies against Uzunoglu until h[MASK] was exonerated by the Municipal Court in Prague in 2007 . [MASK]he court held that although the crimes did[MASK]take place , there is no evidence that Uzunoglu took part in it . He was also defending judge Pavel Nagy , who was indicted of accepting a bribe . The proceedings ended with Nagy being found insan[MASK] and[MASK]criminally not liable . Jablonský also acted as a defense attorney in the case of a hairdresser of Czech VIPs indicted on [MASK]harge[MASK] of rape and torture . During the procee[MASK]ings , the judge sent Jablonský to fac[MASK] the disciplinary commission of the Czech bar association for what he perceived a[MASK] " beha[MASK]iour bordering on contempt " . 
 
 = = = Da[MASK] 1 of the trial = = = 
 
 The trial started on February 4 , 2013 . Blythe testified that when [MASK]e wanted to see the club before the concert , La[MASK]b of God 's technician told him[MASK]that the club was terrible and messy . According to Blythe , the technician went on , saying that the stage was [MASK]mall ,[MASK]there were too many people , and that it was rather danger[MASK]us . 
 Blythe , who is nearsighted , took off his glasses be[MASK]ore entering th[MASK] stage , which together with the smoke and light effects allegedly left him half @-@ blind . Blythe said[MASK]that people co[MASK]ld easily reach the band members or climb up [MASK]o [MASK]he stage . One of the fans , who was identified as Milan Pořádek by Czech newspapers , and who w[MASK]s scheduled to testify la[MASK]er during the proceedings , managed to[MASK]climb the stage twice without being stopped by security . Blythe testified that during t[MASK]e first attempt , Pořádek rushed the stage and started waving [MASK]is arms before stage diving . The second time , he tried to put his arms around Blythe in an attempt to h[MASK]g him[MASK]. Blythe , who according to his own words perceived this as a danger , caught Pořádek 's collar , pushed him on the ground , knelt on him and repeatedly told him to stop . He then led the fan by his hair to the[MASK]edge of the stage , where the fan jumped off . It was only after watching a video of the incident that Blythe found out that a se[MASK]urity officer [MASK]as actually pushing the fan from back . Blythe[MASK]fur[MASK]her said that he saw Pořádek trying to reach the stage yet again before finally being stopped by security . 
 Later , when another fan tried to climb the stage , Blythe thought that[MASK]it was Pořádek again . Blythe testified that he approached the fan and pushe[MASK] him with both hands out of the stage in the belief that the crowd would catch him , which [MASK]t did not . Jiří Choroš , author of video which caught the previous incidents with Pořádek , testified that the fan was for a moment lying on th[MASK] ground with nobody helping him . Blythe further commented that he[MASK]saw the fan get up and that other fans showed him thumbs up . Blythe i[MASK]sisted that he never saw Nosek nor came into contact[MASK]with him . It was not un[MASK]il the a[MASK]rest two years later that he found out about Nosek 's death [MASK] 
 Blythe further testified that he was not under the influence of alcohol during the concert and that he had never used any dr[MASK]gs . Ch[MASK]is Adler ,[MASK]Lamb of God 's drummer , testified that he had not seen anything from the back of the stage and further proclaimed that Blythe 's aggressiveness is only a stage act . According to Adler , Blythe is a calm , mode[MASK]ate , and well @-@ r[MASK]ad perso[MASK] . The defense also p[MASK]esented videos fr[MASK]m various Lamb of God concerts in order to demonstrate that metal music is very energetic and that Blythe regularly cheers to the crowd , but[MASK]not to encourage people to climb th[MASK] stage . 
 Blythe also alleged that after learning about Nosek 's death , he had written a letter to the Nosek family , in which he offered help and a meeting in @-@ person .[MASK]Daniel Nosek[MASK]'s father , however , testified that the family has not been contacted by anyone from the band nor by the defense[MASK]team . Nosek 's father confirmed that his son had been healthy[MASK]up until the day of the [MASK]ncident . The Nosek family 's repr[MASK]sentative brought a claim for damages in the amount of CZK 10 @[MASK]@ 000 @,@ 000 ( approx[MASK]. US $ 530 @,@ 000 ) . 
 
 = = = Day 2 of the tr[MASK]al = = = 
[MASK]
 Altogether , eight witnesses del[MASK]vered their testimonies on February 5 , 2013 . Among them were friends of Daniel Nosek . Nosek and three friends had come to attend[MASK]the concert from Vrchlabí , a town in mountains some 130 kilometres ( 81 mi ) nort[MASK]west of Prague . They described Nosek as a huge fan of Lamb of God who had been able to secure an autograph from a guitar player before the concert had started . 
 Nosek 's friend Jan Jebavý testified that[MASK]Nosek climbed[MASK]the stage , and as he turned around to[MASK]ards the crowd he was pushed by Blythe off the st[MASK]ge . He said he was " 100 % sure Blythe pushed Nosek with both hands . " He further said that Blythe 's behavior devia[MASK]ed from all the concerts he had attended in the p[MASK]st , commenting that Blythe was visibly furious . He further claimed that Nosek was not the first person to be chased off the stage by Blythe , with [MASK]nother fan being k[MASK]cked , choked and receiving a punch from Blythe . Jebavý corrobo[MASK]ated Blythe 's testimony that Blythe asked " Ar[MASK] you okay ? " after Nosek fell an[MASK] that the crowd g[MASK]ve him a positive reply . However , as Nosek fell s[MASK]ck after the concert , they called him an ambulance . Ac[MASK]ording to Jebavý , the band had not warned the fans against getting on stage and the security guards did not pay much attention to it [MASK] 
 Nosek 's other friend Ondře[MASK] Vlach testified that Nosek 's fall happened in a [MASK]reak between the end of concert an[MASK] the encore . No[MASK]ek climbed the stage together with another fan as the band members were leaving to [MASK]o backstage . According to him , Blythe ran into the two[MASK]fans and pushed them [MASK]oth off . While the other fan was caught by a couple of fans remainin[MASK] under the stage , Nosek fell di[MASK]ectly[MASK]on the ground . Acco[MASK]ding [MASK]o Vlach , there wer[MASK] fewer fans in front of the stage due[MASK]to the break[MASK]. Vlach furth[MASK]r testified that after the fall , [MASK]osek we[MASK]t to [MASK]it on a bench , where he was fetched a water bottle . Nosek began vomiting about half an h[MASK]ur after t[MASK]e fall and as[MASK]his f[MASK]iends rea[MASK]ized that he[MASK]had a bulge at the back of his [MASK]ead , they cal[MASK]ed an ambulance for fear[MASK]he might have a concussion . Vlac[MASK] said that he un[MASK]erstood Bly[MASK]he 's gestur[MASK] in the b[MASK]eak as an invitation to the stage . 
 A[MASK]other perso[MASK] to testify was[MASK]Robert Havelka , who worked[MASK]as a security guard[MASK]the night of the inciden[MASK] . Havelka [MASK]aid that the [MASK]uardrail was too close to the stage[MASK], but n[MASK]t so close as[MASK]to make a platform for climbing the stage . He testified that he pulled one person off the stage and that anoth[MASK]r person fell off before he could be secu[MASK]ed . He further [MASK]aid that the fan 's fall might have been helped by someone else , perhaps the singer , though he did not see it precisely . 
 Blythe 's defense team attacked differences between the testimonies th[MASK] witnesses gave after the incident in 2010 and at the court .
