 = = Producti[MASK]n = = 
 
 
 = = = Development = = = 
 
 Markowitz 's script for Horrible Bosses was sold at auction to New Line Cinema by Ratner 's production company Rat Entertainment in 200[MASK] for a six @[MASK]@ figure amount . Ratner i[MASK]itially was interested in directing , but be[MASK]ame occupied[MASK]wi[MASK]h directing the come[MASK]y Tower Heist . Frank Oz and David Dobkin were in talks to direct . Jonathan Goldstein and John Francis Daley rewrote the script in 2010 , and the project went into production with Seth Gordon directing . 
 
 = = = Design = = = 
 
 Produ[MASK]tion designe[MASK] Shepherd Fr[MASK]nkel specifically set out to create distinctly different environments for the three employees and their respective bosses ' homes and offices . Nick and Harken 's workplace is [MASK]he " Comnidyne " bullpen , which was designed to " enhance the discomfort an[MASK] anxiety of lower @-@ level employees clustered in the center of the room where every movement is m[MASK]nitored by the boss from his corner office[MASK]. " The design team[MASK]met with financial strategists and management companies to learn about the architecture of their office layouts to visually represent the experience of starting from a low @-@ r[MASK]nking po[MASK]ition in a cubicle and aspiring to[MASK]an o[MASK][MASK]ice . Costume designer Carol Ramsey worked with Frankel and set decorator Jan Pascale to match Harken 's suit to that of th[MASK] surrounding " cold grey and blue " colo[MASK] palette of his office[MASK]. Harken 's home was d[MASK]scribed as " equally lackin[MASK] in warmth " as the office but more lavishly decorated and " for show " , including an intentionally oversized portrait of him with his " trophy wife " . 
 De[MASK]igning Julia 's office was descr[MASK]bed as a [MASK] challenge " , i[MASK]fusing a " sensual vibe " into a denta[MASK] office . Frankel approached the design through Julia 's mentality , stating , " She 's a Type A pro[MASK]essional at the top of her game [MASK] who likes to play cat @-@ and @-@ mous[MASK] , so it 's a completely controlled environment , with [MASK]pertures and views into other rooms so she alway[MASK] knows what 's g[MASK]ing on " . " It 's highly designed , with rich wallpaper and tones , sumptuous artwork and subtle lighting — all very disarming till you step into her private office . The blinds close , the door lock[MASK] and you[MASK]think , ' It [MASK]s the Temple of Doo[MASK] . ' " Similarly[MASK]approaching the character 's home , the design allowed for wide windows which face onto a public st[MASK]eet " which afford [MASK]er the[MASK]opportunity to put on the kind of show she cou[MASK]dn 't get away with at work . " 
 Bobby 's environme[MASK]ts were designed with more[MASK]contrast , the characte[MASK] being new to the[MASK]work area . Frankel described the contrast as " the [MASK]ompany reflects [ Jack Pellitt 's ] human touch , whereas [MASK] Bobby Pellitt [MASK]s ] home is a shameless shrine to himself and his hedonistic [MASK]ppetites . " Frankel continued , " It[MASK]featu[MASK]es a mishmash of anything he finds exotic and er[MASK]tic , mostly Egyptian and Asian motifs with an ' 80s Studio 54 vi[MASK]e , a makeshift dojo , lots of mirrors and a massage table . " Some parts of the house design were provided by Farrell and Gordon 's interpretation of the character[MASK]and his " infatuation " with martial arts and " his delusions of prowess " . 
 
 = = = Filming = = = 
 
 Filming of Horrible Bosses took place in an[MASK] around Los Angeles . The product[MASK]on [MASK]eam attempted to find locations " that people haven '[MASK] already seen a hundred times in movies and on TV " , aimi[MASK]g fo[MASK] the film to appear as if it could be taking place anywhere in America " where people are trying to pursue the [MASK][MASK]er[MASK]can dream but getting stopped by a horrible boss . " " Comnidyine " [MASK]as r[MASK]presented by an office building[MASK]in Torrance , California , with the crew building[MASK]the set on a vacant floor[MASK]. For " Pellitt Chem[MASK]cal " , the production team found[MASK]a " perfect landscap[MASK] of pipes and containers " in Santa Fe Springs , surrounding an unoccupied water clea[MASK]ing and storage facility . To take advanta[MASK]e of the[MASK]surrounding imagery , the warehouse required an extens[MASK]ve series of overhauls , including cutting windows into concrete [MASK]alls and cre[MASK]ti[MASK]g new doorwa[MASK]s to allow for [MASK]isuals of the warehouse [MASK][MASK]terior and provide a settin[MASK] for the final scene of Sutherla[MASK]d 's character . A T.G.I. Friday 's in Woodland Hil[MASK]s , Los Angeles , was used a[MASK] a bar frequented by Nick , Dale ,[MASK]an[MASK] Kurt[MASK], while the bar scene where the[MASK] meet with J[MASK][MASK]es was staged in [MASK]owntown Los Angeles . 
 The film was shot digitally using the Panavision Ge[MASK]esis camera . Gordon encouraged the actors to improvise , thoug[MASK] Aniston claimed to not have taken advantage of the offer as much as her co @-@ stars , stating , " My dialogue was[MASK]just so beautifully choreographed that there wasn ’ t much that I needed to do ” . 
 
 = = = Music = = = 
 
 The soundtrack was composed by award @-@ winning composer Christopher Lennertz , with music contributed by Mike McCready of Pearl Jam , [MASK]tefan Lessard of Dave Matthews Band and Money Mar[MASK] — a collaborator with the [MASK]east[MASK]e Boys . McCready , Lessard , and Mark worked with musicians Matt Chamberlain , David Levita , Aaron Kaplan , Victor Indrizzo , Chris Chaney , Davey Chegwidden and DJ Cheapshot to develop the music . Major contributions were provi[MASK]ed by Mark on keyboard , McCready and Levita on guitar , Chaney and [MASK]essard on bass , Indrizzo on drums and DJ Cheapshot on t[MASK]rntables . 
 Lennertz recorded the soundtrack at The Village recording studio in West Los Angeles and C[MASK]pitol Records . Lenn[MASK]rtz attempted to remain " authentic " to the characters ' progression from av[MASK]rage worker to calculated killer . To achieve this aim , he decided against recording digitally , instead recording the tracks on two @-@ inch analog tape , intending each musica[MASK] cue to sound as if it was emanating from a vinyl record . He explained , " The idea was to put together a band that would record the score together the same way that they[MASK]would make an alb[MASK]m . It isn 't over @-@ produced or shiny and digital in any way . It 's[MASK]brash , nois[MASK] , and full of bravado and swagger . I knew that if we could harness some of this sonic magic i[MASK] the score , then the toughness and [MASK]onf[MASK]dence of the music would play against Bateman , Sudeik[MASK]s , and Charlie Day to really emphasize and elevate the humor in the situations tha[MASK] transpire . " Lennertz continued , " We tracked through tape before Pro Tools to get that fat sound , and made every ch[MASK]ice based on feel rather than perfection . We even used the same Wurlitzer that Money Mark play[MASK]d on Beck 's classic ‘ Where I[MASK] 's At ’ . At the end of the day , Seth [ Gordon ] and I wanted to produce a score that is [MASK]s irreverent and full of attitude as the movie itself . I think we did it ... and most of all , everyone had [MASK] blast in the process . " 
 Horr[MASK]ble Bosses : The Original Motion Picture Soundtrack was released in [MASK]hysical and digital formats on July 5 , 20[MASK]1 , by WaterTower Music . The soundtra[MASK]k consists of 33[MASK]tracks with a runtime of 63 mi[MASK]utes . 
 
 = = Release = = 
 
[MASK]The world premiere of Horrible Bosses took place on June 30 , 2011 at Grauman 's Chinese Theat[MASK]e in Holly[MASK]ood , California . 
 
 = = = Box office = = = 
 
 [MASK]orrible Bosses grossed $ 117 @.@ 5 milli[MASK]n ( 56 @.@ 1 % ) in the North America and $ 92 @.@ 2 million ( 43 @.@ 9 % ) i[MASK] other territories for a wo[MASK]ldwide gross of $ 209 @.@ 6 million , aga[MASK]nst its budget of $ 35 million . 
 North Ameri[MASK]a 
 Horrible Bosses was released on July 8 , 2011 in the United States and Canada across [MASK] @,@ 040 theaters . It grossed $ 9.9M on the first d[MASK]y , g[MASK]ving[MASK]it the second la[MASK]gest opening gross for an original[MASK]R @-@ rated comedy of the summer , behind Bad Teacher ( $ 12.2M ) . For the open[MASK]ng we[MASK]kend , the film took in a total of $ 28 @,[MASK] 302 @,@ 165 , an average of[MASK]$ 9 @[MASK]@ 310 per th[MASK]ater , making it the numbe[MASK] two film for the weekend , behind Transformer[MASK] : Dark of the Moon ( $ 47.1M[MASK]) , the secon[MASK] highest @-@ grossing opening weekend for an original R @-@ rated comedy , again behind Bad Teacher ( $ 31.6M ) , and the highest @-@ grossing opening weekend ever for a dark / black comedy film , overtaking the 2004 The Stepford Wives ( $ 21.4M ) . The opening week[MASK]nd audience was 51 % male , and 64 % of the aud[MASK][MASK]nce were over 25[MASK]years[MASK]of age . The second weekend ( 1[MASK] – 17 July ) saw a further 94 theaters added , for a total of 3 @,@ 134 . Box office revenue dropped by a " respectable " 38 % , taking $ 17.6M for a total[MASK]gross of $ 60M in ten days . The film r[MASK]nked third for the weekend . It remained [MASK]n the top five films during its third wee[MASK] , dropping 33 % and leaving thirty theate[MASK]s from the previous weekend , to take in $ 11.9M for a gross of $ 82.6M [MASK]n 17 days . On July 28 , 2011 , with $ 87.6M after 20 days , Horrible Bosses surpassed The War of the Roses ( $ 8[MASK].8M ) to become the high[MASK]st grossing dark [MASK] black comedy f[MASK]lm in unadjusted dollars . 
 Other territories 
 Horrible Bosses was r[MASK]leased on Ju[MASK]y 7 , 2011 , in the United Arab Emirates ( $ 258 @,@ 108 ) , and on July 8 in Estonia ( $ 24 @,@ 471 ) , Latvia ( $ 15 @,@ 750 ) , Lebanon ( $ 36 @,@ 316 ) and Lithuan[MASK]a ( $ 13 @,@ 676 ) , grossing $ 348 @,@ 321 for the opening weekend and accruing a total of $ 855 @,@ 009 in the first 17 d[MASK]ys . On the week[MASK]nd of July 21 – 24 [MASK] the film opened in the United Kingdom ( $ 3 @,@ 386 @,@ 876 ) , Greece ( $ 367 @,@ 845 ) , I[MASK]rael ( $ 200 @,@ 372 ) , South Africa ( $ 193 @,@ 632 ) [MASK] Norway ( $ 109 @,@ 252 ) and East Africa ( $ 7 @,@ 324 ) . 
 
 = = = Critical reception = = = 
 
 Horrible Bos[MASK]es received generally positive rev[MASK]ews from critics . On Rotten Tomatoes[MASK], the film holds a rating of 68 % , based on 208[MASK]reviews , with an average rating of 6 @.@ 2 / 10 . The site 's critical consensus reads , " It 's nasty , uneven , and far from original , but thanks to a smartly assembled cast that [MASK]akes the most of a solid premise , Horrible Bosses works . " Review aggregate Metacriti[MASK] gave the film a score of 57 out of 100 , based on 40 critics , indicating " mixed or average reviews " . 
 Roger Ebert gave [MASK]he film three[MASK]and a half stars out of four , calling it " well @-@ cast " and commending it for playing to each actor 's strengths . Ebert gave particular praise to Spacey , labeling him " superb " , and Aniston ,[MASK]judging her performance to be a " surprise " and a return to form , stating " she has acute comic timing and hilariously[MASK]enacts alarming sexual hungers " . Ebert called Horrible Bosses " cheerful and wicked " . Lisa S[MASK]hwarzbaum of Enter[MASK]ainment Weekly reacted positively , calling the film " a bouncy , well @-@ built , delightfully nasty tale of resentment , desp[MASK]ration , and amoral revenge " and complimented the casting of the protagonists and antagonists . The A.V. Club 's Nathan Rabin also praised the cast , stating that the picture " succeeds almost entirely on the chemistry of its [MASK]hree leads , who remain likeable even while resorting to homicide " , add[MASK]ng the " acting more than compensates for the film 's other failings . " Rabin singled out Day 's performance as " a potent illustration of how a brilliant character actor with a[MASK]spark of madness can elevate a ramshackle lowbrow farce into a solid mainstream comedy[MASK][MASK]hrough sheer fo[MASK]ce of charisma . " Edward Douglas of ComingSoon.net credited director Seth Gordon with h[MASK]ving assembled " the perf[MASK]ct cast " , claim[MASK]ng " the six leads kill in every scene [MASK] , but echoed Nathan Rabin 's sentiments that Da[MASK] is the " real stan[MASK]out " . Douglas summarize[MASK] the picture as " dark fun that works better t[MASK]an expected due to a well @-@ deve[MASK]oped script , an impeccable cast and a director who knows how to put t[MASK]e two together " . A. O. Scott of The New York Times stated " the ti[MASK]ing of the cast ... is impeccable " and appreciated that the script did not attempt " to cut its coarseness with a hypocrit[MASK]cal dose of sweetness or respectability " . [MASK]he review c[MASK]ncluded that " in the ways that count and ev[MASK]n when it shouldn[MASK]’ t , Horrible Bosses works . [MASK] [MASK] USA[MASK]Today 's Scot[MASK] Bowles awarded the film three out of four sta[MASK]s , labeling it a " surprising comedy that rivals Bridesmaids[MASK]as the funniest film [MASK]f[MASK]the summer , if not the year . " Bowles [MASK]dded that " the [MASK]haracters are so [MASK]ikable " , giving particular credit to Sudeikis though also adding praise for the perfor[MASK]ances of[MASK]Batem[MASK]n and Day . The dialogue was also la[MASK]ded by Bowles , whi[MASK]h commented that " Seth Gordon has a [MASK]eft touch with water @-@ cooler talk — even when the water cooler might be sp[MASK]ked w[MASK]th poison . " L[MASK]onard Maltin of indieWire considered Day to have had the " breakout role "[MASK]and offered praise to the performances of the ca[MASK]t , but lamented the lack o[MASK] screen time for Farrell 's character . Maltin concluded " the movie has just enough raunchiness to identify it as a 2011 comedy , just e[MASK]ough cleverness to admire , and just the right camaraderie [MASK]mong its three male stars , which turns out to be the movie ’ [MASK] greatest strength . " Rolling Stone 's Pet[MASK]r Travers gav[MASK] kudos to the " killer cast " , with s[MASK]ecific credit gi[MASK]en to Bateman and Day , but was critical of the movie , statin[MASK] " it wussies out on a sharp pre[MASK]ise " an[MASK] that it is a " hit @-@ and @-@ [MASK]iss farce that leaves you wishing i[MASK] was funnier than it is[MASK]" The Guardian 's Philip French called Horrible Bosses " [MASK] lumberi[MASK][MASK] , misogynistic affair " , but admitted " I laughed frequently , probably to the detriment of my[MASK]self @-@ respect . " Nicholas Barber of The Independent gave a positive review , complimenting Gordon for not allowing the actors ' i[MASK]provisation to be detrimental to the pacing , b[MASK]t felt the movie was not as " dar[MASK] " as its premise required , saying "[MASK]what edginess the film does h[MASK]ve comes[MASK]instead from the inordinate quantity of swearing , plu[MASK] a smattering of homophobia a[MASK]d misogyny . " 
 Salon 's Andrew O 'Hehir offered a mixed response , characterizing the film as[MASK]a " lot funnier in theory tha[MASK] in [MASK]ract[MASK]ce , but it won 't ruin you[MASK] Saturday night " . S[MASK]lon appreciated [MASK]he " effortless comic chemistry " between Sudeikis , Bateman and Day and singled [MASK]ut Bateman , Aniston and Spacey for their performances . O 'He[MASK]ir was however critical of the perceived homophobia , sexism and racism . The Hollywood Reporter 's Kirk Honeycut[MASK] responded negatively , stating the jokes failed to be funny , stating " Seth Gordon shows no flair for[MASK]turning the absurdities and cartoonish characters in the script ... into anything m[MASK]re than a collection of moments in search of laughs . " Karina Longworth of The Village Voice was critical of[MASK]the premise , which she felt lacked any [MASK]egitimate " rage [MASK] ag[MASK]inst the characters ' bosses , stating " ... there 's every sign that , even without these particular emasculators , Dale , Kurt [MASK]nd Nick would still be — for lack of a better word — total pussies . " Longworth felt that the humor [MASK]as " rarely actually laugh @-@ out @-@ l[MASK]ud funny , and never truly dark [MASK]r daring "[MASK]. She [MASK]articularly criticized the all @-@ white , male protagonists and a plo[MASK] she deemed racist and f[MASK]lled with [MASK] stereotypes " . Justin Chang o[MASK] Variety praised the performance of the ensemble cast , but considered the plot to be " predicta[MASK]ly moronic , vulgar and juvenile " . Chang echoed the sentiments of The Vil[MASK]age Voice in lamenting that the film failed to pursue the premise to " darker , [MASK]ore daring terri[MASK]ory " [MASK][MASK]d faulted it for falling back on " over @-@[MASK]the @-@ to[MASK] comic e[MASK]aggeration " . 
 
 = = = Accolades = = = 
 
 The film received several award n[MASK]minations , including a Satellite Award for Best Supporting Actor for Colin Farr[MASK]ll , and thr[MASK]e nomina[MASK]ions from the 2012 Comedy Awards , including Comedy Actor for Bateman , Comed[MASK] Actress for Aniston , and best Comedy Film . Farrell and Aniston were both nominated for Best On @[MASK]@ Screen Dirt Bag at the 2012 MTV Movie Awards , with Aniston claiming the award . Farrell also received a nomination for Best[MASK]On [MASK]-@ Screen Tran[MASK]formation . [MASK] 
[MASK]= = = Home [MASK]edia = = = 
 
 On July 26 , 2011 , FX obtained the rights to the network premiere of t[MASK]e fil[MASK] . [MASK] Ho[MASK]rible Bosses was released on DVD[MASK]and Blu @-@ [MASK]ay Disc in the United States on October[MASK]11 , 2011 . The DVD version sold an estimated 400 @,@ 682 units in the United States during its first week , earning approximately $ 6 @.@ 1 million . It was the number 2 best selling DVD of the week , finishing behind Green [MASK]antern , and the number [MASK] Blu @-@ ray disc film behin[MASK] Green Lan[MASK]ern and The Lio[MASK] King . As of Novemb[MASK]r 2012 , it has sold an estimated 1 @.@ 3 million units an[MASK] earned $ 18 @.@ 3 million . 
 The[MASK]DVD contains the t[MASK]eatrical cut of the film and deleted scenes . The Blu @-@ ray Dis[MASK] edition contains the Blu @-@ ray Disc , the DVD and a digital version of the film in a single pack .[MASK]The Blu @-@ ray Dis[MASK] version is an unrated , extended cut ( the " Tota[MASK]l[MASK] Inappropriate Edition " ) with a runtime of 106 minutes compared to the theatrical 98 minutes . The Blu @-@[MASK]ray Disc contains deleted [MASK]cenes and four featurettes : My Least Favorite Career , Surviving a Ho[MASK]rible Boss , Being Mean Is So Much Fun , and The Making of the Horr[MASK]ble [MASK]osses Soundtrack . Both the theatrical and extended cu[MASK]s are presented in the film 's original aspect ratio of 2 @.@ 39 : 1 with DTS @-@ HD Master Audio sound . Beginning with t[MASK]e Blu @-@ ray Disc release o[MASK] Horrible Bosses and Green Lan[MASK]ern , Warne[MASK] Bros. included a code that allows the owner[MASK]to access a version of[MASK]the film via UltraViolet , a cloud storage service which allows stream[MASK]ng or downloading to a variety of devices . 
 
 = = Sequel = = 
 
 Seth Go[MASK]don confirmed in July 2011 that talks were underway for a sequel , after the[MASK]financial success of the film in the United States , saying :[MASK]" Yeah , we 'v[MASK] definitel[MASK] discussed it . It 's done well i[MASK] the States , the film has , so that 's bec[MASK]ming a more concerted effort[MASK]now[MASK], we 're trying to figure [MASK]ut what th[MASK] sequel could be . " On January 4 , 2012 , it was confirmed that a sequel was moving forwa[MASK]d , and that[MASK]Goldstein and Da[MASK]ey w[MASK]uld be returning to write t[MASK]e script . New Line was reported to be negotiating with Gordon to return as director , with Batema[MASK] , Day , and Sudeikis also exp[MASK]cted to return to their r[MASK]les . On February 27 , 2[MASK]12 , it was con[MASK]irmed that Goldstein and Daley were in the process of writing the new script . In March 2013 , Goldstein and Daley confirmed that they had submitted mul[MASK]iple draft scripts for the sequel , and that production had moved towards finalizing the budget . Later in the same month Bateman[MASK], Day , and Sudeikis were confirmed to be reprising their roles , with Foxx negotiating to retur[MASK][MASK]. The film will again be produce[MASK] [MASK]y Brett Ratner and Jay Stern . In August 2013 ,[MASK]it was announced that Gordon would not be returning to direct because of scheduling conflicts and that the studio was a[MASK]tively searching fo[MASK] a replacement . In September 2013 , Sea[MASK] Anders was announced as Gordo[MASK] 's replacement , with John Morris joining t[MASK]e production as a producer . Th[MASK] pair had previously[MASK]performed a rewrite on Goldstein 's and Daley 's sequel script . F[MASK]l[MASK]ing had [MASK]een schedule[MASK] to begin in summer 2013 , but began in November 2013 . Foxx , Jennifer Aniston , and K[MASK]vin Spacey reprised their roles , with Christoph Waltz and Chris Pine j[MASK]ining the cast . 
 
 
 = 1985 Rajneeshee assassination plot = 
 
 The 1985 Rajneeshee ass[MASK]ssination plot was[MASK]a conspiracy by a group of high @-@ ranking followers of Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh ( later known as Osho ) to [MASK]ssassinate Charl[MASK]s Turner , the then @-@ Un[MASK]ted States Attorney for the District of Oregon . Rajneesh 's persona[MASK] secretary and second @-@ in @-@ command , Ma Anand Sheela[MASK]( Sheela Silverman ) , assembled the group after Turner was appointed to investigate il[MASK]egal a[MASK]tivity at Rajneeshpuram . Turner investigated charges of immigration fraud and sham marriages , [MASK]nd later headed the federal prosecu[MASK]ion of the 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack in The Dalles , Oregon . 
 The conspirators included : Ma Anand Sheel[MASK] , Sally @-@ Anne Croft , Chief Financial Officer of [MASK]ajneeshpuram ; Susan Hagan , head of security at Rajneeshpuram , Catherine Jane Stork , who bought weapons and silencers and volunteered to be [MASK]he actual murderer ; Ann Phyllis McCarthy , fourth @-@ in @-@ command of Rajneeshpuram ; a[MASK]d co @-@ conspirators Alma Potter [MASK] Carol Matthews , Phyllis Caldwell and Ri[MASK]hard Kevin Langford . The conspirat[MASK]rs obtained false identification to purchase handguns out @-@ [MASK]f @-@ state ,[MASK]stalked Turner , and [MASK]lanned to m[MASK]rder him near his workplace in Portland , Oregon . The assassination plo[MASK] was never carried out and was only discovered later , as a[MASK]result of the investigation by federal law enforcement into the bioterror attack in The Dalles and other illegal acts by the Rajneeshpuram leadership . 
 Prosecution [MASK]f the conspirators began in 1990 , when a federal grand jury brought indictments against several of the key players . Some had [MASK]led [MASK]he country , and ext[MASK]adit[MASK]on proceedings against the perpetrators and subsequ[MASK]nt prosecution and [MASK]onviction was not completed for sixt[MASK]en years . The final conspirator w[MASK]s convicte[MASK] in 2006 , when Catherine Jane Stork agreed to r[MASK]turn to the United States from Germany in order to[MASK]be allowed to visit her ill son in Australia . Eight perpetrators r[MASK]ceived sentences ranging from five years probation to five years in fed[MASK]ral prison and an additional member of the Rajneesh commune pleaded g[MASK]ilty to murder conspiracy . Rajneesh was never prose[MASK][MASK]ted in relati[MASK]n to the conspiracy , [MASK]nd left the United States after ple[MASK]ding guilty to [MASK]mmigration frau[MASK] and agreeing not to reenter the country without permission from the U.S. Attorney General . 
 
 = = Planning = = 
 
 
 = = = Hit list = = = 
 
 Seven follo[MASK]ers ( called Rajneeshees ) of charismatic leader Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh ( now known as Osho ) , were convicted of a 1985 conspiracy to assassinate Charles Turne[MASK] , and an additional [MASK]nindicted eighth member of the[MASK]Ra[MASK]neesh commune pleaded guilty to murder conspira[MASK]y . The perpetrators were high @-@ ranking followers within the Rajneeshee organization . Prosecutors in the case stated that the perp[MASK]trators had planned to murder Turner after he was appointed to head an inve[MASK]tigation into the group 's activities in Rajneeshpuram , Oregon . Turner 's investigation foc[MASK]sed on sham marriages organized by the group , as well as ot[MASK]er illegal activities including immigration fraud , a[MASK]d he later head[MASK]d the federal prosecution relating to the 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack in The D[MASK]lles , [MASK]reg[MASK]n . Oregon Attorney [MASK]eneral Dave Frohn[MASK]ayer was also involve[MASK] in investigations of the group , working alongside Turner . 
 In May 1985 , Rajneesh 's persona[MASK] secretary and second @-@ in @-@ command , Sheela Silverman ( Ma Anand Shee[MASK]a ) , gathered the leader 's key followers and formed a group of conspirators in order to plan the assassination of[MASK]Turner , as well a[MASK] several dissidents among their organization . [MASK]heela stated that Turner 's grand jury investigation " threa[MASK]ened the existence of the commune " , and exposed Rajneesh and several of his disci[MASK]les to criminal p[MASK]osecution . Sheela hoped that [MASK]y murderin[MASK] Turner they would be able to thwart the federal immigration investigation which could have[MASK]resulted in deportat[MASK]on of Rajneeshee leaders . Three former leaders of the commune including Ma Anand Sheela , Dianne Yvonne Onang ( Ma Anand Puja ) , a registered nurse [MASK]rom the Philippines who managed the Raj[MASK]eeshee medica[MASK] corporation , and former treasurer of Rajneesh Foundation International and Catherine Jane Stork ( Ma Shanti Bhadra ) of Australia , put together a hit list which includ[MASK]d U.S. Attorney Charles Turner and Oregon Attorney General David Fro[MASK]nmayer . 
 [MASK]usan Hagan ( Ma Anand Su ) , a top official in the Rajneeshpuram hierarchy , was also a participa[MASK]t in the assassination conspiracy . Hagan was in charge of the security force at Rajneeshpuram , ran the Rajneesh Investment Corporation , and supervised construction on[MASK]the commune . Other conspirators in the assassination plot included Ann Phyllis McCarthy ( [MASK]a [MASK]oga Vidya[MASK]) , president of the Rajneesh commune , and Alma Potter ( Ma Dhyan Yogini ) , Ma A[MASK]and Sheela 's bodyguard and traveling companion . Potter was manager of the Hotel Rajneesh in Portland , Oregon , and a member of the commune 's security force . The Oregonian reported[MASK]that nine people were on the hit li[MASK]t , inc[MASK]uding : Turner , Frohnmayer , former assistant attorney g[MASK]ne[MASK]al Karen H. Gre[MASK]n , Wasco County planning director Daniel C. Durow , Wasco County commissioner James L. Comini , investigative journalist for The Oregonian Leslie L. Zaitz , former member Helen C. Byron ([MASK]Ma Idam Shunyo ) , who had been awarded US $ 1 @.@ 7 m[MASK]llion in a lawsuit against Rajneesh Foundation International , her[MASK]daughter Barbara J. Byron ( Mak[MASK]ma ) , and Rajnees[MASK] 's former secretary Laxmi Thakarsi Kuruwa ( Ma Yoga Laxmi ) . 
 
 = = = Weapons = = = 
 
 Cather[MASK]ne Jane Stork volunteered to be the follower who would actually murder Turner , and bought guns and silencers . Stork was known to fellow follow[MASK]rs as Ma Shanti Bhadra , and was also one of the three " [MASK]ig Mam[MASK]as " in Rajneeshpuram . Sally @-@ Anne Croft ( known by follo[MASK]ers [MASK]s Ma Prem Savita ) , an accountant and the group 's Chief Financial Officer , provided money for the purchase of weapons related to the plot . Phyllis Caldwell [MASK] Ma Deva Ritka ) described in a federal affidavit how members of the murder conspiracy obtained handguns , referring to Cather[MASK]ne Jan[MASK] Stork and [MASK]ally @-@ An[MASK]e Croft : " Shanti B went down to Jesus [MASK]rove , an[MASK] Savita [MASK]ave us several thousand dollars to use to buy guns . " Jesus Gr[MASK]ve referred to a group of trail[MASK]rs where all the leaders of the Rajneesh commune resided , except for Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh . 
 Ma Anand Sheela and three other Rajneesh followers traveled to New Yor[MASK] in the spring [MASK]f 1985 to acquire false identification . According [MASK]o a federal indictment , the perpetrators of the assassination plot used a false birth c[MASK]rtificate to purchase guns . Two members of the grou[MASK] then traveled to Texas to purchase handguns . Caldwell stated she and Catherine Jane Stork flew to [MASK]exas to purchase guns there . They purchased five guns in Texas , but encounte[MASK]ed difficulty purchasing handguns in Texas with[MASK]out @-@ of @-@ state identification and traveled to[MASK]New Mexico instead . Caldwell said they called back to the commune but the women were instructed " not to come back without the[MASK]guns " . 
 In Ne[MASK] Mexico , they obtained [MASK]alse identification , and purchased several [MASK]istols . Their intention was to [MASK]urchase guns which wer[MASK] difficult to trace [MASK] Caldwell said it was ea[MASK]y to obtain guns in New Mexico : " we found it[MASK]was pretty easy to buy guns . All you had to do was show some i[MASK]entification and it was easy to get . " Caldwell said[MASK]she and Stork went to a un[MASK]versity library to find the identity " of someone dying very young " , next we[MASK]t " to public reco[MASK]ds and asked for a copy of a birth certificate "[MASK]and described h[MASK]w " we got a rent receipt book and just made up a rent receipt " . " And then we were ab[MASK]e to go to several differen[MASK] gun shops in Alb[MASK]querque with those two bits of[MASK]identification and buy five different guns and bullets , " said Caldwell . They were able to o[MASK]tain one Colt .38 @-[MASK] caliber revo[MASK]ver , and four Ruger .357 @-@ caliber Security @[MASK]@ Six Magnum revolvers . The conspira[MASK]ors smuggled the guns into Oregon by packing them in lu[MASK]gage and putting the luggage on a Greyhound Lines bus . Caldwell said that she and Stork traveled by bus back to the Rajneesh c[MASK]mmune so as to avoid airport metal detectors . 
 
 = = = Surveillance = [MASK] = 
 
 After obtaining guns the conspirators returned to Portland , Oregon . They [MASK]ente[MASK] out an apartme[MASK]t in[MASK]Portland to serve as their base of operations for the assassination of Turner . Raj[MASK]eesh follower Carol Matthews ( Ma Prem Samadhi ) used a f[MASK]ke na[MASK]e during the planning of the assassinatio[MASK] plot , in an attempt to obtain the home address of Charles Turner . According to federal prosecutors Matthews[MASK]obtained a college yearbook of Turner 's , and learned his car 's license plate number and his parking location . Court r[MASK]c[MASK]rds state [MASK]hat Matthews and an unindicted[MASK]co @-@ conspirator gave voter registration offi[MASK]ials fake identities and told[MASK]officials they were conducting " a voter survey on President Reagan 's economic plan " , in order to obtain Turner 's route number and post office box number . The two tried repeating the story wi[MASK]h members of the U.S. Postal Service , but the postal officia[MASK]s did not give[MASK]them Turner 's address . They then drove around Turner 's neighborhood [MASK]nd were able to find his home by locating a sign in front o[MASK] his residence that said " Turner " . Matthews[MASK]had [MASK]ictures of Turner 's residen[MASK]e develope[MASK] ; these were later obtained by the Federal Bureau of Investigation [MASK] FBI ) during an investigation of the Ra[MASK]neesh commune , and verified after being shown to Turner . 
 Members of the group of conspirators watched Turne[MASK] 's office , home and car , and discussed methods to assassinate him , hoping that his death would hinder the[MASK]efforts of the f[MASK]deral investigation into Rajneeshp[MASK]ra[MASK] . Their plan was [MASK]o shoot Turner in t[MASK]e garage of the federal office building where he worked , in Port[MASK]and , Oregon , [MASK]ut the conspirators also debated whether to murder[MASK]Turner i[MASK] downtown Portland or cl[MASK]ser to his home . After sp[MASK]nding multiple nights watching Turn[MASK]r 's house , the conspirators decided on the parking garage because they fel[MASK] it would be too risky to murder him on the drive to or from work , or in front of his home . Tur[MASK]er had a reserved parking spot in a [MASK]ederal garage underneath Terry Schrunk Plaza in Portland , Oregon . In an affidavi[MASK] given to the FBI , conspirator Alma [MASK][MASK]ralta described how the perp[MASK]trators decided on the fed[MASK]ral parking garage as the location : " Sha[MASK]ti Bhadra[MASK][ Catherine Jane Stork ] said this seems like a[MASK]good place to bump this fellow off . " 
 The conspirators practiced diffe[MASK]ent ways [MASK]f murdering Turner . According to informant statements to law enforcement , one of the conspirators was to pretend the[MASK]e was car trouble , and the [MASK]thers would then a[MASK]pro[MASK]ch Turner with [MASK]heir guns . Informants later told law enforcement officials that the conspirators intended to hide out at an international[MASK]network of Rajneesh communes if the plan was successful .[MASK]According to The Oregonian the [MASK]ssassinations were not carried out because Ma Anand Sheela became distract[MASK]d by political power plays within t[MASK]e Rajneesh commune and oth[MASK]r member[MASK][MASK]of the organization wh[MASK] were trying to remove her from her position within the group . 
 
 = = Prosecutions =[MASK]= 
 
 
 = = = Invest[MASK]gation = = = 
 
 On February 28 , 1985 , Congressman Jam[MASK]s H. Weaver gave a speech in the United States House of Representatives in which he asserted that the Rajneeshees w[MASK]re involved in the bioterror attack [MASK]n Oregon .[MASK]At a series [MASK]f press conferences in September 1985 , Rajneesh accused several of his recently depart[MASK]d lieutenants of i[MASK]volvement in this and o[MASK]her crimes , including the poisoning of Mike Sullivan , a Jefferson County district att[MASK]rney , and ask[MASK]d state and[MASK]federa[MASK] authorities to[MASK]investigate his allegations . The as[MASK]assination plot was uncovered by federal law enforcement as a result of the ensuing investigation into activities at Rajneeshpuram . Turner was [MASK]ever physically harmed , and had retired by 1995 . 
 [MASK][MASK]e Oregonian was informed in [MASK]ctober 1985 by [MASK]ederal law enforcement officials that Leslie L. Zaitz , an investigative journalist who had written a 20 @-@ part series on the[MASK]Rajneesh movement in Oregon , was on a " hit list " which also incl[MASK]ded Turner and Or[MASK]gon Attorney General David Frohnmayer . Assistant U.S. Attorney Robert Weaver prosecu[MASK]ed the case ; the charges were first detailed at an October 1985 bond hearing in North Carolina a[MASK]t[MASK]r Rajneesh and his followers were arrested at an airport in Charlotte . Weaver said in court that followers [MASK]f Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh had plotted to assassinate Turner an[MASK] Frohnmayer . He said these allegations were reasons why releasing R[MASK]jnees[MASK] and his followers from jail w[MASK]uld be " a clear a[MASK]d presen[MASK] danger to public o[MASK]ficials " . The guns purchased by the Rajneesh followers for[MASK]the assassination plot had reportedly been [MASK]umped in a lake at Rancho Rajnee[MASK]h ; the lake was searched by U.S. Navy divers . Scuba divers searched the lake for two days but did not find the guns . 
 Joseph Gr[MASK]ene ,[MASK]a U.S. immigration agent , testified in court that FBI age[MASK]ts had learned of the assassination plot from a member of th[MASK] organizat[MASK]on[MASK]who was in a witn[MASK]ss [MASK]rotection pro[MASK]ram . Greene said [MASK]hat members invol[MASK]ed in the assassination plot included Ma Anand Sheela , Dianne Yvonne Onang , and Alma Peralta . The a[MASK]sassination plot was investigated by the FBI and the Oregon State Police . Informants told law enforcement that Ma Anand Sheela hoped Turner 's de[MASK]th would prevent an Immigration and Naturalization Service investigation which she thought could lead to Rajneesh 's arrest and de[MASK]ortation from the United States . Weaver stated " These attempt[MASK] to assassinate public officials were because they were presentin[MASK] an [MASK]mmigration case that might result in imprisonment " of Rajneesh[MASK]. " There were not simply plans , but at least one ( assas[MASK]ination ) attempt , " said Weaver at the hearin[MASK] . 
 A[MASK]grand jury investigation led by Turner brought charges of " widespread immigration fraud " against members of Rajnee[MASK]hpur[MASK]m . Wiretapping crimes wer[MASK] discovered after Ma Anan[MASK] Sheela had fled the [MASK]o[MASK]mune in September 198[MASK] . In December 1985 , 2[MASK] followers of[MASK]Rajneesh were in[MASK]icted on wiretapping charges . 
 
 [MASK] = = A[MASK]rests and convictions = = = 
 
 [MASK]hi[MASK]f criminal assistant U.S. attorney Baron C. Sheldahl was assigned to prosecute the charges of federal wiretapping , and a special te[MASK]m from the United States Department of Justice[MASK]Crimi[MASK]al Division was tasked with prosecuting the murder conspiracy c[MASK]arges . Four of the perpetrators were [MASK]rr[MASK]sted in September 1990 . Cathe[MASK]ine Jane S[MASK]ork and Richard Kevin Langford were arrested in West Germany , Ann Phyllis McCart[MASK]y w[MASK]s arrested in South Africa , and Susan Hagan was arrested in England . In September 1990 , Alma Peralta pleaded g[MASK]ilty to conspir[MASK]cy to commit murder . Peralta , who had served as Ma Anand Sheela 's bodyguard and co[MASK]fidante , agreed to t[MASK]stify against the other defendants in the murder conspiracy . Under the terms of Peral[MASK]a 's plea agreement she received a[MASK]sentence of two years in federal prison . Carol Matthew[MASK] was arrested in Bade[MASK] @-@ Baden[MASK], Germany in October 1990 on charges of [MASK]iretapping and conspiracy to mu[MASK]der Turner , where she was held along wi[MASK]h three other Rajneeshees . At the time of[MASK]her arrest , Matthews was found in possession of a false British passport , and had been trave[MASK]ing under the fake name of " Daphene Fosberry " . Indictments were brought against Ma Anand Sheela and six other co @-@ conspirators by a federal grand jury in November 1990 . 
 In April 1991 , Carol Matthews and Richard Kevin Langford ( Swami Anugiten ) we[MASK]e extradited from Germany to the United States i[MASK] order to appear in federal court in Portland , Oregon . Law enforcement officials from the United States Marshal[MASK] Service traveled to Frankfurt , Germany and took custody of the Matthews and Langford at Rhine Main Airport . On April 15 , 1991 , Matthews and Langford appeared in federal court in Oregon , and both pleaded innocent to charges of conspiracy to commit murder and carrying out wiretapping . On April 25 , 1991 , Richard Kevin Langfo[MASK]d pleaded guilty in federal court to pa[MASK]ticipating in the murder conspiracy plot against Turner , and in exchange he received a sentence of five years in federal prison and the dismissal of other charges against him relating to firearms and wiretapping . Langford agreed to testify against th[MASK] other members of the murder conspiracy . Langford wrote on his plea agreement form : " In 1985 , meetings were held at the Rancho Rajneesh ... at which time the possible killing of [MASK]he United States Attorney [MASK]or Oregon was discussed . I participated in a number of these meetings and agreed with others [MASK]o work toward that object . " Prosecutor Timothy J. Reardon III stated [MASK]hat Langford had been a member of the Rajneesh commune in Oregon since it[MASK]began in 1981 , and that the gover[MASK]ment w[MASK]s able to prove he joined the mu[MASK]der conspiracy at a point in time after May 25 , 1985 . Reardon said that Langford was a member of a group called[MASK]the " Circle of 38 " , which was the personal security force that guarded Bhagw[MASK]n Shree Rajneesh , and that he had served [MASK]s a [MASK]eapons[MASK]instructor and poli[MASK]eman at the co[MASK]mune . Langford told U.S. District Judge Malcom F. Marsh that he had suggested that guns for the murder conspiracy could be bought in Texas , instructed the c[MASK]nspiractors about[MASK]silencers , took responsibility for the weapo[MASK]s wh[MASK]le they were in the commune ,[MASK]and[MASK]disposed of them when members of the murder conspiracy decided to flee the U.S. for Europe . In Jul[MASK] 1991 , Carol[MASK]Matthews entered a guilty plea and[MASK]was convicted in federal court , she was sentenced to five years in prison . 
 Catherine Jane [MASK]tork was convicted of the attempted murder of Rajneesh[MASK]'s[MASK]physicia[MASK] Dr. George Mere[MASK]ith ( Swami Devaraj ) in 1986 , and served almost three years in [MASK]ail . Af[MASK]er her release , agents from the FBI uncovered the plot to assa[MASK]sinate Turne[MASK] , but Stork had already fled to Germany . She was ind[MASK]cted by a federal grand jury in 1990 . In[MASK]1991 [MASK] the German government [MASK]efused to extradite Stork back to the [MASK]nited States[MASK]. In June 1991 , U.S. prosecutors filed affidavits in t[MASK]e murder conspiracy ca[MASK][MASK] with the Higher Regional Court in Karlsruhe , Germany , as pa[MASK]t of an attempt[MASK]to extradi[MASK]e Catherin Jane Stork [MASK]rom Germany to the [MASK].S. The affidavits stated that all[MASK]of the members in the murder conspiracy plot al[MASK]o belonged to [MASK] group of Rajnee[MASK]h followers at the Oregon[MASK]commune kno[MASK]n as " the 38 " , and were trained in " commando tactics using Uzi semiautomatic rifles and handguns[MASK]" . David Berry Knapp ( known to Rajneesh followers [MASK]s Swami Krishna Deva ) st[MASK]ted in an FBI affidavit tha[MASK] the murder c[MASK]nspiracy was motivated by Ma An[MASK]nd Sheela 's " tremendous ang[MASK]r " towards Turner . 
 Ma Anand Sheela served 2[MASK] months in a minimum security federal pr[MASK]son for charges related to assault , attempted murd[MASK]r , arson , wiretapping and the 1984 bioter[MASK]or attack in The Dal[MASK]es , and moved to Switzerland after her release from prison in 1988 . The assassination conspiracy was discovered after Shee[MASK]a had left the United S[MASK]ates , and as of 1999 she[MASK]wa[MASK] still wanted by [MASK]ederal law enforcement for her role in the plot , and risked extrad[MASK]tion if she [MASK]rossed the Swiss border . Switzerland declined an extradition request from the United States , and instead tried her in a Swiss court . Sheela w[MASK]s[MASK]found guilty of " criminal acts preparatory to the commission of [MASK]urder " in 1999 , and sentenced to time already served . 
 Sally @-@ Anne Croft and Susan Hagan were extradited from Britai[MASK] in [MASK]994 , and were convicted by a jury decision on July 28 , 1995 for their roles in the assassination plot . They had[MASK]unsuccessf[MASK]lly atte[MASK]pted to appeal their extradition from Britain to Home Secretary Michael How[MASK]rd . During their trial the prosecution presented twenty @-@ nine witness[MASK]s , including former followers of Rajneesh who placed [MASK]oth women in planning meetings where they discus[MASK]ed murdering Turner . David Berry Knapp , t[MASK]e former mayor of Rajneeshpuram , testified for the government in the case and implicated Croft and Hagan in the assassin[MASK]tion conspiracy . Ava Kay Avalos ( Ma Ava ) , a Rajneesh disci[MASK]le , testified in the Croft case and[MASK]stated tha[MASK] she had been part of the conspirators th[MASK]t plotted to assassinate Turner . In addition to Knapp and Avalos , co @-@ conspirators Richard Kevin Lan[MASK]ford , Phyllis Caldwell , and Alma Peralta testified in the case pursuant to con[MASK]itional plea or immunity agreements . Both women wer[MASK] sentenced to five years in prison . Croft and Hagan did not [MASK]estif[MASK] during their trial . " We hashed over every[MASK]hin[MASK] –[MASK]evidence , notes , evidence , notes . I think we did an absolutely fabulous job , " said one of the jurors . At the sentencing for Croft and Hagan , the federal Judge Malcolm Marsh described them as " people of obvious goodwill who had committed an extremely serious offense against the criminal justice system . " Prosecutor Tim Reardon called the conspiracy to commit assassination " a deadly [MASK]erious crime aimed [MASK]t the heart of the criminal ju[MASK]tice system . " Croft an[MASK] Hagan were released from impr[MASK]sonment at FC[MASK] Dubl[MASK]n , California in April 1998 , and returned[MASK]to Bri[MASK]ain . 
 In December 20[MASK]2 , Ann P[MASK]y[MASK]lis McCarthy pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit murder , a[MASK]d was sentence[MASK] to one year in jail and a fine of USD $ 10 [MASK],@ 000 . McCarthy had served as fourth @-@ in @-@ command of Rajneeshp[MASK]ram ,[MASK]and was kn[MASK]wn by Rajneesh 's followers as Ma Yoga Vidya . Turner called the one @-@ year prison sentence " [MASK]aughable . " In court [MASK]tatements , McCarthy stated " I cannot forgive myself for not [MASK]eing tougher at the time , " and called [MASK]er time with the group " psyc[MASK]ologica[MASK] torture[MASK]. " 
 In February[MASK]2006 , S[MASK]ork became the last perpetrator sentenced in the political [MASK]ssassination plot ,[MASK]after [MASK]en months of negotiations with Oregon prosecutors . Stork offered to turn herself [MASK]n and return to the United[MASK]States after learning of her son 's terminal brain tumor . Prior to sentencing , the court allowed her to travel to Australia to visit her son . In addition to charges of consp[MASK]racy to commit murder , Stork also pleaded guilty to the purchase of weapons i[MASK] viol[MASK]tion of federal firearms law . An Oregon judge sentenced her to five years probation , and three months time already served in a Ger[MASK]an jail [MASK] Turner thought she[MASK]should have received a harsher[MASK]se[MASK]tence ,[MASK]and[MASK]com[MASK]ented " This was a ly[MASK]ng @-@ i[MASK] @-@ wait[MASK]conspiracy to murder me , a p[MASK]esidential appointee , and for a long time I slept with a loaded gun beside my bed . " Though Stork could have faced life in prison , U.S. District Judge Judge Malcolm F.[MASK]Marsh thought she had " seen the error of her ways . " A federal prosecutor in the case described Stork as the " MVP " of the conspiracy , a[MASK]d said she was the designated assassin that was[MASK]set to murder Turner . After her sente[MASK]cing , Sto[MASK]k stated : " I actually conspired to kill Mr. Turner , it is up to me alone to face this te[MASK]rible truth ... No person has the right to do what I did . I 'm truly sorry . " Stork returned to Germany after her sentencing . 
 In an affidavit , Timothy J. Reardon[MASK]III , lead prosecutor for the United States Department of Justice in the case , stated Ma Anand She[MASK]la had told members of the murder conspiracy that Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh h[MASK]d personally authorized the " necessary " murder of specific enemies of the Rajneesh commune . Bhagwan Shre[MASK] Rajneesh paid a fine of US $ 400 @,@ 000 , agreed to[MASK]plead guilty to immigr[MASK]tion fraud ,[MASK][MASK]nd was deported from the United States . He agreed to leave the United States and not return unless given permission[MASK]first from the United States Attorney General . Joseph T. McCann writes in Terro[MASK]ism on American Soil " Nevert[MASK]ele[MASK]s , he was never prosecuted for any of the more serious cr[MASK]mes perp[MASK]trated by cult members , including the salmonella poisoning . "

 = Die Another Day = 
 
 Die Another Day ( 2002 ) is the twentieth spy film in the James Bond [MASK]eries , and the fourth and final film to star [MASK]ierce Brosnan as the fictional MI6 agent James Bond . The film fo[MASK]lows Bond[MASK]as he leads a mission to North Korea , during which he is betrayed and , a[MASK]ter seemingly killing a rogue North Korean colonel , is captured and imprisoned . Fourteen months later , Bond is released as[MASK]part of a prisoner exchange . Surmising that s[MASK]meone within the British government betrayed him , he attempts to earn redemption by [MASK]racki[MASK]g down his betr[MASK]yer and killing a North Korean agent he believes was involved in his torture . 
 Die Another Day , produced by Michael G. Wilson and Barbara[MASK]Broccoli , and direct[MASK]d by Lee Tamahori , marked the James Bond franchise [MASK]s 40th anniversary .[MASK]The series began in 1962 with Sean Connery starring as Bond in Dr.[MASK]No . Die Another Day includes references to each of the pre[MASK]eding films . 
 The film received mi[MASK]ed reviews[MASK]. Some critics prai[MASK]ed the wor[MASK] of Lee Tama[MASK]ori , while others criticised the film 's hea[MASK]y use of computer @-@ generated imagery , which they found unconvincing and a distraction from the fi[MASK]m 's plot . Nevertheless , Die A[MASK]other Day was the highest @-@ grossing James Bond film up to [MASK]hat time if inflation is not taken i[MASK]to account . 
 
 [MASK] = Plot = = 
 
 MI6 officer James Bond[MASK]— agent 007 — inf[MASK]ltrates a [MASK]orth Korean military base , where Colonel [MASK]an @-@ Sun Moon is illegally trading weapons for African blood diamonds . After Moon 's assistant Zao discovers that Bond is a British agent , the colo[MASK]el attempts t[MASK] kill Bond and a hovercraft chase ensues , which ends with Moon 's apparent death . Bond sur[MASK]ives , but is captured by North Korean soldiers and imprisoned by the Colonel 's father , Gene[MASK]al Moon . 
 After 14 months[MASK]of cap[MASK]ivity and torture , Bond is traded for Zao in a prisoner exch[MASK]nge . He is sedat[MASK]d and taken to meet M , who informs him that his status as a 00 Agent is suspended under suspicion of [MASK]aving[MASK]leaked information under du[MASK]ess . Bond is convinced that he has been set up by a double agent in the British government and decides to avenge his betrayal[MASK]. After escaping from the custody of MI6 , he discovers that[MASK]he is[MASK]in Hong Kong , where he learns from[MASK]a Chinese agent that Zao is in Cuba . 
 In Havana Bond meets NSA agent Gia[MASK]inta ' Jinx ' Johnson and follows her to a gene therapy clinic , where pa[MASK]ients can have t[MASK]eir ap[MASK]earances altered through DNA rest[MASK]ucturing . Bond locates Zao inside the clinic and attempts to kill him , but Zao escapes . He leaves behind a pendant which leads Bond to a cache of diamonds , identified as conflict diamonds , but bea[MASK]ing the crest of the company owned by British billionaire Gustav Graves . 
 At[MASK]Blades Club[MASK]in Lond[MASK][MASK] Bond meets Graves , alon[MASK] with his assistant Miranda Frost , wh[MASK] is also an undercover MI6 agent . After a fencing exercise ( and a litera[MASK] sword @-@ fi[MASK]ht ) , Bond is invited by Graves to Iceland for a scientific demon[MASK]tration . Shortly afterwards , M r[MASK]stores Bond 's Double @-@ 0 status and o[MASK]fers as[MASK]istance in the investig[MASK]tion . 
 At his ice palace in Icel[MASK]nd Graves unveils a new orbital mirr[MASK]r satellite[MASK], " Icar[MASK]s " , which is able to focus solar energy on a small area and provide year @-@ round sunshine for crop development . Du[MASK]ing the night , Jinx infiltrates Graves ' command centre , but is captured by Graves and[MASK]Zao . Bond rescues her and later d[MASK]scovers that Colonel Moon is[MASK]still alive . Moon has used the gene therapy technology to change his appearance , assuming the identity of Gustav Graves . 
 Bond confronts Graves , but Fro[MASK]t arrives to reve[MASK][MASK] herself as the traitor who b[MASK]trayed Bond in North Korea , forcing 007 to escape from Gra[MASK]es ' facility . Bond then returns in his Aston [MASK]artin Vanquish to rescue Jinx , who has been captured once ag[MASK]in . Zao pu[MASK]sues him in his own vehicle , both cars driving inside the rapidly melting ice palace . Bond kills Zao by shooting an ice chandelier onto him , and then revives Ji[MASK]x after she has drowned . 
 Bond and J[MASK]nx pursue Graves and Frost to the Korean peninsula and stow away on Graves ' car[MASK]o plane . Graves reveals his true identity to his father , and the purpose of the Icarus [MASK]atellite : to cut a path through the Korean Demilitarized Zone with concentrated sunlight , allowing North Korean troops to invade South Korea and reunite th[MASK] peninsula[MASK]by force . Horrified , General Moon tries to [MASK]top the plan , but he is murdered by his own son . 
 Bond attempts to shoot Graves but he is prevented by one of the soldiers on board . In their struggle , a gunshot pierces the fuselage ,[MASK]causing the plane to de[MASK]cend rapidly . Bond engages Graves in a fist fight , and Jinx attempts to regain control of the plane . Frost attacks Jinx , forcing her to defend herself in a sword duel . After the plane passes through the Icarus beam and is further damaged , Jinx kills Frost . Graves attempts to escape by parachute , bu[MASK] Bond opens the parachute , causing Graves to be pulled out of the plane and[MASK]into o[MASK]e of its engines , killing him[MASK]and disabling the Icarus beam . Bond and Jinx then escape fr[MASK]m the disintegrating plane in a helicopter from the cargo hold , carryi[MASK]g away Gra[MASK]es ' stash of diamonds in the process .

 Colin Salmon as Charles Robinson , M 's Deputy Chief of Staff[MASK]. 
 Ho Yi as the Hotel manager and Chinese special a[MASK]ent Mr. Chang . In early drafts of t[MASK]e script , it was Wai Lin ( Michelle Yeoh ) who aided Bond in Hong Kong , but the i[MASK]e[MASK] fell through and Chang was created to re[MASK]lace [MASK]er . 
 Rachel[MASK]Grant as Peaceful Fountains of Desire , a Chinese agent working for Mr. Chang , undercover as [MASK] masseuse . 
 Emilio Echevarría as Raoul ,[MASK]t[MASK]e manager of a Havana cigar factory , and a British sleeper .
