 = = Product[MASK]on = = 
 
 
 = = = Filming = = = 
 
 Principal photography of Die Another Day began on 11[MASK]January 2002 at Pinewoo[MASK] studios . The film was shot primarily in the United Kingdom , Iceland , and Cádiz , Spain . Other locations included Pinewood Studios ' 007 Stage and Maui , Hawa[MASK]i , in December 2001 . La[MASK]rd Hamilton , Dave Kalama , and Darrick Doerner performed th[MASK] pre @-@ title surfing scene at the surf break known as Jaws in Peʻahi , Maui , while the shore sh[MASK]ts were t[MASK]ken near Cádiz and Newquay , Cornwall . Scenes inside Graves ' diamond min[MASK] were also filmed [MASK]n Corn[MASK]all , at the Eden Project . The s[MASK]enes involving the Cuban locations of Havana and the fictional Isla de Los Organo[MASK] were[MASK]filmed at La Caleta , Spain . 
 The scenes f[MASK]aturing Berry in a bikini were shot in Cád[MASK]z . The l[MASK]cation was reportedly cold and windy , and footage has been released of Berry[MASK]wrapped in thick towels between tak[MASK]s to avoid catching a chill . Berry was injured dur[MASK]ng filming when debris from a smoke grenade flew into her eye[MASK]. The debris was removed in a 30[MASK]@-@ minute operati[MASK]n . 
 Gadgets an[MASK] other props from every previous Bond[MASK]fi[MASK]m and stored in Eon Productions ' archives appear in Q 's warehouse in the London Underground . Examples include the jetpack in Thunderball and Rosa Klebb 's poi[MASK]on @-@ tipped shoe in Fr[MASK]m Russia with Love [MASK] Q mentions that the watch he issues Bond is " your 20th , I believe " , a refere[MASK]ce to Die Another Day being the 20th[MASK]Eon @-@ pro[MASK]uced Bond film . In[MASK]London , the Reform Club was used to shoot several places in the fi[MASK]m , including the lobby and gallery at the Blades Club , MI6 Headquarters , Buckingham Palace , Green Park , and Westminster . Svalbard , Norway and Jökulsárlón , I[MASK]eland were used for the car chase on the ice with additional scenes filmed at Jostedalsbreen National Park[MASK], Norway and RAF Little Rissington , Gloucestershire ; Manston Airport in Kent was used for the scenes involving the An[MASK]onov cargo pla[MASK]e scenes . The [MASK]cen[MASK] in which Bond surfs the wave created by Icarus when Graves was attempting to kill Bond was[MASK]shot on the blue screen . The waves , along with all the g[MASK]aciers in the scene are compu[MASK]er @-@ generated . 
 The [MASK]angar interior of the[MASK]" US Air Base in South Korea " , shown crow[MASK][MASK]d with Chinook helicopters , was filmed at RAF Odiham in Hampshire , UK , as were the helicopter interior shots during the Switchb[MASK]ade sequence . These latter scenes , though portrayed in the air , were actually filmed entirely on the ground [MASK][MASK]th the sky background being added in post @-@ production using blue screen techniques [MASK] [MASK]lthough the base is portrayed in the film as a US base , all the aircraft and personnel in the scene are British in real[MASK]life . In the film , Switchblades ( one @-@ person gliders[MASK]resembling fighter jets in shape ) are flown by Bond and Jinx to stealthily enter North Korea . The Switchblade was based on a workable model called " PHASST " ( Programmab[MASK]e High Altitude Single Soldier Transport ) . Kinetic Aerospace Inc . ' s lead designer , Jack McCornack was impressed by director Lee Tamahori 's way of conducting the Switchblade scene and commented , " It 's bri[MASK]f , but realistic . The good guys get in unobserved , th[MASK]nks to a fast cruise , good glide performance , and minimal r[MASK]dar signature . It 's a wonderfu[MASK][MASK]promotion for the PHASST . " 
 
 = = = Music = = =[MASK]
 
 The soundtrack was composed by David Arnold and rele[MASK]se[MASK] on[MASK]Warner Bros. Records . He again mad[MASK] use of electronic rhythm elements in his score , and included two of the new themes c[MASK]eated for The World Is Not Enough . The first , originally used as Renard 's theme , is heard during the mammoth " A[MASK]tonov " cue on the recording , and[MASK]is written for piano . The second ne[MASK] [MASK]heme , used in[MASK]the " Christmas in Turkey " t[MASK]ack of The World Is Not Enough , is reu[MASK]ed in the " Going [MASK]own Together " track . [MASK] The title song for Die Another Day was co @-@ written and co @-@ produced by Mirwais Ahmadzai and performed by Madonna[MASK], who also had a ca[MASK]eo in the film as Verity , a [MASK]encing instructor . Thi[MASK] is the first Bond title sequence to dire[MASK]tly reflect the film 's plot since Dr. [MASK]o ; all the [MASK]ther previous Bond titles are stand @-@ alone set pieces . [MASK]he concept of the ti[MASK]le sequence[MASK]is to rep[MASK]esent Bond trying to survive 14 months of torture at the hand[MASK] of t[MASK][MASK] North Koreans . Critic[MASK] ' opi[MASK]ions of the song were sharply div[MASK]ded — it was nominated for a Golden Globe for Best Original Song and the 2004 Grammy Award for Best Dance Recording , but also for a Golden Raspbe[MASK]ry Award for Worst Original Song of 2002 ( while Mad[MASK]nna herself won the Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Supporting Actres[MASK] for her cameo ) . In [MASK] MORI poll for the Cha[MASK]nel 4 programme " James Bond 's Greatest Hits " , the song was voted 9[MASK]h out of 22 , and also came in as an " o[MASK]erwhelming number one " favourite a[MASK]ong those under the ag[MASK] of 24 . 
 
 = = Marketing tie @-@ ins = = 
 
 MGM and Eon Productions granted Mattel the license to sell a line of Barbie dol[MASK]s based around the franchise . Mattel announc[MASK]d that the Bond Barbies will be at her " stylish best " , clad in evening[MASK]dress and red shawl . Li[MASK]dy Hemming created the dress , which is slashed to the thigh to reveal a telephone strapped to Barbie 's leg . The doll was sold in a gift set , with Barbie[MASK]'s boyfriend Ken posing as Bond in a tuxedo designed by the Italian fashion house Brioni . 
 Revlon also collaborate[MASK] with the makers of Die Another Day to create a cosmetics line based [MASK]round the character Jinx . The limited edition 007 Colour[MASK]Collection was launched on 7 November 2002 to coincide with the film 's release . The produ[MASK]t na[MASK]es were loaded with puns and innuendo , with shades and textures ra[MASK]ging from the " warm " to " cool and frosted " . 
 [MASK] = = Rele[MASK]se and reception = = 
 
 Die Another Day had it[MASK] world premiere on 18 November 2002 at the Royal Albert Hall in London . Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip were [MASK]uests of honour , making it the second [MASK]ond film premiere to be attended by the Queen , the first one being You Only Live Twice in 1967 . The Royal Albe[MASK]t Hall had a make @-@ over for the screening and [MASK]ad been transformed into an ice palace . Proceeds from the première , about £ 500 @,@ 000 , were donated to the Cin[MASK]ma and Television[MASK]Benevolent Fund of which the Queen is[MASK]patron . On the first day , ticket sales reached[MASK]£ 1 @.@ 2 million . Die Another Day was the highest grossing James[MASK]Bond film until the release of Casino Royale . I[MASK] earned $ 432 million worldwide , beco[MASK]ing the sixth highest grossing film of 200[MASK] . 
 Die Another Day became a c[MASK]ntroversial subject in eastern [MASK]sia . The North Korean government [MASK]isliked th[MASK] portrayal of their state as brutal and war @-@ hungry . The South Koreans boycotted 145 theatres where it was released on 31 December 2002 , as they were offended by the scene in whi[MASK][MASK] an American of[MASK]icer issues orders to the South Korean army[MASK]in [MASK]he defence of thei[MASK] homeland , and by a lovemaking scene near a statue of the Buddha . Th[MASK] Jogye[MASK]Buddhist Order issued a statement that the film was " disrespectful to our religion and does not reflect our value[MASK] and ethic[MASK] " . The Washi[MASK]gton Post reported growi[MASK]g resentment in the nation[MASK]towards[MASK]th[MASK] U[MASK]ite[MASK] States . An official of the South Korean Ministry of Culture and Tourism said th[MASK]t Die Ano[MASK]her Day[MASK]was " the wrong film at the wrong time . " 
 The amount of[MASK]product placement in the film was a point of criticism , specifically from various news o[MASK]tlets such as the BBC , Time and Reu[MASK]ers who all used the pu[MASK] " Buy Another Day " . Reportedly 20 companies , paying $ 70 mi[MASK]lion , had their products[MASK][MASK]eatured in the fil[MASK] , a record at the time , alt[MASK]ough USA Today reported th[MASK]t number to be as high as $ 100 million . By choice , the number of companies[MASK]involved in product plac[MASK]ment was dropped to eight for the next Bond film Casino Royale in 2[MASK]06[MASK]. 
 Rot[MASK]en Toma[MASK][MASK]es liste[MASK] Die Another Day wit[MASK] a 58 % rating .[MASK]Me[MASK]acritic gave th[MASK] film a 56 out [MASK]f 100 rating , representing " mixed or average reviews . " Michael Dequina [MASK]f Film Threat prais[MASK]d the film as the best of the series to star Pierce Brosnan and " the most satisfying installment of the franchise in recent memory . " Larry Carroll of CountingDown.com pr[MASK]ised Lee Tamahori for h[MASK]ving[MASK]" magnificent[MASK]y ba[MASK]anced the film so that it keeps true to the Bond legend , makes[MASK]reference to the classic films that prece[MASK]ed it , but also injects a new zest to it all . " Entertainmen[MASK] Weekly magazine also gave a positive reaction , saying that Tamahori , " a true filmmaker " , has re @-@ esta[MASK]lished the series ' pop sensuality . Dana Stevens of The New York Times called the[MASK]film the best of the Jame[MASK] Bond series since [MASK]he Spy Who Loved Me . Kyle Bell of Movie Freaks 365 stated in his review that the [MASK] first half of Die Another Day is classic Bond " , but that " Things start to go downhill when the ice palace get[MASK] introduced . " 
 However , Die Another Day was strongly criticised by some reviewers who[MASK]felt that the film relie[MASK] too heavily on gadgets and[MASK]special effects , with the plot being ne[MASK]lected[MASK]. James Berardinelli[MASK]of Reelviews[MASK]net said , " This is a train wreck of an action film – a stupefying attempt by the filmma[MASK]ers to force @-@ feed Jame[MASK] Bond into the mindle[MASK]s x[MASK]x [MASK]old and throw 40 years of cinematic histor[MASK] down the toilet in favor of bright flashes and loud bangs . " [MASK]f the action sequences , he said , " Die Another Day is an exercise in loud e[MASK]plosions and e[MASK]cruciatingly bad special effects . The CGI work in this movie is an order of magnitude worse than an[MASK]thing I have seen in a [MASK]ajor motion picture . Co[MASK]pled with lousy production design , Die Another Day looks like it was done on the cheap . Gary Brown of the Houston Community News[MASK]apers also described the weak point of the film as " the seemingly non @-@ stop action sequences and loud explosions that appea[MASK][MASK]to take centre stage[MASK]while the Bond character is almost relegated to second string . " Roger Moore remarked , " I thought it just went too far – a[MASK]d that ’ s from me , the [MASK]irst Bond in space ! Invisible cars[MASK]and d[MASK]dgy CGI footage ? Please ! " 
 
 = = Novelisation = =[MASK]
[MASK]
 Die Another Day was written into a novel [MASK]y the[MASK]then @-@ current official James Bond writer , Raymond Benson , based on the scr[MASK]enplay b[MASK] Nea[MASK] Purvis an[MASK] Robert Wade . Fan reaction to it was above average . After its publication Benson retired as the official James Bond no[MASK]elist and a new series featuring the sec[MASK]et a[MASK]ent 's adventures as a teenager , by Charlie Higso[MASK] , was launched in 2005 . As t[MASK]e novelisation was published after Benson 's final original 007 novel , The Man with the Red Tattoo , it was the final literary work featu[MASK]ing Bond as o[MASK]iginally conceived by[MASK]Ian Flem[MASK]ng until the publication[MASK]of Dev[MASK]l May Care by Se[MASK]astian Faulks i[MASK] 2008 to mark the 100th anniversary of Fleming 's birth . 
 
 = = Cancelled spin @-@ off[MASK]= = 
 
 Speculat[MASK]on arose in 2003 of a spin @-@ off fil[MASK] concentrating on Jinx , which was scheduled for a November / December 2004 release . It was originally reported that MGM was [MASK]een to set up a film series that would be a " winter olympics "[MASK]alternative to ' James Bond ' . In the late 1990s , MGM had originally consider[MASK][MASK] developi[MASK]g a [MASK]pin @-@ off [MASK]ilm based on Michelle [MASK]eoh 's character , Wai Lin , in 1997 's Tomor[MASK]ow Never Dies . However , despite much speculation of an imminent movi[MASK] , on 26 October 2003 , V[MASK]riety reported that MGM had complete[MASK]y pulled the plug on this project , to the dism[MASK]y [MASK]f Barbara Broccol[MASK] and Michael G. Wilson of Eon Entertainment , who were reported to b[MASK] " clearly furious " about the decision . MGM were keen to [MASK]nstead move on with the next film , Casino Royale . 
 
 
 = Rakie Ayola = 
 
 Rakie Olufunmilayo Ayola ( born May 1968 ) is [MASK] Welsh actress , best known for her role as Kyla Tyson in the BBC medical drama Holby Ci[MASK]y . She first rose to prominence in the lead role of the 1993 Jeanette Winterson screenplay Great Moments in Aviation . Ayola has worked in theatre ,[MASK]film and television , appearing in a number of Shakespearean theatrical performances , Hollywo[MASK]d films The i Insi[MASK]e and S[MASK]hara , and British television shows inc[MASK]udin[MASK] Soldier Soldier , EastEnders , Sea of Souls and Doctor Who . [MASK]he appeared in Holby City from its eighth to eleventh series , from 2006[MASK]to 2008 , and in 2[MASK]09 starred in the CBBC musical comedy My Almost Famous Family . 
 Ayola is an advocate of increased ethnic representation in the entertainment ind[MASK]stry , and in 2001 founded her own production c[MASK]mpany , producing the short film Persephone 's Playground for the Cannes film festival in order to further her campaign . In 2006 , Ayola w[MASK]s shortlisted for the ' Female Performance in TV ' award[MASK]in the Screen Nation Awards , receiving Honourable Men[MASK]ion in th[MASK] same category in[MASK]2007 , and a further shortlisted nomination in 2008 . [MASK]he is married to fellow actor Adam Smethurst ,[MASK]with whom she has two daughters . 
 
 = = Early life = = 
 
 Ayola was born in Cardiff [MASK] Wales in May [MASK]968 ,[MASK]to a Sierra Leonean mother and[MASK]a Nigerian father . She was raise[MASK] by he[MASK] mother 's cousin an[MASK] his wife in Ely , C[MASK]rdiff . Ayola 's heritage means she is Yoruba by descent , although she does not speak the language . Ayola stu[MASK]ied at Windsor Clive Primary and Glan E[MASK]y High School , and was a member of the Orbit Youth Theatre , South Glamorgan Youth Theatre , South Glamorgan Youth Choir and th[MASK] National Youth Theatre of Wales . She left high school b[MASK]fore[MASK]sitting her A Levels in or[MASK]e[MASK] to pursue her ambition[MASK]of be[MASK]oming an actress . She explains[MASK]: " I 've always wanted to act . I decided at 16 I wanted to make my living acting , but even if I couldn 't , I ’ d be in an amateur theatre company . " She then went on to atte[MASK]d the Roy[MASK]l Welsh College of Music and Drama , studying for a three @-@ year acting di[MASK]loma . Her first acting role was for the Welsh E[MASK]steddfod[MASK]when still at primary school , playing a lady @-@ in @-@ waiting at the court of King Arthur . Ayola ha[MASK] st[MASK]ted that it was Barbra Streisand 's performance in Hello , D[MASK]lly ! that inspired her to act as a child , though credits her adoptive mothe[MASK] with encouraging her to act profes[MASK]ionally . Ayola 's [MASK]irst job was selling jeans on Bessemer Road Market in Cardiff .[MASK]She worked as a chambermaid whilst attending drama scho[MASK]l , and , six wee[MASK]s prior to[MASK]graduation , was offered a job with the ' Made in Wales ' theatre company which enabled her to obtain her union card . 
 
 = = Career[MASK]= = 
 
 Ayola began her career in the theatre , performing in a number of Shakespearean plays including Twelfth Night [MASK] [MASK] Mid[MASK]ummer [MASK]ight 's Dream , The Tempest , The M[MASK]rchant of Venice and Macbeth . She states of this : " Shakespeare keeps coming my way . I lo[MASK]e th[MASK] fact that I get to play peopl[MASK] who are much more art[MASK]cul[MASK]te than I 'll ever be " . Ayola has performed in Twelfth Night in the lead [MASK]oles of both Olivia and Viola . She ex[MASK]lains[MASK]: " The role of Viola didn[MASK]'t sit that well with me for some reason but Olivia makes more sense . " She has also appeared in modern performances , assuming the tit[MASK]e role of Dido , Queen of Carthage[MASK]at the Globe Theatre in London in 2003 [MASK] which she described as " a dream of a part " . She has[MASK]dee[MASK]ed her dream role t[MASK] be that of Isabella in Measure for Measure , as she once lost out on the[MASK]part and would like to prove herself capable of pla[MASK]ing it . 
 Ayola 's first film appearance was in the 1993 film Great Moments in Aviation , writte[MASK] by Jeanette Winterson , in which she starred [MASK]longside Jonathan Pryce and Jo[MASK]n Hurt . Variety magazine 's Dav[MASK]d Rooney said of her performance : " In the film 's most naturalistic turn [MASK] Ayola is a c[MASK]nstant pleasure to watch . Unforced and appealing , [MASK]he often succeeds in pulling the fanciful fireworks momentarily back down to Earth . " Ayola recalls having been daunted at the prospect of work[MASK]ng alongside so many established names , but has [MASK]eemed it to have been a " wonderful experience " . Her subsequent film credits are romantic comedy The Secret Lau[MASK]hter of Women , set in Nigeria and starring Colin Firth , thriller The i Inside , filmed in Sully Hospital , Cardiff , and starring Ryan Phillippe , and Sahara , filmed in [MASK]orocco whilst Ayola was pregnant with her first child , starring Penélope Cruz . Ayola says[MASK]of her film career : " I really like doing film [ but ] I 've not done enough big films though [MASK]o really know the difference between film and television . " [MASK] Ayola 's first prolific te[MASK]evision role was in [MASK]he ITV drama Soldier Soldier , in[MASK]which she starred thr[MASK]ughout its third se[MASK]ie[MASK] in 1993 as soldier[MASK]'s wife Bernie Roberts . Ayola credits her chemistry with co @-@ star Akim [MASK]ogaji , who played her on @-@ screen[MASK]husband Luke Roberts , for winning her her au[MASK]ition [MASK] She went on to app[MASK]ar i[MASK] Gone [MASK]ith the Wind[MASK]sequ[MASK]l Scarlett , and st[MASK]r in We[MASK]sh soap opera Tiger Bay . She has spoken cri[MASK]ically of the way th[MASK] BBC treated th[MASK] soap , moving it around the schedules and de[MASK]l[MASK]ning to commission a seco[MASK]d series . She acted a[MASK]ongside Pauline Quirke in both Maisie Raine and Being April , d[MASK]eming Quirke to be a " fantastic " actress , and one sh[MASK] w[MASK]uld work alongside again " like a shot " . In 1996 , Ayola appeared at the National Theatre in Helen Edmundson 's adaptation of Leo Tolstoy 's War and Peace . In 2001 , she became a presenter of t[MASK]e BBC Wales arts programme Double Yellow , alongside poet Owen Sheers and performance [MASK]rtist Mark Rees . She posed nude but for a pair of[MASK]yellow rubber gloves to promote the show 's launch , and was highl[MASK] critical of the BBC when[MASK]the show wa[MASK] cancelled midway through its second series . She has since concluded that " the kind of audience they would like to bring in with shows like Double Yellow aren 't really into watching TV " , but at the time was out[MASK]poken against the show 's cancellation[MASK], stating : 
 Ayola 's other notable televis[MASK]on appearances include the BBC psy[MASK]hological thriller Green @-@ Eyed Monster ( 2001 ) , soap opera EastEnders ( 2001 ) , Waking the Dead ( 2001 ) , London 's Burning ( 2001 ) , Offenders ( 2002 ) , Murder [MASK]n Mind ( 2003 ) , The Canterbury Tales ( 2003 ) a[MASK]d Sea of Souls ( 2004 ) . In 2008 , she starred in the Doctor Who episode " Midnight " , playing an intergalactic Hostess[MASK]alo[MASK]gside David Tennant 's Tenth Doctor . In 2009 , Ayola starred in the CBBC musical comedy My Almost Famous Family . She stated : [MASK] The [MASK]cript made me laugh out loud when I read it . [ .[MASK]. ] I als[MASK] like the fact [MASK]hat there were a lot of politically @-@[MASK]correct boxes being[MASK]ticked , but the writers and producer haven 't been restrained by that . " So , instead of bowing to this altar , they 've said , ' Okay , we have this family that 's half @-@ black , half @-@ white , half @-@ American , half @-@ British . We have a mix of boys and girls , one character who 's mixed @-@ raced and deaf – but [MASK]e 're not going to be restrained by any of that . We 're not going to tiptoe around Martha 's di[MASK]ability or anything . ' I liked that . It wasn 't some sort of reverential hands @-@ off approach to what we 're presenting . " She has also been cast in the film Dredd . 
 
 = = = Holby City = = = 
 
 From 7 February 2006 to 9 December 2008 [MASK] Ayola starr[MASK]d in BBC medical drama Hol[MASK]y City as nurse Kyla Tyson . She had previously appeared in Holby City 's sister show Casualty [MASK] and had made an appearan[MASK]e in Holby City 's fifth series as patie[MASK]t Marianne Lawson . She was approached about returning to the[MASK]show in a more[MASK]permanent role by BBC casting director Julie Harkin . After a series of three meetings , a year a[MASK]ter the birth of her first child , she agreed to assum[MASK] the role of Kyla , despite being " nervous about signing such a long co[MASK]tract " , stating : " I 've been someone who 's lov[MASK]d the uncertainty of acting . I 've loved that one month it 's Sahara [MASK]n Morocco and [MASK]he next I 'm doing a stage play , then it 's a six @-[MASK] part telly thing . But last summer I st[MASK]rted thinking it would be really nice not to ha[MASK]e to look for a job every couple of we[MASK]ks . It would be nice just to stay put for a while . If I [MASK]m going to be a working mu[MASK] I 'd rather just be one rather t[MASK]a[MASK] be one [MASK]ntermittently . And then Holby came along , so I 'm very grateful " . 
 Ayola signed[MASK]a three @-@ [MASK]ear contract to pl[MASK]y Kyla , and described herself as " very similar " to her character , speaking pos[MASK]tively about h[MASK]r working relationship [MASK]ith co @-@ stars Jaye Jacobs and Sharon D. Clarke , as well as the " dream " storylines he[MASK] character was given . She said of t[MASK]e show : 
 " I really love Holby and I 'm surprised[MASK]how much . What thrills me abou[MASK] Holby is that you get back what you put in . The powers that be are only as interested in you as t[MASK]ey think you are in the job . For me it 's about more than turning up and saying the lines . It 's about understanding it and trying to make it better . Tha[MASK] 's actually a lot of fun . What [MASK]s great is nobody says , ' Just shut up [MASK] ' They want you to work at it . [ ... ] I surprise myself sometimes because after two [MASK]nd a half years s[MASK]metimes I see friends on the side of a poster and I think[MASK], ' do I want to do something else ? ' but [MASK] really like this[MASK]job , I never get [MASK]ha[MASK] awful ‘ dread ’ feeling when you really don [MASK] t want to go into work . [MASK] 
 In October 2008 , Ayola announced that she would be depart[MASK]ng from Holby City in o[MASK]der to have a second child[MASK], stating : " I [MASK]ve had a[MASK]great time and I 'll miss it . I made t[MASK]e dec[MASK]sion purely becau[MASK]e I was pregnant , but I wasn 't really ready to put dow[MASK] the character of Kyla . I 'm very sorry to have to let her[MASK]go . " 
 
[MASK]= = = Rac[MASK] a[MASK]d charity work = = = 
 
 Throughout her career , Ayola has been outspoken on the subject of racial discrimination in the entertainme[MASK]t indus[MASK]ry . Describing her motivation , she states : " I am not an o[MASK]e[MASK]tly political person . I just want fairness " . Ayola believ[MASK]s that[MASK]black actor[MASK] receive less recognition than thei[MASK] white counterparts , explaining ; " If you get a show with six stars and one is black you are more likely to see interviews with the five white actor[MASK] . [ ... ] They are not being sold as a reason to watch . "[MASK]She believes that her career would h[MASK]ve taken her in a different direction were she not of ethnic origin , stating : " I could not have played any of the r[MASK]les I have played[MASK]on TV if I was white [ ..[MASK] ] I am very aware of where the glass ceil[MASK]ng is and it 's still[MASK]very low and expectations are still very low " . She has noted having casting directors accept the notion of characters being both bl[MASK]ck and Welsh to be a particular problem , explaining th[MASK]t : " I get offered a lot of very different roles , but they '[MASK]e never [MASK]elsh . [ ... ] The one time I was asked to play a Welsh character on screen was in Tiger Bay for BBC Wales , but I know if that series had been called Radyr Park or Cyncoed Close I [MASK]ouldn 't have been in it " . In 2001 , Ayola founded a production company and directed a short film entitled Persephone 's Playground . She presented the fil[MASK] at the Cann[MASK]s film festival , using it as part of her[MASK]campaign for increased black re[MASK]resentation in theatre , films and television . The project , however , was largely unsuccessful , with Ayola[MASK]stating : " it just made me decide that if there 's anything I don 't want to do , it '[MASK] produce films , because I 'm rubbish at it . I[MASK]was so bad with the budget that I just said yes to everything and then had to worry about how to pay for things at the end . " In 2008 , Ayola o[MASK]fered her sup[MASK]ort to the Action [MASK]or Southern A[MASK]rica campaign Dignity ! Period , aiming to provide affordable sanitary pro[MASK]ection to Zimbabwean wo[MASK]en . 
 
 = = = Awards = = = 
 
 Ayola was[MASK]nomina[MASK]ed and shortlist[MASK]d for the ' Female Performance in TV ' awa[MASK]d in the 2006 Screen Nation A[MASK]ards , for her role as Kyla Tyso[MASK] in Holby[MASK]City . She received Honourable Mention for the same role the following year , and was shortlis[MASK]ed again in 2008 . In 2005 , WalesOnline voted Ayola the 29th sexiest woman in Wales , saying of her : " One of our favourite thesps [MASK] she 's black , beautiful and the term " yummy mummy " should have been made for her . " She placed 40th in 2008 , with the West[MASK]rn M[MASK]i[MASK] noting : " the last 15 years have only seen Rakie become more b[MASK]autiful and more successful " . Ayola placed 17th in the awards in 2009 . 
 
 = = Personal life = = 
 
 Ayola describes he[MASK]self as " optimistic , cynical , lazy , naive [ and ] hon[MASK]st " . She spends her fr[MASK]e time " watching televi[MASK]ion , the theatre , cinema , conc[MASK]rts , indoor wall climbi[MASK]g [ and ] keeping fit [ with ] yoga [ and ] aerobics " .[MASK]She has a colle[MASK]tion of Troll dolls which she keeps[MASK]under her bath . Ayola has an interest in travel , and has visited Peru [MASK]nd Kenya among other destinations . She has expressed a d[MASK]sire to visit Brazil and Argentina , [MASK]nd has " a romantic notion of travelling around Europe in a camper van " [MASK] Ayola often speaks of her pride in her Welsh u[MASK]bringing , describing herself as " an El[MASK] gir[MASK] through and [MASK]hrough " . She was made a Fellow of the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama in 2003 . 
 During a 1998 production of Hamlet , Ayola met her future husband , fellow actor Adam Smethurst – son of Love Thy Neighbour star Jack Smethurst . They met again two years later , during a production of Twelfth N[MASK]ght , and went on to become a[MASK]co[MASK]ple . T[MASK]e pair ma[MASK]ried in May [MASK]004 , and Ayola gave birth to their first daughter in July tha[MASK] year . Their second daughter was born in January 2009 .

 Ayola has undertaken th[MASK] [MASK]ollowing roles from her screen and tele[MASK]isual debut in 1993 , to the present d[MASK]y .
